recipes.title: Ginger-Onion Lo Mein
recipes.description: A savory Chinese noodle dish with fresh ginger, green onions, and oyster sauce.

ingredients.prep_note: cut into fine matchsticks, or to taste
washed, trimmed, cut into 1-inch lengths (halve the white part the long way)

instructions.text: Bring a pot of water to a rolling boil, add noodles and cook 1 or 2 minutes. Pasta should be al dente.
Drain and rinse with cool water, then drain well.
Heat oil in wok, then add ginger, the cooking wine and chicken broth, stirring all the time.
Next stir in the oyster sauce, salt, white pepper, sugar, and sesame oil.
[INFERRED] Add the drained noodles to the wok and toss to coat evenly with the sauce.
[INFERRED] Add green onions and toss briefly until just wilted.
[INFERRED] Transfer to serving plates and garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve immediately.

notes: Fresh Chinese noodles (lo mein noodles) are available in the refrigerated section of Asian grocery stores. Dried lo mein or egg noodles may be substituted.
Chinese cooking wine (Shaoxing wine) can be substituted with dry sherry.
Steps 5-7 are inferred from standard lo mein technique as the original clipping was cut off.

flags.issue: Instructions cut off in original scan - completed using standard lo mein technique

ingredients_metric.prep_note: cut into fine matchsticks, or to taste

recipes.title: Glazed Carrots
recipes.description: Simple, healthy glazed carrots with dill and a touch of brown sugar.

instructions.text: Place carrots in skillet.
Mix broth, sugar, dill and white pepper; pour over carrots.
Bring to a boil. Cook, uncovered, until liquid has evaporated and carrots are tender, about 8 minutes.
Stir in lemon juice and serve.

notes: Nutrition per serving: Calories 44, Carbohydrates 9g, Protein 2g, Cholesterol 0, Fat 0g, Sodium 167mg

recipes.title: Jubilie Jumbles
recipes.source_note: Typed recipe card (family collection) - Original recipe from Betty Crocker's Cooky Carnival booklet, circa 1955
recipes.description: Soft, cake-like cookies with walnuts, topped with a rich burnt butter glaze. A classic Carnation Evaporated Milk recipe.

instructions.text: Combine shortening, sugars, and eggs thoroughly.
Stir in evaporated milk and vanilla.
Sift flour with soda and salt, then stir into mixture.
Blend in nuts.
Refrigerate dough for 1 hour.
Heat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough 2 inches apart on greased baking sheet.
Bake about 10 minutes, until delicately browned.
While warm, frost with Burnt Butter Glaze. Garnish with walnut halves if desired.

notes: Original recipe card listed '2 tsp' butter for glaze, but canonical Carnation recipe uses 2 tablespoons. Using 2 tbsp as this produces the correct consistency.
The original card spelled it 'Jubilie' - this may be a regional/family spelling variation of 'Jubilee'.

flags.issue: Original card shows '2 tsp' but standard recipe is '2 tbsp' - using standard amount

frosting.name: Burnt Butter Glaze
frosting.instructions: Heat butter in small saucepan over medium heat until golden brown, watching carefully to prevent burning. Pour browned butter into bowl. Beat in confectioners' sugar and evaporated milk until smooth and spreadable.

recipes.title: Original Chex Party Mix
recipes.description: The classic savory snack mix with Chex cereals, nuts, pretzels, and a buttery seasoned coating.

ingredients.prep_note: or regular bagel chips, broken into 1-inch pieces

instructions.text: In large microwavable bowl, mix cereals, nuts, pretzels and bagel chips; set aside.
In small microwavable bowl, microwave butter uncovered on High about 40 seconds or until melted. Stir in seasonings.
Pour seasoned butter over cereal mixture; stir until evenly coated.
Microwave uncovered on High 5 to 6 minutes, thoroughly stirring every 2 minutes.
Spread on paper towels to cool. Store in airtight container.

recipes.pan_size: large microwavable bowl or roasting pan
notes: Duplicate card found in collection (file 471)

ingredients_metric.prep_note: or regular bagel chips, broken into 2.5cm pieces

oven_directions.text: Put cereal mixture and seasoning mixture into ungreased roasting pan.
Bake for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes.
Spread on paper towels to cool, about 15 minutes. Store in airtight container.

recipes.title: She's a Geisha Cocktail
recipes.source_note: Royal Caribbean Izumi restaurant menu card
recipes.description: Izumi's signature cocktail—refreshing and fruity, it pairs nicely with sweet and spicy signature rolls.

instructions.text: Muddle the blueberries and juices with a spoon or pestle.
Pour sake over ice in a cocktail tin and shake it all together.
Pour the contents into a glass (do not strain) and enjoy.

notes: Recipe from Royal Caribbean cruise ship Izumi restaurant
Lime cordial (like Rose's) provides sweetness - fresh lime juice with simple syrup can substitute

recipes.title: The Original Chex Party Mix
recipes.description: The classic savory snack mix - variant from 2011 box printing.

ingredients.prep_note: or regular bagel chips, broken into 1-inch pieces

instructions.text: In large microwavable bowl, mix cereals, nuts, pretzels and bagel chips; set aside. In small microwavable bowl, microwave butter uncovered on High about 40 seconds or until melted. Stir in seasonings. Pour over cereal mixture; stir until evenly coated.
Microwave uncovered on High 5 to 6 minutes, thoroughly stirring every 2 minutes. Spread on paper towels to cool. Store in airtight container.

recipes.pan_size: large microwavable bowl or roasting pan
notes: Recipe is not gluten free
This is a variant of the same recipe from a different box printing (2011)
recipes.variant_notes: Same recipe from different box printing (2011). Identical ingredients. Minor wording differences in instructions. Adds 'Recipe is not gluten free' note.

ingredients_metric.prep_note: or regular bagel chips, broken into 2.5cm pieces

oven_directions.text: Heat oven to 250°F (120°C). In ungreased large roasting pan, melt butter in oven. Stir in seasonings.
Gradually stir in remaining ingredients until evenly coated.
Spread on paper towels to cool, about 15 minutes. Store in airtight container.

recipes.title: Homemade Pizza Sauce
recipes.description: A rich, flavorful homemade pizza sauce with tomatoes, onion, and Italian seasonings.

instructions.text: Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, sugar, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes if using.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed. Use as pizza sauce or store in refrigerator for up to 1 week.

notes: Instructions inferred from standard pizza sauce technique as original clipping was incomplete.
Sauce can be frozen for up to 3 months.

flags.issue: Instructions inferred from standard technique - original incomplete

recipes.title: Challah
recipes.description: Traditional Jewish braided bread, rich with egg yolks and slightly sweet. Perfect for Shabbat or holidays.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast and 1 tsp sugar in warm water. Let stand until foamy, about 5-10 minutes.
Stir in remaining sugar, oil, egg yolks, and salt.
Gradually add flour, mixing until a soft dough forms. Knead on floured surface for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place dough in oiled bowl, turning to coat. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled, about 1 1/2 hours.
Punch down dough and divide in half. Divide each half into 3 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a rope about 12 inches long.
Braid 3 ropes together, pinching ends to seal. Place on greased baking sheet. Repeat with remaining dough.
Cover and let rise until doubled, about 45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brush loaves with beaten egg. Sprinkle with sesame or poppy seeds if desired.
Bake 30-35 minutes until golden brown and hollow-sounding when tapped. Cool on wire rack.

notes: Using mostly egg yolks gives this challah an especially rich, golden color.
For a shinier crust, brush with egg wash twice - once before rising and once just before baking.

recipes.title: French Toast with Lemon Sauce
recipes.description: Classic French toast served with a warm, sweet lemon sauce flavored with cinnamon and nutmeg.

instructions.text: In a shallow bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, vanilla, and salt.
Heat butter in a large skillet or griddle over medium heat.
Dip bread slices in egg mixture, coating both sides. Let excess drip off.
Cook until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Serve warm with Lemon Sauce.

notes: Day-old bread works best as it absorbs the egg mixture without falling apart.
Brioche or challah make especially rich French toast.

frosting.name: Lemon Sauce
frosting.instructions: In a small saucepan, whisk together sugar and cornstarch. Gradually stir in water until smooth. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and boils. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice, zest, butter, cinnamon, and nutmeg until butter melts. Serve warm over French toast.

recipes.title: Whole Wheat Bread
recipes.description: Hearty homemade whole wheat bread with honey and nonfat dry milk.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine warm water, yeast, and honey. Let stand until foamy, about 5-10 minutes.
Stir in dry milk, salt, and oil.
Add whole wheat flour and stir until combined.
Gradually add bread flour until a soft dough forms. Knead on floured surface for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place dough in oiled bowl, turning to coat. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled, about 1 1/2 hours.
Punch down dough and divide in half. Shape each half into a loaf and place in greased 9x5-inch loaf pans.
Cover and let rise until dough reaches top of pans, about 45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Bake 35-40 minutes until golden brown and hollow-sounding when tapped. Remove from pans and cool on wire rack.

notes: Nonfat dry milk adds protein and helps create a softer crumb.
For a softer crust, brush tops with melted butter immediately after baking.

recipes.title: French Bread
recipes.description: Classic crusty French bread with a chewy interior.

ingredients.prep_note: beaten with 1 tbsp water, for wash

instructions.text: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let stand until foamy, about 5-10 minutes.
Stir in salt.
Gradually add flour, mixing until a soft dough forms. Knead on floured surface for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place dough in oiled bowl, turning to coat. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.
Punch down dough and divide in half. Roll each half into a 15x10-inch rectangle. Starting from long side, roll up tightly, pinching seams to seal.
Place seam-side down on baking sheet dusted with cornmeal. Cover and let rise until doubled, about 45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Place a shallow pan of hot water on lowest oven rack to create steam.
Using a sharp knife, make 3-4 diagonal slashes across top of each loaf. Brush with egg white wash.
Bake 25-30 minutes until deep golden brown and hollow-sounding when tapped. Cool on wire rack.

notes: The pan of water creates steam for a crispy crust.
Original recipe had salt listed twice - confirmed correct amount is 1 tablespoon total.

flags.issue: Original had duplicate salt listing - confirmed 1 tbsp total is correct per standard French bread ratios

recipes.title: Tomato Basil Topping
recipes.description: Fresh tomato and basil topping, perfect for bruschetta or as a bread accompaniment.

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine diced tomatoes, basil, and garlic.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Season with salt and pepper, toss gently to combine.
Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Serve on toasted bread slices or as a topping for grilled meats.

notes: Best made with ripe summer tomatoes.
Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days; bring to room temperature before serving.

recipes.title: Chicken Andouille Gumbo
recipes.description: Hearty Southern gumbo with chicken and andouille sausage, featuring a rich dark roux and the holy trinity of Cajun cooking.

instructions.text: Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper. In a large Dutch oven, brown chicken in 2 tablespoons of the oil over medium-high heat. Remove and set aside.
Add remaining oil to pot. Gradually whisk in flour to make a roux. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until roux is dark chocolate brown, 25-35 minutes. Do not let it burn.
Add onion, celery, and bell pepper (the 'holy trinity'). Cook until vegetables are softened, about 10 minutes.
Add garlic and cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in tomatoes, chicken broth, bay leaves, thyme, cayenne, and black pepper.
Return chicken to pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes.
Remove chicken pieces. When cool enough to handle, shred meat and discard bones and skin.
Add andouille sausage to pot and cook 15 minutes.
Return shredded chicken to pot. Add okra and cook 15 minutes more until okra is tender.
Remove bay leaves. Adjust seasoning with salt and cayenne if needed.
Serve over hot cooked rice. Sprinkle with file powder at the table if desired.

notes: The key to great gumbo is a dark roux - be patient and don't rush this step.
File powder (ground sassafras leaves) thickens the gumbo - never add it during cooking as it becomes stringy. Add only at serving.
Pork andouille sausage provides authentic Cajun flavor.

recipes.title: Ragú Veggie No Boiling Lasagna
recipes.source_note: Ragú Old World Style Pasta Sauce product recipe card
recipes.description: A vegetable-loaded lasagna using no-boil noodles for easy preparation.

ingredients.prep_note: cut in half lengthwise and thinly sliced

ingredients.item: Ragú Old World Style Pasta Sauce

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. In 12-inch nonstick skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat and cook onion, red bell pepper and zucchini, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes or until softened.
Meanwhile, in medium bowl, combine ricotta cheese, 1 cup mozzarella cheese, 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese and eggs.
In 13x9-inch baking dish, spread 1 cup Pasta Sauce. Layer 4 uncooked noodles, then 1 cup Sauce, half of the ricotta mixture and half of the vegetables; repeat.
Top with remaining uncooked noodles and 2 cups Sauce. Reserve remaining Sauce.
Cover tightly with aluminum foil and bake 1 hour.
Remove foil and sprinkle with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses. Bake uncovered 10 minutes.
Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Serve with reserved Pasta Sauce, heated.

notes: No-boil lasagna noodles absorb liquid from the sauce during baking.
Can substitute any Ragú pasta sauce variety.

recipes.title: Fat-Free Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
recipes.source_note: The Tampa Tribune (Jeff Houck recipe column)
recipes.description: A lighter version of the classic using cake mix with applesauce instead of oil.

instructions.text: Mix sugar, corn syrup and lemon juice and pour into a 9-by-13-inch pan coated with cooking spray.
Arrange drained crushed pineapple and cherries over the brown sugar mix.
Prepare cake mix according to instructions on box using egg beaters and applesauce and water, or pineapple juice in place of the water.
Pour over the brown sugar mix.
Bake for 43 minutes at 350 degrees.
Cool for 5 minutes and invert onto serving tray.

notes: Using applesauce in place of oil makes this virtually fat-free.
Can use pineapple juice instead of water for extra pineapple flavor.

recipes.title: Val's Pineapple Upside Down Cake
recipes.source_note: The Tampa Tribune (Jeff Houck recipe column)
recipes.description: A from-scratch pineapple upside-down cake baked in a cast iron skillet.

ingredients.prep_note: if cubed or crushed, drain thoroughly and save juice

instructions.text: Melt butter in 10- to 12-inch Teflon skillet that can go in the oven (the heavier the better).
Sprinkle brown sugar on butter and pat down until bottom of pan is covered. Lay in pineapple slices and cherries.
Separate egg whites and beat until firm.
In separate bowl, beat egg yolks, flour, sugar, baking powder and pineapple juice. Fold in egg white mixture by hand until all gone.
Pour mixture in pan on top of brown sugar, butter and pineapple.
Bake at 350 degrees for 45 to 50 minutes until done.

notes: A heavy cast iron or oven-safe nonstick skillet works best.
The beaten egg whites make this cake especially light and fluffy.

recipes.title: Nana's Broccoli Salad
recipes.description: A beautiful and tasty broccoli salad with grapes, bacon, and a sweet mayonnaise dressing.

instructions.text: Mix broccoli, grapes, raisins, onions, almonds and bacon. (Can be mixed ahead of time).
Just before serving, mix mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar and pour "dressing" over salad mixture.
Stir well.
Makes a beautiful and very tasty salad.

notes: Salad ingredients can be mixed ahead; add dressing just before serving.
Original card has festive candy cane border - likely a holiday favorite.
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 33.jpeg

recipes.title: Cheesecake Brownies
recipes.description: Rich brownies topped with a creamy cheesecake layer and chocolate swirl.

instructions.text: Bake brownie mix in 9x13 inch pan at 350°, bake only 15 minutes following package directions.
Meanwhile, beat sugar, sour cream, vanilla & softened cream cheese in mixing bowl using mixer (med. speed).
Add 1 egg at a time, mixing after each egg (at low speed), blending evenly.
Pour over brownie batter, filling will come almost to top of pan.
Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.
After cooling, swirl melted chocolate over brownies, let stand till chocolate firm.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hrs.
Cut into 16 squares and leave at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before serving.

notes: The brownie layer is only partially baked before adding cheesecake layer.
Must refrigerate at least 4 hours for clean cutting.

recipes.title: Pirogs
recipes.description: Savory bacon and onion filled yeast rolls, a family favorite.

instructions.text: Sprinkle yeast on warm water.
Add sugar, salt, and milk. Let stand a few minutes and stir.
Mix in half the flour.
Add egg and oil, then the rest of the flour.
Knead well and place in a greased bowl. Let rise until double.
Make into rolls and double again.
Brown bacon and onion for the filling.
After dough rises twice, fill each roll with bacon mixture and knead together.
Brush top with egg wash.
Bake 10 to 15 minutes at 400 degrees.

notes: Also known as pirozhki in Russian cuisine.
Can be made with various fillings - this version uses bacon and onion.

recipes.title: German Potato Dumplings
recipes.description: Traditional German potato dumplings (Kartoffelklöße) served with gravy.

instructions.text: Boil potatoes with the skins on.
Let the potatoes cool, then skin and grate.
Add the rest of ingredients and mix well.
Form into balls, drop into boiling water and simmer for 20 minutes.
Take potato balls out with a slotted spoon.
Serve with gravy.

notes: Use starchy potatoes like Russets for best results.
Dumplings are done when they float to the surface.

recipes.title: Golden Green Bean Casserole
recipes.source_note: Publix Apron's recipe card (©2008 Publix Super Markets, Inc.)
recipes.description: A quick and easy green bean casserole with mushroom soup and French-fried onions.

ingredients.item: Sargento Fancy Shredded Sharp Cheddar Cheese

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Microwave beans in package on HIGH for 4-5 minutes or until hot. Transfer beans to medium bowl.
Stir in fresh onions and soup until blended. Transfer mixture to 2-quart baking dish.
Top evenly with cheese, then French-fried onions.
Bake 10-15 minutes or until cheese melts, top is browned, and mixture bubbles around edges of the dish. Serve.

notes: Shortcuts and Tips: Don't rinse the pan between cooking the pork and the mushroom sauce. The browned bits in the pan will add extra flavor to the sauce.
Original card appears to be part of a larger meal featuring pork.

recipes.title: Chili Tortilla Bake
recipes.description: A layered Tex-Mex casserole with seasoned ground beef, beans, corn, and cheese.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. In a large skillet, brown ground beef over medium-high heat; drain.
Add tomato sauce, beans, corn and green chilies. Stir in next five (5) seasonings. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, 15 minutes.
In a 2-quart baking dish, coated with cooking spray, place 3 flour tortillas to cover bottom. Overlap as needed.
Layer with half of chili mixture and half of cheese. Top with remaining tortillas, meat mixture and cheese.
Bake 30 minutes. Serves 8.

notes: Can substitute any brand of spices for McCormick.
Top with sour cream, guacamole, or salsa if desired.
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 37.jpeg

recipes.title: Hot Chicken Salad
recipes.source_note: Sweet Sue Premium Chicken product recipe card
recipes.description: A warm, creamy chicken casserole topped with potato chips and cheese.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix all ingredients except topping ingredients and place in casserole dish.
Mix topping ingredients (potato chips and cheese) and place on top of Sweet Sue Chicken mixture.
Place small pats of butter or margarine on top of casserole.
Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.

notes: Can substitute water chestnuts for almonds for a different texture.
Any canned or pouch chicken can be substituted for Sweet Sue brand.

recipes.title: Calamondin Cake
recipes.source_note: Newspaper clipping (Sweet Spiced Calamondins feature, Times 30 years ago)
recipes.description: A moist citrus cake using calamondin puree with a tangy lemon glaze.

instructions.text: Combine cake mix and gelatin. Add milk and mix. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each.
In a small bowl, combine puree, oil and extract. Add these slowly to batter, beating at low speed.
Pour into greased and floured 9- by 13-inch cake pan or Bundt pan.
Bake at 350 degrees (325 degrees for tube pan) for 1 hour, or until it tests done.
Immediately prick top of cake with fork and spread glaze on hot cake.
Glaze: Combine all glaze ingredients. Spread on hot cake.
To make calamondin puree: Wash fruit well; halve and seed; process in blender or food processor until pureed.

notes: Calamondins are small citrus fruits common in Florida gardens.
If calamondins are unavailable, substitute equal parts lime and orange juice.
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 952.jpeg

recipes.title: Sweet Spiced Calamondins
recipes.source_note: Newspaper clipping - Calamondin Pineapple Preserves feature
recipes.description: Whole spiced calamondins preserved in a sweet syrup, perfect for gifting.

instructions.text: Wash fruit thoroughly. Make a small slit crosswise. Cover with water and bring to a boil; cook 10 minutes; drain.
Make a syrup of sugar, vinegar and water; bring to a boil.
Drop in spices tied in a small clean cloth; cook 5 minutes.
Remove spice bag. Add fruit; cook 10 minutes and let stand overnight to allow fruit to plump.
Bring to a boil and cook until syrup is thick.
Pack hot into hot canning jars, leaving 1/4-inch head space. Adjust caps.
Process 10 minutes in boiling water bath.

notes: These make excellent holiday gifts.
The overnight standing allows the fruit to absorb the syrup and plump up.
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 952.jpeg

recipes.title: Calamondin Pineapple Preserves
recipes.attribution: Lorraine Hottenroth of New Port Richey, Marjorie Rosquist of Holiday, Etea Stasionis of Largo, Gladys Griessner, Lois Kelly of St. Petersburg
recipes.description: A tropical preserve combining calamondins with crushed pineapple and maraschino cherries.

instructions.text: Put all ingredients except pectin into large pot. Bring rapidly to a boil, stirring constantly.
Boil 1 minute. Add pectin; remove from heat; cool 7 minutes, stirring several times.
Ladle into hot, sterilized jars to within 1/8-inch of jar top. Wipe jar rims.
Adjust lids and process in boiling water bath 5 minutes.

notes: Multiple Florida contributors shared versions of this recipe.
The cherries add festive color for holiday giving.

recipes.title: Calamondin Liqueur
recipes.attribution: Esther Vonhof of Largo, Marjorie Rosquist of Holiday, Gladys Griessner of St. Petersburg
recipes.description: A homemade citrus liqueur made by infusing calamondins in vodka.

ingredients.prep_note: carefully picked, stems removed, thoroughly washed

instructions.text: Put vodka and sugar in a glass jar with a flat, tight, screw top and stir to dissolve as well as possible.
Add calamondins; seal jar tightly and leave on counter top (upright).
Next day, invert jar. Repeat, alternating positions of jar for 30 days.
Open jar, remove fruit. Enjoy.

notes: The daily inverting helps distribute the sugar and extract flavor evenly.
Makes an excellent holiday gift.

recipes.title: Calamondin Nut Bread
recipes.description: A moist quick bread with citrus flavor from dried calamondins, raisins and nuts.

instructions.text: Wash and dry calamondins; remove seeds and grind. This makes about 3/4 cup. Add sugar and set aside.
Sift together flour, salt, soda, cloves and cinnamon.
Cream together shortening, brown sugar and eggs; add calamondin mixture, then dry ingredients.
Add raisins and nuts. Pour into greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350 degrees 30-35 minutes or until bread tests done. Keeps well-frozen.

notes: Esther Vonhof usually doubles the recipe.
Freezes well for later use.

recipes.title: German Chocolate Cheese Pie
recipes.source_note: Cereal box recipe card (Mornin' Gems Corn Flakes)
recipes.description: A no-bake chocolate cheesecake pie with a corn flake crust, topped with whipped topping.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300°. Butter 9-inch pie plate.
Combine Corn Flake crumbs and brown sugar. Add butter. Mix thoroughly. Press evenly onto bottom and sides of pie plate.
Bake 10 minutes. Cool.
Heat water and chocolate in small saucepan over low heat until chocolate is just melted. Stir constantly. Let cool 10 to 15 minutes.
In large bowl of electric mixer beat cream cheese and sugar. Add vanilla and salt.
Slowly beat chocolate into cheese mixture. Refrigerate 1 hour or until very thick.
Fold in whipped topping. Turn into crust.
Freeze 4 hours or overnight. To serve, set pie plate in warm water for 1 minute before cutting.

notes: Measure and crush cereal in glass measure.
Must freeze at least 4 hours for proper texture.

recipes.title: Old Fashioned Cheesecake
recipes.source_note: Gold Label product recipe card (graham cracker crust lid)
recipes.description: A classic baked cheesecake with a sour cream topping, served with fresh fruit.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F.
In bowl, combine cream cheese, sugar, lemon juice, vanilla and salt. Mix until well blended.
Add eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
Place crust on baking sheet; pour in filling.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until inserted knife comes out clean.
Topping: Combine 1 cup sour cream, 2 tablespoons sugar and 1/4 teaspoon vanilla. Carefully spread over pie.
Continue baking 10 minutes; cool.
Chill 3 hours. Top with fresh fruit or canned fruit filling.

notes: To keep pie fresh after preparation, place inverted plastic lid over pie and crimp foil edge down to hold lid in place.
Chilling time is essential for proper texture.

recipes.title: BBQ Meatballs
recipes.description: Easy crockpot meatballs in a sweet and tangy BBQ sauce.

instructions.text: Blend all ingredients except meatballs.
Add to meatballs in crock pot and heat thoroughly, mixing occasionally.

notes: Perfect for parties and potlucks.
Can use any type of frozen meatballs.

recipes.title: One on One Casserole
recipes.description: A simple ground beef and rice casserole with creamy mushroom soup.

instructions.text: Crumble meat in 2 1/2 qt. casserole.
Sprinkle rice and dry soup mix over meat.
Blend soup and water, and pour all over.
Cover and bake at 350-degrees for 45 minutes to one hour.

notes: A true one-dish meal - no precooking required.
The rice cooks in the liquid during baking.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Bread
recipes.description: A simple quick bread with peanut butter flavor, perfect for toast or sandwiches.

instructions.text: Sift dry ingredients together.
Blend in butter and peanut butter until it resembles coarse meal.
Beat eggs and milk together. Combine mixture.
Spoon into a 9 x 5 x 3 loaf pan.
Bake at 350-degrees for one hour.
Cool for 10 minutes.

notes: Great toasted with jam.
Use creamy peanut butter for best texture.

recipes.title: Latkes
recipes.description: Traditional Jewish potato pancakes, crispy on the outside and tender inside.

instructions.text: Squeeze excess water from potatoes. Put in a bowl with lemon.
Beat eggs lightly. Add onion, beaten eggs, matzo meal, salt and pepper. Mix.
Heat 1/4 cup oil in a pan.
Drop potato mixture by tablespoons. Fry until brown.
Drain (keep warm in oven). Repeat.

notes: Traditional for Hanukkah celebrations.
Serve with applesauce and sour cream.
The lemon juice prevents the potatoes from browning.

recipes.title: Shrimp Scampi
recipes.description: Classic garlic butter shrimp served over noodles or rice.

instructions.text: Melt butter and oil together in a sauté pan. Add garlic; sauté for one minute, then add shrimp.
Cook for 1 minute; add wine, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Cook and stir until shrimp turns pink and sauce thickens. Do not overcook.
Sprinkle with parsley; garnish with lemon wedges. Serve over noodles or rice, if desired.

notes: Do not overcook shrimp - they cook quickly.
Can substitute any raw shrimp for Fisherman's Wharf brand.

recipes.title: Cajun Fried Catfish
recipes.description: Crispy Southern-style fried catfish with Cajun seasonings.

ingredients.item: Zatarain's Crispy Southern Style Fish Fri

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, blend together mustard and buttermilk; set aside.
Pour Fish Fri into a shallow pan.
Dip catfish fillets in buttermilk mixture and then coat evenly with Fish Fri. Place breaded fillets into preheated oil (350°F) and fry until golden brown. Turn once.
Serve fish with coleslaw and Southern Pride Catfish brand Hushpuppies, if desired.

notes: Most domestic catfish are harvested in Alabama, Louisiana, Mississippi and other Southern states.
Can substitute any white fish fillets.

recipes.title: Fish Steaks with Herbed Vegetable Confetti
recipes.source_note: Reynolds Hot Bags Foil Bag recipe booklet
recipes.description: Fish steaks baked en papillote style in foil bags with colorful vegetables.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 450°F OR grill to medium-high. Place bag in a 1-inch deep pan. Spray inside of bag with nonstick spray.

Arrange fish steaks in bag in an even layer. Sprinkle fish steaks with half of thyme. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Combine remaining thyme, vegetables, cheese and oil. Spoon mixture over fish steaks. To seal, double fold open end of bag.

Leave bag in pan and place in oven OR slide bag onto grill. Bake 25 to 30 minutes OR grill 12 to 14 minutes in covered grill. Use oven mitts and a knife to cut bag open. Fold back top for steam to escape.

notes: The French call this technique 'en papillote' - cooking inside a sealed packet.
Can use regular aluminum foil instead of Reynolds bags.

recipes.title: Broiled Swordfish with Tomato
recipes.description: Swordfish steaks broiled with a Dijon-Parmesan sauce and fresh tomato-basil topping.

instructions.text: Preheat broiler. Line a baking sheet with foil.

Make sauce by mixing together mustard, lemon juice, olive oil, Parmesan cheese, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Place the swordfish steaks on the prepared baking sheet and brush them lightly with half the sauce.

Broil fish 4 inches from heat until opaque, about 3 to 4 minutes. Stir tomato and basil into reserved sauce. Turn fish; top with sauce. Broil 3 to 4 minutes more or until fish flakes when tested with a fork.

notes: Swordfish is most commonly sold as a steak with the skin on.
Can substitute other firm fish like mahi-mahi or tuna.

recipes.title: Southern Crab Cakes with Herb Sauce
recipes.description: Pan-fried crab cakes served with a fresh dill and herb mayonnaise sauce.

instructions.text: In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, dill, parsley, chives, juice and mustard. Refrigerate herb sauce until ready to serve crab cakes.
In a medium bowl mix crabmeat, melted butter, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper and 1 egg. Mold crabmeat mixture into small cakes; set aside.

Beat 1 tablespoon water into the remaining egg; dip crab cakes into egg and water mixture. Dredge crab cakes in breadcrumbs. Sauté crab cakes in hot oil in frying pan over medium heat until golden brown. Serve with herb sauce.

notes: Can be made ahead - refrigerate sauce and uncooked patties up to 24 hours in advance.
A made-from-scratch sauce is a special touch, but store-bought tartar sauce works too.

recipes.title: Salmon with Roasted Red Pepper Salsa
recipes.description: Grilled salmon topped with a fresh roasted red pepper and balsamic salsa.

instructions.text: Preheat grill to medium-high. Skewer onion and pepper slices halfway through with a toothpick or short metal skewer. Brush pepper and onion slices with oil. Grill vegetables cut-side up about 10 minutes or until pepper skins are blistered and onion is tender. Remove vegetables, wrap in foil and let cool 10 minutes.
Sprinkle salmon portions with pepper. Place fish on a greased grill rack. Grill over medium heat for 5 minutes per half inch of thickness, turning once.
Meanwhile, for the salsa, unwrap vegetables and peel skin off peppers. Finely chop peppers and onion. Combine with balsamic vinegar and cilantro. Season to taste with pepper.
Serve salmon topped with salsa.

notes: The salsa can be made ahead and refrigerated.
Can also broil the salmon instead of grilling.

recipes.title: Parmesan Baked Fish Packets
recipes.source_note: Reynolds Wrap Release Non-Stick Aluminum Foil recipe
recipes.description: Fish fillets baked in foil packets with vegetables and Parmesan cheese.

ingredients.item: Reynolds Wrap Release Non-Stick Aluminum Foil
orange roughy, cod or sole fillets

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 450°F OR grill to medium-high.
Center one fish fillet on the non-stick (dull) side of each sheet of foil. Spread fillets with mayonnaise. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and cayenne pepper. Top with vegetables.
Bring up foil sides. Double fold top and ends to seal packet, leaving room for heat circulation inside. Repeat to make four packets.
Bake 18 to 22 minutes on a cookie sheet in oven OR grill 10 to 12 minutes in covered grill.

notes: Foil packets make for easy cleanup.
Can substitute any mild white fish.

recipes.title: Wild Orange Pie
recipes.description: A creamy citrus pie with fluffy meringue topping, inspired by Florida's wild orange trees.

instructions.text: Blend first 3 ingredients together until thick. Pour into prepared pie crust.
Top with meringue and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until meringue is golden brown.
Meringue: Whip egg whites until they stand in peaks. Add cream of tartar. Slowly add sugar and beat. Spread over pie.

notes: Raye Bailey and his wife bake 100 a week from Nov. 1 to Memorial Day.
Sour orange juice can be found in Latin grocery stores, or substitute 1/4 cup each lime and orange juice.

recipes.title: Rotini Salad Bowl
recipes.description: A classic pasta salad with ham or shrimp, peas, and cheddar cheese.

instructions.text: Cook Del Pino's rotini according to directions above. Drain, do not chill.
While still hot, drizzle with oil and vinegar. Add onion, seasonings, and cheese; toss well.
Gently mix in remaining ingredients. Chill thoroughly. Serve on salad greens.

notes: Del Pino's cooking instructions: Pour 2 cups of rotini in 2 quarts of rapidly boiling water. Add 2 teaspoons of salt if desired. Boil 8 to 10 minutes until tender.
Can use any spiral pasta.

recipes.title: Popeye's Classic Spinach Dip
recipes.description: A creamy spinach dip with water chestnuts and vegetable soup mix.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients until well blended.
Cover and chill for several hours before serving.
Serve with raw vegetables, chips, or crackers.

notes: Can use low fat sour cream and mayonnaise.
Makes about 4 cups of dip.

recipes.title: Zesty Italian Chicken
recipes.description: A quick one-skillet chicken dish with mushrooms, peppers, and marinara sauce.

ingredients.item: boneless chicken breasts or pork chops

instructions.text: Brown chicken in hot oil in skillet. Transfer to plate.
Add vegetables to skillet and cook 3 min.
Stir in marinara sauce and Worcestershire. Return chicken to skillet. Cover; simmer 5 min. until chicken is cooked.

notes: One skillet recipe - easy cleanup.
Can substitute pork chops for chicken.

recipes.title: Microwave Fries
recipes.source_note: Reynolds Microwave Wrap Non-Stick Cooking Paper box
recipes.description: Quick seasoned potato wedges cooked in the microwave with Parmesan cheese.

instructions.text: Place a sheet of Reynolds Microwave Wrap on a microwave-safe plate; set aside.
In a medium bowl, mix garlic salt, paprika, pepper and oil. Cut each potato quarter into 4 or 5 thin wedges. Toss potato wedges in spice mixture until evenly coated.
Arrange potato wedges, cut-side down, on microwave cooking paper-lined plate. Sprinkle potato wedges evenly with Parmesan cheese.
Microwave at HIGH for 5 to 7 minutes or until potatoes are tender, rotating dish once. Let stand 1 minute. Serve immediately.

notes: Quick alternative to oven fries.
Rotate dish halfway through for even cooking.

recipes.title: Hearty Chicken & Noodle Casserole
recipes.description: A creamy comfort food casserole featuring chicken, egg noodles, and vegetables in a mushroom soup base, topped with melted cheddar.

ingredients.prep_note: Regular, 98% Fat Free, or 25% Less Sodium

instructions.text: Stir soup, milk, vegetables, chicken, noodles, Parmesan cheese and black pepper in 1 1/2-qt. casserole.
Bake at 400°F for 25 min. or until hot. Stir.
Top with Cheddar cheese.

notes: Try It Alfredo: Use broccoli instead of vegetables and replace Cheddar cheese with Parmesan. Bake for 5 min. more.
Use Your Noodle: Use 2 cups cooked elbow macaroni for noodles. Replace Parmesan with 1/4 cup shredded Cheddar cheese stirred into soup mixture. Top with 1/4 cup additional Cheddar cheese.

recipes.title: Chicken Soup As Good As Grandma's
recipes.source_note: Swanson Chicken Broth product recipe card
recipes.description: A simple, comforting chicken noodle soup made with Swanson broth, tender vegetables, and extra wide egg noodles.

ingredients.prep_note: Regular, Natural Goodness, or Certified Organic

instructions.text: Heat broth, pepper, carrot and celery in 2-qt. saucepan over medium-high heat to a boil.
Stir in noodles and chicken. Reduce heat to medium. Cook for 10 min. or until noodles are tender.

notes: Swanson Sensational Chicken Noodle Soup
The secret is Swanson Broth.

recipes.title: Crispy Herb Baked Chicken
recipes.description: Crispy baked chicken coated in seasoned potato flakes with Parmesan cheese and herbs.

ingredients.prep_note: cut up, skinned, rinsed, patted dry

instructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F. Grease or line with foil 15x10x1-inch baking pan or 13x9-inch pan.
In medium bowl, combine potato flakes, Parmesan cheese, parsley flakes, onion powder, garlic salt, paprika and pepper; stir until well mixed.
Dip chicken pieces into margarine; roll in potato flake mixture to coat.
Place in greased pan. Bake at 375°F for 45 to 60 minutes or until chicken is tender and golden brown.

notes: Skinning the chicken reduces fat and allows coating to adhere better.
Can use bone-in or boneless chicken pieces - adjust cooking time accordingly.

ingredients_metric.prep_note: cut up, skinned, rinsed, patted dry

recipes.title: Ginger-Lime Chicken Stir-Fry
recipes.description: A bright and healthy stir-fry with chicken tenders, napa cabbage, broccoli, and a ginger-lime-soy sauce.

instructions.text: Cook 1 lb. broccoli florets in boiling water 3 min.; drain.
In skillet over high heat, cook chicken in oil 4 min. Add cabbage and pepper.
Cover; cook 4 min. more.
In bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Stir soy sauce mixture and broccoli into chicken. Cook 1 min.

notes: Health tip: Bell peppers are at the top of the list for beta carotene, an antioxidant orange pigment that may prevent night blindness.
Can substitute regular cabbage for napa cabbage.

recipes.title: Brownies (Low Cost)
recipes.description: Classic fudgy brownies made with unsweetened baking chocolate, perfect for a budget-friendly treat.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F. Line an 8- or 9-inch square baking pan with foil, letting ends extend above pan on opposite sides. Coat foil with nonstick spray.
Melt butter and chocolate in a medium saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly. Off heat, add sugar; stir then add eggs, 1 at a time. Stir in vanilla and flour.
Spread in prepared pan. Bake 25 to 30 minutes until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out with moist crumbs attached.
Cool in pan on a wire rack. Lift foil by ends to cutting board. Cut in 16 squares.

notes: Store airtight at cool room temperature up to 3 days. In Rocky Road variation, drizzle Glaze. Day of serving: FYI: These are darker, fudgier than most.

recipes.title: Peanut Lovers' Brownies
recipes.description: Fudgy brownies topped with chocolate-covered peanuts, peanut butter cups, and M&M's for the ultimate peanut lover.

instructions.text: Prepare Brownies through Step 3. Stir 1/2 cup chopped unsalted peanuts into batter.
Distribute milk chocolate-covered peanuts over top, press gently until level with top of batter.
Sprinkle with 1/2 cup peanut butter M&M's and 2 tbsp chopped peanuts. Bake as directed.
Immediately after removing from oven, press peanut butter cup pieces (quarters) into top of brownies. Cool and cut.

notes: Variation of the Low Cost Brownies recipe.
For best results, use the batter from Low Cost Brownies as the base.
recipes.variant_notes: Peanut-topped variation of the base brownie recipe

recipes.title: Chocolate Chunk Cookies
recipes.source_note: Magazine clipping (noting original Toll House cookie was created by Ruth Wakefield in 1933)
recipes.description: Classic chocolate chunk cookies with semisweet chocolate and a buttery, chewy texture.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F.
Beat all ingredients except flour and chocolate chunks in a large bowl with mixer on medium speed until blended, scraping down sides of bowl occasionally, until well blended.
Stir in remaining ingredients. Drop rounded tablespoons of dough 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes until browned at edges. Cool on sheet on a wire rack 2 minutes before removing to rack to cool completely.

notes: The original Toll House cookie was created by Ruth Wakefield in 1933.
Refrigerate dough 1 hour to 1 week at room temperature.
For best results, refrigerate dough 1 hour or up to 3 days before baking.

recipes.title: Carrot Cake (Low Fat)
recipes.description: A lighter carrot cake made with shredded carrots and topped with orange cream cheese frosting decorated to look like carrots.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F. Coat two 8- or 9-inch round cake pans with nonstick spray.
Cake: Put first 5 ingredients in a large bowl; stir to blend. Make a well in center; add oil and eggs. Beat with mixer on medium speed until blended.
Reduce mixer to low; add carrots, pineapple, and nuts. Beat on low, scraping bowl occasionally, until well blended. Stir in remaining ingredients.
Divide between pans, spread evenly. Bake 35 to 40 minutes until a wooden pick inserted in centers comes out clean.
To frost: Place 1 cake layer, top side down, on serving plate. Spread 1/2 cup frosting. Top with second layer. Spread remaining frosting over top and sides. Pat sides with chopped nuts.

To decorate (see Tips, left): Briefly warm bags of frosting between hands. Use orange frosting to pipe 12 carrots on cake. Snip a tiny upside-down V in bottom corner of bag with green frosting; pipe carrot tops. Serve immediately.

notes: Planning Tip: Bake cake and make frosting up to 2 days ahead. Wrap layers separately; store frosting airtight. Refrigerate both. Reheat frosting to soften.
Frosting recipe on original clipping for cream cheese frosting with orange and green food coloring for decoration.

recipes.title: New York-Style Cheesecake
recipes.description: A classic dense and creamy New York-style cheesecake with graham cracker crust, topped with fresh raspberries.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F. Coat bottom and sides of an 8- or 9-in. springform pan with nonstick spray.
Crust: Mix ingredients in a small bowl; firmly press over bottom of pan.

Filling: Mix sugar and cornstarch in a large bowl. Add cream cheese; beat with mixer on medium speed until smooth. Beat in eggs and vanilla, scraping down sides of bowl as needed. On low speed, add cream; beat just to blend. Pour into pan.

Bake 55 to 60 minutes until cake has risen, edges are very lightly browned and center still jiggles when pan is moved. Cool in pan on a wire rack about 1 1/2 hours (cake will set completely). Run knife around edge of pan. Cover pan loosely; refrigerate at least 4 hours.
Up to 1 hour before serving: Remove pan sides. Garnish with raspberries.

notes: How long have people loved this tart? A Roman variation appears in Cato, circa 2 B.C.
Planning Tip: Prepare through Step 4 up to 3 days ahead.
Total cost: $9.67

recipes.title: Rogers Corned Venison
recipes.description: Traditional corned venison using a pickling brine with Morton's Tender Quick, simmered until tender.

instructions.text: Roll meat and tie in bag (or place in large roasting bag).
Combine water, pickling salt, Tender Quick, sugar, pickle spice, bay leaf, peppercorns, and garlic. Pour over meat in bag.
Put in oven glass pan. Refrigerate 4-5 days, turning meat daily.
Rinse in cold water. Cover meat with cold water, bring to boil, then drain.
Add fresh water and simmer to tender, 3-4 hours.

recipes.pan_size: large roasting bag and glass pan
notes: Morton's Tender Quick is a curing salt - do not substitute regular salt.
Turning meat daily ensures even curing.
Can be served hot or cold, sliced thin.

flags.issue: Handwritten recipe - some portions slightly difficult to read but complete

recipes.title: Crunchy Onion Chicken
recipes.description: Simple baked chicken breasts coated in crushed French fried onions for a crispy, flavorful crust.

instructions.text: Crush French Fried Onions in plastic bag.
Dip chicken into egg; then coat in onion crumbs.
Bake 20 minutes at 400°F until cooked through.

notes: In any recipe, simply replace breadcrumbs with crushed French Fried Onions.
Can also be used for pork chops or fish fillets.

recipes.title: Turkey Pot Pie
recipes.description: A homemade turkey pot pie with flaky yeast crust, perfect for using leftover turkey.

instructions.text: In large bowl, combine 1 cup flour, sugar, salt, and undissolved yeast.
Heat water, milk, and butter until very warm (120-130°F). Gradually add to dry ingredients; beat 2 minutes at medium speed.
Add egg and 1/2 cup flour; beat 2 minutes at high speed. Stir in enough remaining flour to make soft dough.
Knead on lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 4-6 minutes. Cover; let rest 10 minutes.
Combine turkey, vegetables, soup, and poultry seasoning.
Roll 2/3 of dough to fit 9-inch pie plate; place in greased plate. Spoon in filling.
Roll remaining dough for top crust; place over filling. Seal and flute edges. Cut slits for steam.
Cover; let rise in warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.
Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: Can substitute chicken for turkey

recipes.title: Kashi and Zucchini Casserole
recipes.description: A nutritious casserole combining Kashi pilaf with fresh zucchini and cheese.

instructions.text: Sauté zucchini and onion in butter until tender.
Combine with cooked Kashi, eggs, half the cheese, salt, and pepper.
Pour into greased 2-quart casserole.
Top with remaining cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes until set and golden.

notes: Kashi is a whole grain pilaf blend

recipes.title: Kashi Nut Loaf
recipes.description: A hearty vegetarian loaf made with Kashi and nuts.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Press into greased 9x5-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes until firm.
Let stand 10 minutes before slicing.

notes: Serve with mushroom gravy if desired

recipes.title: Chicken with Kashi
recipes.description: Tender chicken pieces served over nutritious Kashi pilaf.

instructions.text: Heat oil in large skillet. Brown chicken with paprika, salt, and pepper.
Add onion and garlic; sauté until soft.
Add Kashi and broth. Bring to boil.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer 25 minutes until Kashi is tender.

recipes.title: Kashi Pilaf Side Dish
recipes.description: A simple, nutritious side dish featuring Kashi pilaf with herbs.

instructions.text: Bring water or broth to boil with salt and butter.
Add Kashi, reduce heat, cover and simmer 25 minutes.
Fluff with fork, stir in herbs, and serve.

notes: Use vegetable broth for added flavor

recipes.title: Tofu Vegetable Curry and Kashi
recipes.description: A flavorful vegetarian curry with tofu and vegetables served over Kashi.

instructions.text: Sauté onion and garlic in oil until soft.
Add curry powder and cook 1 minute.
Add tofu, vegetables, and coconut milk.
Simmer 20 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Serve over cooked Kashi pilaf.

notes: Adjust curry powder to taste

recipes.title: Kashi Cheese & Nut Casserole
recipes.description: A protein-rich vegetarian casserole with cheese and nuts.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into greased 2-quart casserole dish.
Bake at 350°F for 35 minutes until set and lightly browned.

recipes.title: Vegetable Sauté and Kashi
recipes.description: Fresh sautéed vegetables served over hearty Kashi pilaf.

instructions.text: Heat oil in large skillet or wok.
Stir-fry vegetables and garlic until crisp-tender.
Add soy sauce and toss to coat.
Serve over cooked Kashi and sprinkle with sesame seeds.

notes: Add tofu or chicken for extra protein

recipes.title: Kashi Mexicana
recipes.description: A Mexican-inspired dish with Kashi, beans, and southwestern spices.

instructions.text: Combine Kashi, beans, corn, tomatoes, cumin, and chili powder in casserole.
Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.
Top with cheese and bake 5 more minutes until melted.
Garnish with green onions.

notes: Serve with sour cream and salsa

recipes.title: Kashi Purifying Soup
recipes.description: A cleansing, nourishing soup with Kashi and fresh vegetables.

instructions.text: Bring broth to boil in large pot.
Add Kashi, carrots, celery, onion, and garlic.
Reduce heat and simmer 35-40 minutes until Kashi is tender.
Stir in parsley, season with salt and pepper.

notes: Very cleansing and good for digestion

recipes.title: Kashi Yam and Carrot Soup
recipes.description: A creamy, naturally sweet soup with yams, carrots, and Kashi.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in large pot.
Bring to boil, reduce heat, and simmer 45 minutes until vegetables and Kashi are tender.
Puree half the soup for creamier texture if desired.
Season with salt and serve.

notes: The natural sweetness of yams makes this comforting

recipes.title: Corkscrew Pasta and Kashi
recipes.description: A unique combination of pasta and Kashi for added nutrition and texture.

instructions.text: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain.
Sauté garlic in olive oil.
Add pasta, Kashi, marinara sauce, and Italian seasoning.
Toss well and top with parmesan cheese.

notes: Adds whole grain nutrition to pasta dishes

recipes.title: Kashi Verde
recipes.description: Kashi pilaf with fresh green vegetables and herbs.

instructions.text: Melt butter in large skillet.
Add peas, spinach, and green onions; sauté until spinach wilts.
Stir in cooked Kashi and parsley.
Season with salt and pepper.

notes: A bright, fresh way to serve Kashi

recipes.title: Kashi Parmesan
recipes.description: Simple Kashi pilaf enriched with butter and parmesan cheese.

instructions.text: Melt butter in saucepan.
Add cooked Kashi and toss to coat.
Remove from heat and stir in parmesan, parsley, and pepper.
Serve immediately.

notes: Great as a side for grilled meats

recipes.title: Kashi Holiday Stuffing
recipes.description: A wholesome holiday stuffing made with Kashi instead of bread.

instructions.text: Sauté celery, onion, and mushrooms in butter until tender.
Combine with cooked Kashi, broth, and seasonings.
Place in greased 2-quart baking dish.
Bake covered at 350°F for 30 minutes.
Uncover and bake 15 minutes more until top is lightly browned.

notes: Can also be used to stuff a turkey

recipes.title: Kashi Stuffing
recipes.description: A simple, basic Kashi stuffing with traditional seasonings.

instructions.text: Sauté onion and celery in butter until soft.
Mix with Kashi, seasonings, and broth.
Place in greased baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for 35 minutes.

recipes.title: Kashi Breakfast Pilaf
recipes.description: A warm, hearty breakfast alternative using Kashi with honey and fruit.

instructions.text: Place warm Kashi in serving bowls.
Pour warm milk over Kashi.
Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with cinnamon.
Top with raisins and almonds.

notes: A nutritious alternative to oatmeal

recipes.title: Kashi Vegetable Salad
recipes.description: A refreshing cold salad with Kashi and fresh vegetables.

instructions.text: Combine cooled Kashi with all vegetables.
Whisk together olive oil and lemon juice.
Pour dressing over salad and toss.
Add parsley, salt, and pepper.
Chill at least 1 hour before serving.

notes: Similar to tabbouleh but with Kashi instead of bulgur

recipes.title: Kashi From the Sea
recipes.description: Kashi pilaf combined with seafood for a nutritious main dish.

instructions.text: Melt butter in large skillet.
Sauté garlic briefly, then add shrimp and scallops.
Cook until seafood is just done, about 5 minutes.
Add wine and lemon juice; simmer 2 minutes.
Serve over Kashi pilaf, garnished with parsley.

notes: Can substitute any firm white fish

recipes.title: Coconut Kashi Custard
recipes.description: A creamy coconut custard made with Kashi for added texture and nutrition.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together well.
Pour into greased 1 1/2-quart baking dish.
Place dish in larger pan filled with 1 inch hot water.
Bake at 325°F for 45 minutes until set.
Serve warm or chilled.

notes: Toast coconut for garnish if desired

recipes.title: Kashi Dessert Kugel
recipes.description: A sweet kugel-style dessert made with Kashi, eggs, and dried fruit.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes until golden and set.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

notes: A traditional Jewish-style dessert adapted with Kashi

recipes.title: Kashi Spice Rolls
recipes.description: Tender spiced rolls made with Kashi for added nutrition and texture.

instructions.text: Dissolve yeast in warm water with honey. Let stand 5 minutes.
Add butter, spices, salt, Kashi, and 1 cup flour. Beat well.
Stir in remaining flour to make soft dough.
Knead 5-8 minutes until smooth.
Let rise in warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.
Punch down and shape into 12 rolls.
Place in greased muffin tin or on baking sheet.
Let rise 20 minutes.
Bake at 375°F for 18-20 minutes until golden.

notes: Brush with melted butter after baking for softer crust

recipes.title: Aunt Joshia Mae's Blackberry Doobie
recipes.source_note: LaBelle Cuisine: Recipes to Sing About (Broadway, $25)
recipes.description: Sweet dumplings simmered in a rich blackberry sauce, a soul food classic from Patti LaBelle's cookbook.

instructions.text: To make the dumplings, in a medium bowl mix together the flour and sugar. Cut in the shortening using a pastry blender or fork until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in the milk until mixture forms a soft dough. Using 1 tablespoon of dough for each dumpling, roll into 24 balls (you may get more) and place on a baking sheet.
In a large, deep skillet, toss the berries with sugar, water and butter. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring often.
Reduce the heat to low and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the cornstarch mixture and cook until the juices thicken, 1-2 minutes.
Drop the dumplings into the simmering berries. Cover tightly and cook until the dumplings are puffed and cooked through, about 20 minutes.
Serve hot, spooned into individual bowls.

notes: Can use frozen berries if fresh are unavailable

recipes.title: Biscuits on Creamy Chicken
recipes.description: A comfort food casserole with creamy chicken and vegetables topped with Bisquick biscuits.

ingredients.item: frozen peas, broccoli, or green beans

instructions.text: Heat peas, chicken, soup, sour cream, milk, salt and pepper just to boiling. Keep warm.
Prepare biscuits with Bisquick and water.
Pour chicken mixture in 11-by-7-by-1-inch pan. Sprinkle with cheese.
Top with biscuits and bake at 425 degrees for about 20 minutes.
Remove from oven and serve.

recipes.title: Weight Watchers Chicken Creamed with Biscuits
recipes.description: A lighter version of chicken and biscuits using fat-free ingredients and Sweet 'n' Low.

instructions.text: Bake biscuits according to package directions; set aside, and keep warm.
Place the vegetables in a saucepan with a pat of butter substitute, Sweet 'n' Low and 1/8 cup water.
Bring to a boil and cook for about 3 minutes.
Combine chicken, milk, poultry seasoning, salt, pepper and soup in the saucepan with the vegetables.
Cook over medium heat 10 minutes, or until thoroughly heated, stirring frequently.
Split 4 of the 5 biscuits in half, reserving remaining biscuit for another use.
Spoon 1 cup chicken mixture over each split biscuit. Serve immediately.

notes: Each serving equals 8 Weight Watchers points

recipes.title: Lemon Meringue Pie
recipes.description: A classic lemon meringue pie with homemade pastry crust, tangy lemon filling, and fluffy meringue topping.

instructions.text: To make pastry in food processor: Process flour and salt to mix. Add shortening and butter; pulse until coarse crumbs form. With motor running, add 2 Tbsp water; process just until dough leaves sides of bowl, adding more water as needed. Remove blade, then dough.

By hand: Mix flour and salt in a medium bowl. Cut in shortening and butter with a pastry blender until coarse crumbs form. Add water, 1 Tbsp at a time, tossing mixture with a fork until dough clumps together.
Gather into a ball; press into a disk. Wrap and refrigerate 1 hour or until firm enough to roll out.
Heat oven to 425°F. Have a 9-in. pie plate ready.

Roll out dough on lightly floured surface with lightly floured rolling pin to a 13-in. circle. Fit into pie plate; fold edge of pastry under to form a rim. Crimp or flute rim. Prick bottom and sides at 1-in. intervals.
Bake 22 to 27 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Cool completely on a wire rack.

Reduce oven to 350°F. Filling: Whisk sugar and cornstarch in a medium saucepan. Whisk in yolks until smooth. Stir in water with a wooden spoon. Place over medium heat; stir until mixture comes to a full boil. Boil, stirring, 1 minute or until filling is translucent and thick. Remove from heat; add peel, juice and butter. Stir until butter melts.
Pour hot filling into pie shell.

Meringue: Beat egg whites and cream of tartar in a medium bowl with mixer on medium-high speed until soft peaks form when beaters are lifted. Beat in sugar, 1 Tbsp at a time, beating after each addition until sugar dissolves. Beat 2 minutes longer or until stiff peaks form.
Spoon meringue around edge of hot filling, then spread to edge of crust (see Tip). Spoon remaining meringue in center and spread and swirl with back of a small spoon to cover filling evenly.
Bake 20 minutes or until meringue is browned and an instant-read thermometer inserted in center of meringue registers 160°F (see Note, below).
Cool completely on a wire rack, then refrigerate at least 2 hours.
To serve: Cut pie with a long-blade knife dipped in cold water and wiped clean between cuts.

notes: Having the meringue touch the crust all around the edge keeps the meringue from shrinking as it bakes
Because of possible salmonella contamination from uncooked egg, it's important to cook egg whites completely
This much-loved favorite was born in Philadelphia in the early 1800s

recipes.title: Hot Fudge Sauce
recipes.description: A rich, creamy hot fudge sauce perfect for ice cream. The perfect ice cream topping came from NYC's Schrafft's, founded in 1861.

instructions.text: Bring cream just to a simmer in a saucepan or medium bowl in microwave. Remove from heat, add chocolate and stir until melted.
Add remaining ingredients; stir until blended and smooth. Serve warm.

notes: Refrigerate tightly covered up to 4 weeks. Reheat in microwave or over low heat before serving

recipes.title: Chicken Piccatta with Israeli Cous Cous
recipes.description: Elegant chicken piccatta with a lemon-caper sauce served over turmeric-spiced Israeli couscous.

instructions.text: Heat a sauté pan. Dredge the chicken in seasoned flour. Pour the oil into the hot pan and fry gently on both sides. Finish the chicken in the oven.
Prepare the sauce in the sauté pan. Add the capers, lemon juice, wine and simmer. Remove from heat, swirl in the butter and add the chives, season with salt and pepper to taste.
For the couscous: Boil 1 qt. of water and add the turmeric. Boil the cous cous until tender. Drain the cous cous.
Sauté the garlic, zucchini, and peppers in the olive oil, add the hot cous cous, stir and season.
Serve in the center of the plate with the chicken and sauce on top.

notes: Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 59.jpeg

recipes.title: Salmon with Angel Hair Pasta
recipes.description: Pan-seared salmon served over fresh tomato and basil angel hair pasta.

instructions.text: Boil the pasta, drain and hold.
Heat a sauté pan over medium high heat.
Season the salmon on both sides. Heat the olive oil in the sauté pan and sear the salmon on both sides.
In the same pot you cooked the pasta, heat the 2 oz. of olive oil and sauté the garlic; add the basil and tomatoes. Toss in the hot pasta. Season to taste. Serve with lemon wedges.
Basil oil can be used to flavor the salmon. Blanch a bunch of basil and chill. Puree the leaves in a blender with 1/2 cup of olive oil, strain and season.

notes: Basil oil optional for extra flavor
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 60.jpeg

recipes.title: Apple Strudel
recipes.description: Traditional apple strudel with a hand-stretched dough, filled with spiced apples, walnuts, and cookie crumbs.

instructions.text: Place all the dough ingredients in a mixer and knead for 5 minutes. Allow the dough to rest for 30 minutes, wrapped in plastic.
On a flour-dusted cloth, roll and stretch the dough so that it is about 4 feet by 3 feet.
Brush the dough with melted butter.
Sprinkle the dough with the filling. Roll into a log, brush with butter.
Place on parchment-lined pan and bake at 350° until golden brown.
Dust with powdered sugar.

notes: The dough should be stretched thin enough to read a newspaper through it
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 60.jpeg

recipes.title: Spring Rolls
recipes.description: Fresh Vietnamese-style spring rolls with chicken, shrimp, and vegetables, served with a ginger dipping sauce.

instructions.text: Prepare sauce by combining all ingredients in pot. Simmer for 4 minutes. Remove and chill.
To fill the spring rolls, soak the rice paper sheets in hot water for 2-3 minutes. Remove and place on damp towel.
Arrange each of the following ingredients and roll like a burrito. Fold ends in first, then roll it tight.

notes: Serve with dipping sauce on the side
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 60.jpeg

recipes.title: Butterscotch Oat Squares
recipes.description: Simple, chewy butterscotch oat bars with just 5 ingredients.

instructions.text: Combine brown sugar, baking powder and oats in bowl.
Add butter and vanilla.
Spread thinly in an ungreased 9-by-13 pan (or in two pans that are 8-by-8).
Bake at 375 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes, or until golden brown.
Let stand 5 minutes when cooked and cut in squares while warm.
Let cool thoroughly before removing from tins.

notes: Must cut while warm or they will crumble

recipes.title: Cheesy Chicken & Rice Bake
recipes.description: A one-dish chicken and rice casserole with cream of chicken soup and cheddar cheese.

instructions.text: MIX soup, water, rice, onion powder and black pepper in 2-qt. shallow baking dish. Top with chicken. Sprinkle chicken with additional pepper. COVER.
BAKE at 375°F. for 45 min. Or until chicken is no longer pink and rice is done.
UNCOVER. Sprinkle cheese over chicken. Remove chicken and stir rice before serving. Serves 6.

recipes.title: Cheesy Chicken and Broccoli Casserole
recipes.source_note: Valley Fresh Premium Chunk White Chicken product recipe
recipes.description: A creamy casserole with canned chicken, broccoli, and a touch of curry, topped with cheese and bread crumbs.

ingredients.item: Valley Fresh Premium Chunk White Chicken

instructions.text: Combine soup, mayonnaise, lemon juice and curry.
Spread broccoli in a 2-quart baking dish.
Evenly distribute Valley Fresh Chicken over broccoli and cover with soup mixture.
Top with cheese. Sprinkle lightly with bread crumbs.
Bake 1 hour at 350°F.

recipes.title: Oven-Baked Fries
recipes.description: Crispy, low-fat oven-baked fries with paprika seasoning.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Scrub the potatoes well; cut into quarters lengthwise, then crosswise.
Place in a bowl; toss with the oil, paprika, salt and pepper.
Arrange the potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes, until tender, brown and crispy. Shake once during baking.
Remove from the baking sheet with a metal spatula and serve on a platter. Sprinkle with a little extra salt, if desired.

notes: If you cut up the potatoes ahead of time, keep them in cold water so that they don't discolor

recipes.title: Southern Fried Chicken (Healthy Version)
recipes.description: A healthy baked version of Southern fried chicken using buttermilk and cornflake coating instead of deep frying.

ingredients.prep_note: skinned and trimmed of all visible fat

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Coat a shallow metal baking or roasting pan with nonstick spray. Set aside.
Pour the buttermilk into a shallow bowl. Add the chicken, turning to coat. Refrigerate for at least 15 minutes, turning occasionally.
On a plate, combine the cornflakes, paprika, salt, black pepper and red pepper.
Dip each side of the chicken into the cornflakes mixture, pressing firmly to coat. Stir the cornflakes mixture occasionally with a fork to keep the seasonings evenly mixed.
Coat the chicken with nonstick spray, place pieces in the pan.
Bake, turning the pieces once, for 40 to 45 minutes, or until the chicken is crisp, golden brown and the juices run clear when the chicken is pricked with a sharp knife.
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a thigh, not touching the bone, should register 180 degrees.

notes: Traditional recipe: 419 calories, 25g fat. This healthier version: 138 calories, 2g fat

recipes.title: Buffalo Wings
recipes.description: Classic spicy buffalo wings baked in the oven and served with vegetable sticks and dip.

instructions.text: Bake wings 1 hour at 400 degrees.
Combine hot sauce with melted butter in a large bowl. Add wings and toss to coat.
Serve with Touchdown Yogurt Dip, below, and vegetable sticks. Serves 4 to 6.

recipes.title: Touchdown Yogurt Dip
recipes.description: A tangy blue cheese yogurt dip perfect for buffalo wings and vegetables.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients and refrigerate.

recipes.title: No-Fumble Spinach-Artichoke Dip
recipes.description: A creamy spinach artichoke dip served in a hollowed pumpernickel bread bowl.

ingredients.prep_note: 1 package, thawed and squeezed of excess water

instructions.text: Melt butter with oil in large, heavy pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic; saute until onion is tender, about 6 minutes.
Add flour and stir 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in broth and bring to a boil, whisking constantly. Cook until mixture thickens, about 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat. Stir in spinach, artichokes, Parmesan cheese, yogurt and cayenne pepper. Season with salt and pepper.
To serve, hollow out a loaf of pumpernickel bread and fill with dip. Accompany with pumpernickel bread chunks.

recipes.title: Quarterback Sneak Pizza Muffins
recipes.description: Individual pizza muffins made with biscuits, ground beef, and pizza toppings.

ingredients.item: ground beef or crumbled Italian sausage

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Separate biscuits; pat into 3-inch circles. Press circles into muffin cups (there should be 4 if using 12-cup pan) halfway with water. Set aside.
In large nonstick skillet over high heat, cook meat, green pepper and mushrooms until meat is browned, about 5 minutes, stirring to separate meat. Drain fat.
Add pizza sauce, cheese and pepper sauce; mix well. Bring to a boil, stirring.
Mound filling into muffin cups, dividing evenly.
Bake 20 minutes until muffins are browned. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 8 servings.

notes: Use sliced pitted olives, chopped onions, cooked crumbled sausage, chopped bell peppers or sliced mushrooms as toppings

recipes.title: End Zone Stromboli
recipes.description: A rolled pizza dough filled with deli meats, cheese, and seasonings.

ingredients.prep_note: such as salami, ham and Muenster cheese

instructions.text: Roll pizza dough into 15-by-10-inch rectangle. Spread mustard on top, leaving a 1-inch border.
Arrange meat and cheese on top, overlapping sides. Pinch long edge of dough over filling.
To seal. Pinch ends together and tuck under dough. Place on oiled baking sheet.
Slits in top of dough. Brush with egg and sprinkle with poppy seeds.
Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden. Cool on rack 1 into slices and serve. Serves 6.

recipes.title: Penne with Zucchini and Feta
recipes.description: A bright pasta dish with zucchini, sun-dried tomatoes, and crumbled feta cheese.

ingredients.prep_note: about 2 1/2 ounces, flavored with basil and tomatoes, or plain

instructions.text: Cook the pasta according to the package directions, omitting salt or fat. While the pasta cooks, heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the oregano, zucchini and crushed garlic; saute 3 minutes.
Stir in the broth, rind, juice and pepper. Add the pasta and cheese; toss well. Serve.

notes: Feta cheese can be slightly salty, yet it packs a tangy flavor. A small amount can go a long way.

recipes.title: Roasted Red Bell Peppers
recipes.description: Basic broiler-roasted red bell peppers, perfect for salads, sandwiches and omelets.

ingredients.prep_note: stemmed, cut in half lengthwise and seeded

instructions.text: Preheat the broiler. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
Flatten the pepper halves slightly and lay them, skin-side up, on the prepared baking sheet.
Place under the broiler, about 9 inches from the heat source. Broil until the skins are charred (but not to a crisp), about 12 to 15 minutes.
Remove the peppers to a plastic bag, seal and let steam for 15 to 20 minutes.
Slip off and discard the charred skins. Use peppers as directed.

notes: Don't char the peppers too much, or it will be difficult to remove the skins
Keep this recipe handy - roasted peppers perk up salads, sandwiches and omelets

recipes.title: Collard Greens
recipes.source_note: The Lady & Sons Savannah Country Cookbook
recipes.description: Traditional Southern collard greens simmered with smoked meat, butter, and House Seasoning.

ingredients.prep_note: ham hocks, smoked turkey wings or smoked neck bones

instructions.text: In a large pot, bring 3 quarts water to a boil and add smoked meat, House Seasoning, seasoned salt and hot sauce. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 1 hour.

In the meantime, wash collard greens thoroughly. Remove the thick stem that runs down the center of the greens by holding the leaf in your left hand and stripping the leaf down with your right hand. (The tender young leaves of the collards don't need to be stripped.)
Stack 6-8 stripped leaves on top of each other, roll and slice into 1/2- to 1-inch-thick slices.
Place greens in pot with cooked smoked meat. Add butter. Cook 45-60 minutes, stirring occasionally.
When done, taste and adjust seasoning.

notes: House Seasoning: Mix 1 cup salt, 1/4 cup black pepper, 1/4 cup garlic powder. Store in a shaker or other container.

recipes.title: Snappy Chicken Wings
recipes.attribution: I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!
recipes.description: Crispy baked chicken wings coated in cayenne pepper sauce.

ingredients.item: I Can't Believe It's Not Butter! Spread
Wish-Bone Chunky Blue Cheese or Just 2 Good! Blue Cheese Dressing

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 425°. Cut tips off wings; cut wings in half at joint.
In bowl, combine cayenne pepper sauce, Spread and pepper. Stir in wings until coated.
In roasting pan or bottom of broiler pan lined with aluminum foil, arrange wings.
Bake 1 hour or until wings are thoroughly cooked and crisp.
Serve with Wish-Bone Chunky Blue Cheese or Just 2 Good! Blue Cheese Dressing.

notes: Use more or less cayenne pepper as desired

recipes.title: Spanish-Style Garlic Shrimp
recipes.attribution: I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!
recipes.description: Quick sautéed shrimp with garlic, jalapeño, cilantro and lime.

ingredients.item: I Can't Believe It's Not Butter! Spread

instructions.text: In 12-inch nonstick skillet, melt 1 tablespoon I Can't Believe It's Not Butter! Spread over high heat and cook shrimp with salt 2 minutes or until shrimp are almost pink, turning once. Remove shrimp and set aside.
In same skillet, melt remaining 3 tablespoons I Can't Believe It's Not Butter! Spread over medium-low heat and cook garlic and jalapeño pepper, stirring occasionally, 1 minute.
Return shrimp to skillet. Stir in cilantro and lime juice and heat 30 seconds or until shrimp turn pink.

recipes.title: Cherry Orange Delight
recipes.description: A layered gelatin dessert with cherry Jell-O, mandarin oranges, cream cheese, and whipped topping.

instructions.text: STIR boiling water into gelatin in medium bowl at least 2 minutes until completely dissolved. Stir in cold water.

Refrigerate about 1-1/4 hours or until slightly thickened (consistency of unbeaten egg whites). Reserve a few mandarin oranges for garnish. Gently stir remaining mandarin oranges into gelatin; set aside.
BEAT cream cheese and sugar in separate medium bowl with wire whisk until well blended. Gently stir in whipped topping.
Spoon into large serving bowl; cover with gelatin mixture.
REFRIGERATE 2 hours or until firm. Garnish with reserved mandarin oranges.

recipes.title: Festive Cranberry Pineapple Salad
recipes.description: A holiday gelatin salad with cranberry sauce, pineapple, apple, and walnuts.

instructions.text: DRAIN pineapple, reserving all of the liquid in a 1-quart liquid measuring cup. Remove 1 Tbsp. of the crushed pineapple; set aside for garnish.
Add enough cold water to the reserved liquid to measure 3 cups; pour into large saucepan. Bring to boil; remove from heat. Add gelatin; stir at least 2 minutes until completely dissolved.
Add cranberry sauce; stir until well blended. (Note: Due to the presence of whole berries in the cranberry sauce, the gelatin mixture will not be smooth.)
Pour into large bowl. Refrigerate 1-1/2 hours or until slightly thickened (consistency of unbeaten egg whites).
STIR in remaining pineapple, apple and walnuts; stir gently until well blended. Pour into medium serving bowl.
REFRIGERATE 4 hours or until firm. Garnish with reserved crushed pineapple and additional apple slices just before serving. Store leftover gelatin in refrigerator.

recipes.title: Corn Bread and Sausage Stuffing
recipes.description: A hearty stuffing made with crumbled corn bread, sausage, and McCormick seasonings.

ingredients.item: cooked and coarsely crumbled corn bread

instructions.text: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, celery and bell pepper; cook and stir 5 minutes.
Stir in poultry seasoning, thyme and garlic powder.
Combine corn bread with vegetable mixture and sausage in a large bowl. Add broth; toss gently.
Spoon into a 13 x 9-inch baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, in a 375°F oven 20-25 minutes or until heated through and top is crisp and golden brown.
Prepare Gravy Mix according to package directions. Serve gravy with prepared stuffing.

recipes.title: Treasure Cave Blue Cheese Dressing
recipes.description: A creamy homemade blue cheese dressing perfect for salads or as a vegetable dip.

instructions.text: Mash Treasure Cave Blue Cheese and buttermilk until mixture resembles cottage cheese.
Add remaining ingredients and blend thoroughly. Add salt and fresh ground pepper to taste.
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to use.

notes: Perfect as a salad dressing or vegetable dip

recipes.title: King's Bacon Bowl Dip
recipes.description: A creamy bacon spinach dip served in a hollowed King's Hawaiian bread bowl.

instructions.text: CARVE out center core of bread within one inch of bottom and sides, keeping bread intact.
CUBE removed bread and additional loaf. Place bowl and cubes on baking sheets and bake in pre-heated 350°F oven for 11-13 minutes, until golden brown.
BLEND mayo and sour cream together in a medium bowl. Add bacon and spinach; mix well. Cover and refrigerate until well chilled.
Just before serving, stir in tomatoes; salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to bread bowl and serve with toasted bread cubes.

recipes.title: Luau Pork Sandwich with Pineapple Cole Slaw
recipes.description: Hawaiian-style pulled pork sandwiches on sweet rolls topped with pineapple coleslaw.

instructions.text: In large bowl, combine cabbage, carrots and pineapple; toss to mix.
In small bowl, combine remaining ingredients, stirring to blend. Pour over salad and refrigerate to blend flavors.
To assemble sandwiches, heat shredded pork, divide over each of the buns. Top with cole slaw and serve.

recipes.title: Brunch Pizza Squares
recipes.description: Easy breakfast casserole with sausage, eggs, and cheese on a crescent roll crust.

instructions.text: In a skillet, cook sausage over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.
Unroll crescent dough into a lightly greased 13" x 9" x 2" baking pan. Press dough 1/2-inch up the sides; seal seams.
Sprinkle with sausage.
In a bowl, beat the eggs, milk and pepper; pour over sausage.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake, uncovered, at 400°F (200°C) for 15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted.

recipes.title: Patio Potatoes
recipes.description: Skillet potatoes with bacon, cheese, and green peppers.

instructions.text: Melt margarine in skillet, add potatoes, onion and green pepper.
Cook until browned, turning frequently.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Top with cheese and bacon.
