recipes.title: Mexican Surprise
recipes.description: A hearty Tex-Mex casserole combining taco-seasoned meat with macaroni and cheese.

instructions.text: Brown meat and drain fat.
Add onion, Taco Mix, tomatoes and tomato sauce.
Simmer until onion is cooked.
Prepare macaroni & cheese according to package directions.
Add macaroni & cheese to tomato mixture and stir to combine.

recipes.title: Date and Nut Bread
recipes.description: A classic quick bread studded with dates and nuts.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, add baking soda and boiling water to dates. Let cool.
Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
Pour into a greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for approximately 50 minutes or until tests done.

recipes.title: Artichoke Cheese Dip
recipes.source_note: Recipe card with Easter egg decoration
recipes.description: A creamy, cheesy dip with artichoke hearts and green chiles.

instructions.text: Mix all together.
Put in microwave to warm when ready to serve.

notes: Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 76.jpeg

recipes.title: "Best Ever" Cranberry Muffins
recipes.source_note: Newspaper clipping with candy cane border
recipes.description: Tender muffins with cranberries, walnuts, and orange zest.

instructions.text: Soak cranberries in boiling water 5 minutes. Drain.
In a large mixing bowl, cream sugar and margarine until fluffy.
Add sour cream and mix well.
Combine dry ingredients; stir mixture until moistened.
Drain cranberries and fold into batter.
Add nuts & orange peel and mix completely.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 18-20 mins until tested done.
Cool 10 mins before removing.

notes: For Texas Style (6 large muffins), bake 30-35 minutes

recipes.title: Asian Beef & Noodles
recipes.description: Quick 25-minute dinner with ground beef, ramen noodles, and vegetables.

instructions.text: In large nonstick skillet, brown ground beef over medium heat 10 to 12 minutes or until beef is no longer pink, breaking up into 1/4" pieces.
Remove with slotted spoon; pour off drippings.
Season beef with one seasoning packet from noodles; set aside.
In same skillet, combine 2 cups water, vegetables, noodles (broken up), ginger and remaining seasoning packet.
Bring to a boil; reduce heat. Cover; simmer 3 minutes or until noodles are tender, stirring occasionally.
Return beef to skillet; stir in green onion.

notes: From 'It's What's For Dinner' campaign

recipes.title: Linguine al Granchio con Salsa Rosa
recipes.attribution: Chef Paolo Tini, Caffe Paradiso Tampa
recipes.description: Elegant crab linguine in a creamy tomato-clam sauce.

instructions.text: Sauté the onion in 3 ounces olive oil in a skillet until tender.
Add the pureed tomatoes, salt and pepper. Reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Sauté the garlic in 3 ounces olive oil in a separate skillet until tender and golden.
Add the crabmeat and clam juice. Simmer for 2 minutes.
Reduce the heat and stir in the tomato sauce and heavy cream. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve over the hot, cooked linguine. Garnish with ribbons of fresh basil.

notes: Signature dish from Caffe Paradiso Tampa

recipes.title: Pasta e Fagioli
recipes.description: Hearty Italian bean and pasta soup with pancetta and Parmesan.

instructions.text: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large stockpot over medium-high heat. Add bacon and sauté until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add onion and celery and cook until vegetables soften, 4 to 5 minutes.
Add the garlic, oregano, and hot red pepper flakes and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes and scrape any browned bits from the pan. Add the cheese rind and the beans.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer until flavors meld, about 10 minutes.
Add chicken stock, 4 cups water and salt. Raise heat and bring to a boil.
Add pasta and cook until tender, about 8 minutes.
Off heat, remove cheese rind. Stir in parsley and season with pepper.
Ladle into bowls. Drizzle with remaining oil and serve with grated cheese.

recipes.title: Lemon Sponge Pudding
recipes.description: A light dessert that separates into cake on top and lemon custard below.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Beat egg yolks until light. Add sugar 1/4 cup at a time, beating until smooth.
Blend in lemon juice, lemon peel, and melted margarine. Add flour and milk. Beat well.
Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold into the batter.
Pour into ungreased 8-inch square baking dish.
Place in a larger pan filled with boiling water (water bath).
Bake for 45 minutes.
Let cool at least 5 minutes. Serve warm, spooned into bowls.

notes: Can substitute orange or grapefruit, or make coffee-flavored version

recipes.title: No-Bake Cheesecake
recipes.description: Refreshing lime-flavored no-bake cheesecake with graham cracker crust.

instructions.text: Mix graham crackers and margarine. Press on bottoms and sides of 2 (9-inch) pie pans or 1 9x13-inch pan, reserving some crumbs for top.
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water, set aside until cooled and syrupy.
Cream the cream cheese and sugar and add to gelatin.
Add vanilla and whipped evaporated milk and mix well.
Pour into prepared pans. Sprinkle reserved crumbs on top.
Chill several hours before serving.

notes: Evaporated milk must be well chilled before whipping

recipes.title: Lighten Up Carrot Cake
recipes.description: Healthier carrot cake made with applesauce instead of oil, topped with orange glaze.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F (175°C). Spray bundt pan with non-stick cooking spray.
Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and salt. Set aside.
Beat together applesauce, both sugars, egg whites and orange zest and juice.
Blend in flour mixture until just smooth. Stir in carrots and raisins.
Pour into prepared pan. Bake 60 to 65 minutes until tester comes out clean.
Remove from pan; cool completely on wire rack.
Prepare glaze: mix 2 cups confectioners' sugar, 2 tbsp applesauce, 1-2 tbsp orange juice, 1 tsp orange zest. Spoon over cooled cake.

notes: Uses applesauce instead of oil
Uses only egg whites - no whole eggs

recipes.title: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
recipes.description: Classic cast-iron skillet pineapple upside-down cake with maraschino cherries.

instructions.text: Drain pineapple slices, reserving 2 tablespoons juice.
Melt butter over medium heat in 10-inch iron or heavy oven-proof skillet. Add brown sugar, stirring until melted. Remove from heat.
Arrange 7 or 8 pineapple slices over sugar mixture, slightly overlapping slices around edge of pan if necessary. Fill centers with cherry halves, cut side up.

Combine flour, granulated sugar, baking powder and salt in medium bowl. Add shortening and milk and beat 2 minutes or until mixture is smooth. Add egg and reserved 2 tablespoons syrup and beat 2 minutes longer.
Gently spoon part of batter over ingredients in skillet, then carefully spread remaining batter into even layer without disturbing fruit.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 40 to 45 minutes or until golden brown and surface of cake springs back when pressed gently with fingertips.

Remove cake from oven, place on wire rack and allow to cool 5 minutes. Loosen cake around edge of skillet with small spatula. Place inverted serving platter over cake and turn both upside down. Shake gently, then remove skillet.
Cut cake into wedges and serve warm.

recipes.title: Texas Tornado Pudding Cake
recipes.description: A self-saucing chocolate pudding cake that creates its own fudgy sauce while baking.

instructions.text: Mix flour, sugar, 2 tablespoons cocoa, baking powder and salt together.
Add milk and margarine to dry ingredients. Mix until smooth.
Pour into 9-inch baking pan.
Mix brown sugar, 6 tablespoons cocoa and hot water until sugar and cocoa are dissolved.
Pour over top of cake batter.
Bake in 325°F (165°C) oven for approximately 45 minutes or until cake is done.

notes: Do not stir after pouring topping over batter
The topping sinks to create a fudgy sauce on bottom

recipes.title: Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
recipes.description: Rich, moist carrot cake with pecans and classic cream cheese frosting.

instructions.text: Combine oil and sugar; mix well.
Sift together dry ingredients. Sift half of dry ingredients into sugar mixture; blend well.
Sift in remaining dry ingredients, alternating with eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add carrots; mix well. Mix in pecans.
Bake in 10-inch greased and floured tube pan at 325°F (165°C) for 1 hour 10 minutes, or until done. (Or in two 9-inch layer cake pans for 35 minutes.)
Cool. Remove from pans and frost with Cream Cheese Frosting.

recipes.pan_size: 10-inch tube pan or two 9-inch layer pans

sub_recipes.name: Cream Cheese Frosting
sub_recipes.instructions: Combine all ingredients and beat until smooth.

recipes.title: Old-Fashioned Raisin-Pecan Cake
recipes.description: Two-layer spice cake filled and topped with a rich raisin-pecan custard filling.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease 2 round, 8-inch layer cake pans; set aside.
In large bowl, beat butter and sugar until fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time, then beat in buttermilk.
In another bowl mix remaining ingredients except Raisin-Pecan Filling. Mix dry ingredients into butter mixture to blend thoroughly.
Spoon batter into pans, dividing equally; smooth tops.
Bake in center of oven about 30 minutes until springy to the touch and pick inserted into center comes out clean.
Cool on racks 10 minutes, then turn out onto racks to cool completely.
Place one layer on plate; cover with half the filling. Cover with remaining cake layer and filling. Refrigerate cake.

sub_recipes.name: Raisin-Pecan Filling
sub_recipes.instructions: In 2-quart saucepan mix sugar, cornstarch and salt. In bowl whisk 2 cups buttermilk, 4 egg yolks and 1 teaspoon vanilla; whisk into sugar mixture. Cook over medium-low heat about 5 minutes, stirring constantly, until filling is spreading consistency. Remove from heat; cool to room temperature. Mix in raisins and pecans.

recipes.title: S'Mores Cake
recipes.description: Light cake with graham cracker crumbs topped with toasted marshmallows and chocolate chips.

instructions.text: Lightly butter 2 (8-inch) round springform cake pans or spray with non-stick cooking spray.
Stir together cake flour, graham cracker crumbs and baking powder in medium bowl.
In another bowl, combine non-fat milk, applesauce and vanilla. Add to dry ingredients, stirring just until blended.
Beat egg whites until frothy. Add cream of tartar and continue beating until thick and foamy. Gradually add sugar, beating until soft, smooth peaks form.
Fold half into batter until blended. Fold in remaining whites until just blended.
Divide batter into prepared pans, spreading evenly. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15-20 minutes or until wood pick inserted in center comes out clean.
Sprinkle marshmallows and chocolate chips over tops of cakes. Place under broiler to brown slightly.
Let cool to warm and serve.

notes: Watch carefully under broiler - marshmallows brown quickly

recipes.title: Nutty Graham Picnic Cake
recipes.source_note: Pillsbury product recipe, Grand Prize winner
recipes.description: Moist orange-flavored bundt cake with graham crackers and nuts, topped with brown sugar glaze.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F. Generously grease and flour 12-cup fluted tube pan or 10-inch tube pan.
Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup; level off.
In large bowl, combine all cake ingredients except nuts; beat 3 minutes at medium speed.
By hand, stir in 1 cup nuts.
Pour batter into greased and floured pan.
Bake at 350°F for 40 to 60 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool upright in pan 15 minutes; invert onto serving plate. Cool completely.
In small saucepan over low heat, combine 2 tablespoons brown sugar, milk and 1 tablespoon margarine; heat just until sugar is dissolved, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat. Stir in powdered sugar; blend until smooth. Drizzle over cake; sprinkle with 1/4 cup nuts.

recipes.pan_size: 12-cup fluted tube pan or 10-inch tube pan

sub_recipes.name: Glaze
sub_recipes.instructions: Heat brown sugar, milk and margarine until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat, stir in powdered sugar until smooth. Drizzle over cake and sprinkle with nuts.

recipes.title: Pennsylvania Dutch Cake and Custard Pie
recipes.description: A unique pie with molasses custard filling topped with a tender cake layer and coffee glaze.

instructions.text: Prepare pie crust according to package directions for filled one-crust pie using 9-inch pie pan or 9-inch deep dish pie pan. (Refrigerate remaining crust for later use.)
Heat oven to 350°F. In medium bowl, combine 1/3 cup sugar, 2 tablespoons flour and apple pie spice; mix well. Stir in remaining filling ingredients; blend well. Set aside.
In small bowl, combine 1/2 cup sugar and margarine; beat until well blended. Add sour milk, 1 egg and vanilla; beat until smooth.
Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup; level off. Add flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda; mix well.
Spoon into crust-lined pan. Carefully pour filling mixture over batter.
Bake at 350°F for 45 to 60 minutes or until center springs back when touched lightly and top is deep golden brown.
Meanwhile, in small bowl combine glaze ingredients; blend well. Drizzle over hot pie.
Serve slightly warm with cinnamon ice cream.

recipes.pan_size: 9-inch pie pan or deep dish pie pan
notes: Tip #1: Apple pie spice = 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp ginger, 1/8 tsp nutmeg, 1/8 tsp allspice
Tip #2: To make sour milk, add 1 tsp lemon juice to 1/2 cup milk; let stand 5 minutes
Tip #3: If using self-rising flour, omit baking powder, salt and baking soda

recipes.title: Grilled Salmon with Tarragon
recipes.source_note: Newspaper clipping (Saturday, February 26, 1994), continued from page 2B
recipes.description: Simple grilled salmon steaks with a tarragon-mustard sauce.

instructions.text: In small bowl, mix mustard, mayonnaise, parsley and tarragon until blended; set aside.
Grill or broil salmon, about 5 to 7 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork, turning and brushing with 1/2 cup mustard mixture frequently.
Serve salmon with remaining mustard mixture.

notes: Recipe continues from page 2B - beginning ingredients were cut off

flags: Beginning of recipe cut off - some ingredients unclear

recipes.title: Strawberry Rhubarb Pie
recipes.description: Classic spring pie with rhubarb, strawberries, and a buttery crumb topping.

ingredients.prep_note: without tops, cut into 1/2-inch pieces (or frozen)

instructions.text: In 2-quart saucepan, over medium heat, heat rhubarb, sugar, water and tapioca to a boil. Reduce heat to low; simmer 5 to 10 minutes or until rhubarb is just tender and mixture is thickened.
Stir in strawberries and orange peel.
Meanwhile, brush crumb crust with egg white. Bake at 375°F for 5 minutes.
Remove from oven; cool slightly. Pour rhubarb mixture into crust. Sprinkle with crumb topping.
Bake at 375°F for 25 to 30 minutes or until topping is browned and filling bubbles around the edge.
Cool completely.

sub_recipes.name: Crumb Topping
sub_recipes.instructions: In small bowl, mix flour, brown sugar, walnuts and cinnamon. Stir in melted margarine until blended.

recipes.title: 1896/1993 Gingerbread
recipes.description: Updated classic gingerbread with options for reduced fat - serve with applesauce or chocolate sauce.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9-by-9-inch baking pan with the shortening; set aside.
In mixing bowl, combine sugar, eggs, yogurt, molasses and canola oil; beat until smooth.
Sift flour with ginger, soda, cinnamon and salt; stir into egg-yogurt mixture only to blend. Do not overmix; batter should be a little lumpy.
Pour batter into prepared pan and bake 25 to 30 minutes, or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool slightly in pan on rack, then cut into squares to serve hot or cold, topped with applesauce or chocolate sauce, if desired.
Freeze squares of gingerbread, individually wrapped in plastic film, to reheat in microwave.

notes: Without canola oil: 217 calories, 3g fat per serving
With canola oil: 271 calories, 9g fat per serving

recipes.title: Lowfat Carrot Cake
recipes.description: Healthier carrot cake using prune puree instead of oil, with pineapple and coconut.

ingredients.item: prune puree or prepared prune butter

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Coat a 9x13-inch baking pan with vegetable cooking spray; set aside.
In large bowl combine carrots, sugar, pineapple, prune puree or butter, egg whites and vanilla; stir to blend thoroughly.
Add remaining ingredients except coconut; mix completely.
Gently stir in coconut.
Spread batter in prepared pan; bake about 45 minutes until pick inserted into center comes out clean.
Cool on rack. Cut into 3x3 1/4-inch squares.

notes: Uses prune puree instead of oil for a lowfat cake

recipes.title: Yummy Bars
recipes.description: Decadent layered bars with caramel, German chocolate cake, chocolate chips, and pecans.

ingredients.item: German chocolate cake mix with pudding

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 13x9-inch pan.
Combine caramel candy and 1/4 cup evaporated milk in small saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until smooth. Set aside.
Combine cake mix, butter, egg and remaining evaporated milk with wooden spoon.
Press half of mixture into prepared pan, spreading evenly. Bake for 6 minutes.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with morsels and pecans. Spoon caramel mixture on top.
Carefully spread remaining cake mixture over caramel layer.
Return to oven for 20 to 25 minutes. Cool on wire rack and cut into bars.

recipes.title: Spanish Bar Cake
recipes.description: Spiced cake made with apple pie filling, raisins, and walnuts, topped with cream cheese frosting.

instructions.text: Put apple pie filling into blender with eggs, apple pie spice and cloves. Blend till almost smooth.
Dump into 2-quart mixing bowl and beat in cake mix with electric mixer on medium speed, blending thoroughly.
Remove beaters. Stir in raisins and nuts.
Pour evenly into greased and floured 9x13x2-inch pan.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 50 to 55 minutes or till toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool on wire rack in pan for 30 minutes before applying frosting.

sub_recipes.name: Bar Cake Frosting
sub_recipes.instructions: Beat cream cheese and margarine together till smooth and creamy. Add corn syrup and continue to beat till incorporated. Beat in orange peel. Add powdered sugar and cloves. Spread icing over cold cake.

recipes.title: 'Winning' California Lemon Crunch Dessert
recipes.description: Layered dessert with oat-coconut crust, lemon yogurt topping, and toasted coconut.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Place coconut in single layer in 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake 16-20 minutes or until coconut is lightly toasted, stirring after 12 minutes. Cool completely; set aside.
For crust, in large bowl beat margarine and corn syrup until creamy. Add oats, flour, nuts, cinnamon and baking soda; beat well.
Reserve 3/4 cup coconut for topping; stir remaining coconut into oat mixture.
Spray a 13x9-inch baking pan with nonstick vegetable coating and press dough onto the bottom. Bake 16-18 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely.
For topping, combine whipped topping, yogurt and lemon peel. Spread mixture evenly over cooled top.
Sprinkle with reserved coconut, pressing lightly. Cover; chill. Cut into squares; garnish with lemon twists, if desired.
Store, covered, in the refrigerator.

notes: Original recipe: 360 cal, 24g fat, 230mg sodium
Revised recipe: 251 cal, 12g fat, 145mg sodium

recipes.title: Mystery Pecan Pie
recipes.description: A layered pecan pie with a cream cheese layer hidden beneath the traditional pecan filling.

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese - beat together with 1 tsp vanilla, 1/3 cup sugar, 1/4 tsp salt and 1 egg until smooth.
Put cream cheese mixture in pie crust.
Put 1 1/4 cups chopped pecans on cream cheese mixture.
Beat 3 eggs with 1 cup corn syrup, 1/4 cup sugar and 1 tsp vanilla until blended.
Gently pour corn syrup mixture over cheese layer.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 35-45 min (until knife comes out clean).

notes: If you have crust left over, roll out & cut in 1" strips & cut strips in 1" pieces & put around edge of crust instead of fluting. Looks kinda cute!
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 96.jpeg

recipes.title: Bundt Cake - Virginia
recipes.source_note: Handwritten recipe on West Michigan Nail & Wire Company letterhead (Grand Rapids, Michigan)
recipes.description: A festive bundt cake loaded with orange slice candy, dates, walnuts, and coconut, with orange juice glaze.

instructions.text: Mix and set aside: orange slice candy (cut up), dates, walnuts, coconut and 1/2 cup flour.
Cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs one at a time - beat well.
Mix soda in buttermilk.
Add buttermilk mixture alternately with 3 1/2 cups flour - mix well.
Add candy mixture to batter.
Pour into angel food (tube) pan.
Bake at 300°F (150°C) for 1 hour and 45 minutes.
For glaze: Combine 1 cup orange juice with 2 cups powdered sugar.
Poke holes in cake while hot and pour glaze over cake.
Keep in cold place.

notes: Recipe from Virginia - Michigan origin
Keep refrigerated

sub_recipes.name: Orange Juice Glaze
sub_recipes.instructions: Combine orange juice and powdered sugar. Poke holes in hot cake and pour glaze over.

recipes.title: Baked Tortilla Chips
recipes.description: Crispy homemade tortilla chips with chili-lime seasoning, baked not fried.

ingredients.item: Shedd's Spread Country Crock Plus Calcium Spread

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
In small bowl, blend all ingredients except tortillas.
Brush mixture on one side of each tortilla; sprinkle, if desired, with salt.
Cut each tortilla into 8 wedges.
On greased baking sheets, arrange tortilla wedges in a single layer.
Bake 8 minutes or until golden and crisp.
Serve warm or place on wire rack to cool. Store in airtight container.

recipes.title: Mac and Cheese
recipes.description: Healthier baked mac and cheese with reduced-fat cheese and fat-free sour cream.

ingredients.prep_note: skim milk works just as well

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Coat a 2-quart baking dish with nonstick spray.
In a small bowl, combine the flour, salt, paprika, black pepper and red pepper.
Melt the butter or margarine in a medium saucepan over low heat. Add the onion and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 8 to 10 minutes, or until the onion is translucent.
Add the flour mixture. Cook, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes.
Gradually add the milk. Cook, stirring constantly, for 8 to 10 minutes, or until smooth and slightly thickened.
Remove from the heat and add the cheese. Stir until melted.
Place the pasta in a large bowl. Add the sour cream and mix well. Pour the cheese sauce over the macaroni and stir to mix.
Spoon into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with bread. Coat lightly with nonstick spray.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until bubbly.

notes: Traditional recipe: 409 calories, 23g fat
This healthier version: 318 calories, 9g fat

recipes.title: Rhubarb Preserves
recipes.source_note: Handwritten recipe card - Grandpa Ed's favorite, marked with a smiley face
recipes.description: Simple rhubarb preserves with orange slices - Grandpa Ed's favorite recipe.

instructions.text: Combine rhubarb, sugar, cut up orange slices, and water in a large pot.
Boil until all dissolved.
Stir constantly.

notes: Grandpa Ed's favorite - the original card has a smiley face drawn next to his name
Stir constantly to prevent scorching

recipes.title: Sensational Double Layer Pumpkin Pie
recipes.description: Two-layer no-bake pumpkin pie with cream cheese bottom and spiced pumpkin pudding top.

ingredients.item: KEEBLER READY CRUST Graham Cracker Pie Crust
JELL-O Vanilla Flavor Instant Pudding & Pie Filling

instructions.text: MIX cream cheese, 1 tablespoon milk and sugar in large bowl with wire whisk until smooth. Gently stir in whipped topping. Spread on bottom of crust.
POUR 1 cup milk into bowl. Add pudding mixes. Beat with wire whisk 1 minute. (Mixture will be thick.) Stir in pumpkin and spices with wire whisk until well mixed. Spread over cream cheese layer.
REFRIGERATE 4 hours or until set. Garnish with additional whipped topping, if desired. Store leftover pie in refrigerator.

notes: Helpful Hint: Soften cream cheese in microwave on HIGH 15 to 20 seconds

recipes.title: Macaroon Pie
recipes.description: Unique crustless pie with saltine crackers, dates, pecans, and chocolate chips.

instructions.text: Crush saltines to form fine crumbs.
Mix with dates, pecans, chocolate chips, zest, sugar, salt and almond extract.
Beat the egg whites until stiff, then fold in quickly.
Spread the mixture in a buttered 9-inch pie pan.
Bake in a 300°F (150°C) oven for 45 minutes or until firm and golden.
Serve with whipped cream.

recipes.title: Banana Split Cake
recipes.description: Layered no-bake dessert with graham cracker crust, cream cheese, pineapple, bananas, and whipped topping.

instructions.text: Melt 1 stick margarine in 9-by-13-by-2-inch baking pan. Add graham cracker crumbs and press to form crust on bottom.
Melt remaining margarine in sauce pan. Mix with sugar and cream cheese.
Spread over graham cracker layer.
Spread crushed pineapple over margarine mixture and cover with bananas, which have been sliced lengthwise.
Spread whipped topping over all.
Add nuts and cherries. Drizzle chocolate syrup over top.
Refrigerate 24 hours before serving. Keep chilled.

notes: Must refrigerate 24 hours before serving

recipes.title: Orange Slice Cake
recipes.description: Dense, festive cake loaded with candied orange slices, dates, coconut, and pecans.

ingredients.prep_note: cut in small pieces and rolled in sugar

instructions.text: Stir baking soda into buttermilk until dissolved.
Cream margarine and sugar, adding eggs, one at a time. Add buttermilk mixture.
Stir in flour, orange rind, coconut, dates, pecans and orange slices with large spoon.
Bake at 300°F (150°C) for 2 hours in angel food or tube cake pan that has been greased and floured.
Just before cake is done, press candied cherries and pecan halves on top.

recipes.title: Lemon Ice Box Pie
recipes.description: Classic Southern icebox pie with sweetened condensed milk and fluffy meringue topping.

ingredients.item: crumb or baked pastry pie shell

instructions.text: Combine lemon juice and grated lemon rind or lemon extract; gradually stir into sweetened condensed milk.
Add egg yolks and stir till well blended.
Pour into chilled crumb crust or cooled pastry shell.
Add cream of tartar to egg whites; beat till almost stiff enough to hold a peak.
Add sugar gradually, beating until stiff but not dry.
Pile lightly on pie filling.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) degrees until lightly browned, about 15 minutes.
Cool. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

recipes.title: Lemon Chess Pie
recipes.source_note: Newspaper clipping from The Washington Post
recipes.description: Traditional Southern chess pie with lemon and buttermilk custard filling.

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, beat the eggs lightly with a fork, then beat in the sugar with a fork or a whisk.
Mix in the salt, buttermilk and cornmeal.
Then pour in the melted butter in a steady stream, combining until smooth.
Finally, mix in lemon zest and juice just until incorporated.
Bake in a preheated 400°F (200°C) oven for 10 minutes, then reduce heat to 325°F (165°C) and bake until custard is set, about 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Unabashed Lemon Chess Pie
recipes.attribution: St. Luke's Episcopal Church, Salisbury, N.C.
recipes.description: Rich lemon chess pie with a full cup of butter - unapologetically indulgent.

instructions.text: Line 8-inch pie pan with pastry.
Put in large bowl and toss lightly with fork the sugar, flour and cornmeal.
Add milk, lemon juice, rind, melted butter and eggs. Beat until thoroughly blended.
Pour into pie shell.
Bake at 475°F (245°C) for 5 minutes, then cover edges of crust with foil and bake at 375°F (190°C) until golden brown and set.

notes: Makes one pie or 12 regular size tarts or 4 dozen very small tarts
Handwritten notes adjust lemon juice and milk to 1/4 cup each

recipes.title: Mystery Pecan Pie
recipes.description: A layered pecan pie with cream cheese filling - restaurant recipe from Chef's Garden in Naples.

instructions.text: Prepare pie crust according to package directions for filled one-crust pie.
In small bowl, combine cream cheese, 1 egg, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 1/3 cup sugar and salt; beat at low speed until smooth and well blended. Set aside.
In another small bowl, beat 3 eggs. Stir in 1/4 cup sugar, corn syrup and 1 teaspoon vanilla; blend well.
Spread cream cheese mixture in bottom of crust-lined pan. Sprinkle with pecans.
Gently pour corn syrup mixture over pecans.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 35 to 45 minutes or until center is set. Cover edge of pie crust with strips of foil after 15 to 20 minutes of baking to prevent excessive browning.
Cool completely. Store in refrigerator.

notes: Variant of handwritten Mystery Pecan Pie recipe - this version is from Chef's Garden in Naples, FL
recipes.variant_notes: This newspaper version (1993) is from Chef's Garden in Naples, FL. The handwritten version may be adapted from this or an earlier source.

recipes.title: Upside-Down Apple Pecan Pie
recipes.description: Apple pie baked upside-down over a pecan-brown sugar topping, then inverted for a caramelized finish.

instructions.text: In 9-inch pie pan, combine pecans, brown sugar and margarine; spread evenly over bottom of pan.
Prepare pie crust according to package directions for two-crust pie, placing bottom crust over pecan mixture in pan.
Heat oven to 375°F (190°C). In large bowl, combine apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon and nutmeg; mix lightly.
Spoon into crust-lined pan. Top with remaining crust; fold edge of top crust under bottom crust. Press together to seal; flute edge.
Cut slits in top crust.
Bake at 375°F for 40 to 50 minutes or until apples are tender and crust is deep golden brown.
Cover edge of crust with strips of foil after 15 to 20 minutes of baking to prevent excessive browning. (Place foil or cookie sheet on lowest oven rack during baking to guard against spills.)
Cool pie upright in pan for 5 minutes. Place serving plate over pie; invert.
Carefully remove pan. Some nuts may remain in pan; replace on pie with knife.
Cool at least 1 hour before serving. Garnish as desired.

conversion_assumptions: Apples: 6 cups sliced = about 6-7 medium apples

recipes.title: Apple Crisp Pie
recipes.description: Apple pie with a crunchy oatmeal-cardamom streusel topping instead of a top crust.

instructions.text: Prepare pie crust according to package directions for filled one-crust pie using 9-inch pie pan. (Refrigerate remaining crust for a later use.)
Heat oven to 375°F (190°C). In large bowl, combine all filling ingredients; mix lightly.
Cover with plastic wrap and microwave on HIGH for 7 to 10 minutes until liquid starts to thicken.
Spoon into crust-lined pan.
In small bowl, combine 1/3 cup sugar, 1/4 cup flour, oatmeal, cinnamon and cardamom; mix well.
With fork or pastry blender, cut in butter until mixture is crumbly.
Sprinkle topping mixture evenly over filling.
Bake at 375°F for 35 to 45 minutes or until apples are tender and crust is deep golden brown.
Cover edge of crust with strips of foil after 15 to 20 minutes of baking to prevent excessive browning.

notes: Cardamom gives this a unique Scandinavian twist

recipes.title: Hot Fudge Pudding Cake
recipes.description: A magical self-saucing chocolate cake that creates its own hot fudge sauce as it bakes.

instructions.text: Combine flour, granulated sugar, 2 tablespoons cocoa, baking powder and salt into a bowl.
Blend in milk and shortening; stir in nuts.
Pour into ungreased 9-inch square pan.
Stir together brown sugar and 1/4 cup cocoa; sprinkle over batter.
Pour hot water over all.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes.
While hot, cut into squares and invert each onto dessert plate, spooning sauce over each serving.
Serve with dessert topping or whipped cream if desired.

notes: The hot water creates a fudge sauce beneath the cake as it bakes

recipes.title: Quick Chocolate Pudding Cake
recipes.description: A shortcut version of chocolate pudding cake using cake mix, with a rich chocolate sauce underneath.

instructions.text: Prepare cake according to package directions.
Stir in nuts and pour into a greased 8- by 12-inch cake pan.
Combine the cocoa and sugar and sprinkle over the cake batter.
Add the vanilla to the hot water and pour over all.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 35-40 minutes.
While warm, cut into squares and invert each on dessert plate, spooning sauce on top.
Serve with dessert topping or ice cream.

notes: Using cake mix makes this much faster than the from-scratch version

recipes.title: Pecan Glazed Pumpkin Pie
recipes.description: Classic pumpkin pie elevated with a buttery pecan streusel topping added partway through baking.

instructions.text: Preheat oven and baking sheet to 375°F (190°C).
In large bowl, using a wire whisk, whisk together eggs, pumpkin, evaporated milk, 3/4 cup sugar and pumpkin pie spice.
Place frozen pie crust on preheated baking sheet.
Pour filling into crust. Bake 40 minutes.
In small bowl, combine remaining 1/4 cup sugar, pecans and melted butter.
Crumble over top of partially baked pie.
Bake an additional 30 minutes, or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.

notes: The pecan topping goes on after 40 minutes to prevent burning

recipes.title: Lemony Sweet Potato Pie
recipes.description: A Southern sweet potato pie brightened with lemon juice and warm spices.

instructions.text: Combine the first seven ingredients; mix well.
Add the lemon juice and margarine; beat with electric mixer or rotary beater.
Blend in potatoes and pecans.
Pour into pie shell.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for about 50 minutes to 1 hour, or until knife inserted in pie comes out clean.
Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.

notes: The lemon juice brightens the sweet potato flavor without being overtly lemony

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Chiffon Pie
recipes.source_note: Favorite Recipes of Home Economics Teachers: Desserts (1962)
recipes.description: A light, fluffy sweet potato pie with beaten egg whites folded in for a chiffon texture.

instructions.text: Mix first seven ingredients with beaten egg yolks.
Add milk.
Beat egg whites, gradually adding 1/4 cup granulated sugar; fold into first mixture.
Pour into unbaked pastry shell.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 10 minutes.
Reduce heat to 350°F (175°C); bake until set, about 30 minutes.
Sprinkle nutmeg and sugar on top.

notes: The egg whites give this pie a lighter, more delicate texture than traditional sweet potato pie
From a 1962 Home Economics Teachers cookbook
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 113.jpeg

recipes.title: Cream Cheese Pecan Pie (Elsah)
recipes.attribution: Cecily Brownstone, Associated Press Food Editor
recipes.description: A pecan pie with a layer of sweetened cream cheese beneath the pecan filling, from a small restaurant in Elsah, Illinois.

ingredients.prep_note: 1 for cream cheese layer, 3 for filling

instructions.text: In the large bowl of an electric mixer, at medium speed, beat together until smooth the cream cheese, 1 egg, 1/3 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
Spread over the bottom of the pastry shell.
Sprinkle with the pecans.
In the clean large bowl of the mixer, at medium speed, beat the remaining 3 eggs until frothy.
Add the corn syrup, 1/4 cup sugar, the salt and 1 teaspoon vanilla; beat until blended.
Gently pour the mixture over the pecans.
Bake in a preheated 375°F (190°C) oven until a knife inserted halfway between the center and edge comes out clean — 40 minutes.
Place on a wire rack to cool before cutting.

notes: From a small restaurant in Elsah, Illinois
The cream cheese layer adds richness and a tangy contrast to the sweet pecan filling
recipes.variant_notes: Published version from Elsah, IL restaurant via Cecily Brownstone/AP. Very similar concept to handwritten Mystery Pecan Pie.

recipes.title: Never-Fail Meringue
recipes.description: A foolproof meringue that cuts beautifully and never gets sticky, using a cornstarch stabilizer.

instructions.text: Blend cornstarch and cold water in saucepan.
Add boiling water and cook, stirring, until clear and thickened.
Let stand until completely cold.
With electric beater at high speed, beat egg whites until foamy.
Gradually add sugar and beat until stiff but not dry.
Turn mixer to low speed; add salt and vanilla.
Gradually beat in cold cornstarch mixture.
Turn mixer again to high speed and beat well.
Spread meringue over cooled pie filling, sealing edges well.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) about 10 minutes.
This meringue cuts beautifully and never gets sticky.

notes: The cornstarch stabilizes the meringue so it cuts cleanly
Requested by many readers from St. Petersburg, New Port Richey, Clearwater, Holiday, and Hudson areas

recipes.title: Karo Easy Pecan Pie
recipes.description: The classic Karo corn syrup pecan pie recipe — simple, traditional, and foolproof.

ingredients.item: Karo light or dark corn syrup

instructions.text: In large bowl stir first 5 ingredients until well blended.
Stir in pecans.
Pour into pie shell.
Bake in 350°F (175°C) oven 50 to 55 minutes or until knife inserted halfway between center and edge comes out clean.
Cool.

notes: Dark corn syrup gives a deeper, more molasses-like flavor; light gives a milder taste

recipes.title: Chocolate Pecan Pie
recipes.description: A chocolate variation of the classic Karo pecan pie with melted semisweet chocolate.

ingredients.item: Karo light or dark corn syrup

instructions.text: Follow recipe for Easy Pecan Pie.
Melt 4 squares (1 oz each) semisweet chocolate with margarine.
Stir chocolate mixture into filling before adding pecans.
Continue as directed.

notes: Adds a rich chocolate dimension to the classic pecan pie
recipes.variant_notes: Chocolate variation from same Karo recipe card

recipes.title: Pineapple Carrot Cake
recipes.description: A moist carrot cake loaded with crushed pineapple, coconut, and walnuts, topped with cream cheese frosting.

instructions.text: Sift flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt and cinnamon into large bowl.
Make a well in the center and add in order: sugar, oil, eggs and vanilla.
Beat with wooden spoon until smooth.
Stir in carrots, coconut, walnuts and pineapple until well blended.
Pour into greased and floured 9-by-13-inch baking pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes, or until center springs back when lightly pressed with fingertip. (Center will sink slightly.)
Cool completely in pan on wire rack.
For frosting: Beat cream cheese with butter in a medium bowl.
Beat in confectioners' sugar and vanilla.
Add milk, if necessary, to make frosting of spreading consistency.
Spread with cream cheese frosting. Store in refrigerator.

notes: Makes enough frosting for top of one cake

recipes.title: Rum Cake
recipes.description: A moist bundt cake made with pudding-in-the-mix cake mix and soaked with a buttery rum sauce.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C).
Generously grease a large Bundt pan.
Sprinkle the nuts on the bottom.
Beat remaining cake ingredients except sauce for 6 minutes on medium speed of electric mixer.
Pour over nuts on pan.
Bake for 55 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Prepare sauce about 10 minutes before the cake is done: In a saucepan, bring to a boil 1 stick margarine, 1 cup sugar, 1/4 cup rum and 1/4 cup water, stirring constantly. Boil slowly for 2 minutes.
Pour all of the sauce over cake still in pan.
Let sit until the sauce is well-absorbed, about 20 to 30 minutes.
Invert onto plate.

notes: Let the sauce absorb fully before inverting for best results

recipes.title: Pride of Kentucky Derby Pie
recipes.description: A rich bourbon-spiked chocolate chip and pecan pie with black walnuts, perfect for Derby Day.

instructions.text: Beat eggs and combine with sugar, syrup, bourbon, melted butter, chocolate chips and nuts.
Pour into pie shell.
Bake at 450°F (230°C) for 10 minutes.
Reduce heat to 350°F (175°C) and bake another 35 minutes.

notes: Black walnuts add a distinctive Kentucky flavor
Also called Derby Pie - a Kentucky tradition
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 938.jpeg

recipes.title: Another Derby Pie
recipes.description: A simpler version of Derby Pie with chocolate chips and pecans.

instructions.text: Combine 3 slightly beaten eggs, 1 cup light syrup, 1 teaspoon vanilla and 1/2 cup sugar.
Blend well, then stir in 1 cup broken pecans and 3/4 cup chocolate chips.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 40 to 45 minutes.

notes: Simpler version without bourbon or butter
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 938.jpeg
recipes.variant_notes: Simpler version from same clipping, without bourbon or butter

recipes.title: Pineapple Cheesecake in 15 Minutes
recipes.description: A quick no-bake cheesecake using Jell-O Pineapple Cream instant pudding and cream cheese.

instructions.text: Beat cream cheese until very soft.
Gradually blend in 1/2 cup milk until smooth and creamy.
Add remaining milk and pudding mix.
Beat slowly with egg beater 1 minute. (Do not overbeat.)
Pour into cool graham cracker crust.
Sprinkle graham cracker crumbs on top to make it extra crunchy.
Chill. That's all — really.

notes: For 'traditional' cheesecake, use Lemon Jell-O Pudding instead of Pineapple Cream
Must use Jell-O Pudding - recipe cannot be made with other brands or cooked pudding

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Chocolate Pie
recipes.description: A frozen chocolate pie loaded with chopped peanut butter cup candies.

ingredients.item: cold half and half, light cream, or milk
chocolate crumb or graham cracker crumb crust

instructions.text: Pour half and half into large mixing bowl.
Add instant pie filling mix and beat with wire whisk just until well-blended, about 1 minute.
Let stand 5 minutes.
Fold in whipped topping and chopped candies.
Spoon into crust.
Freeze until firm, about six hours or overnight.
Remove from freezer. Let stand about 10 minutes to soften before serving.
Store any leftover pie in freezer.

notes: Use your favorite peanut butter cups - Reese's work great

recipes.title: Impossible Pumpkin Pie
recipes.description: A self-crusting pumpkin pie that magically forms its own crust using Bisquick.

instructions.text: Grease 10-inch pie plate.
Combine ingredients and mix till smooth.
Pour into pie plate.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 50 to 55 minutes till knife inserted in center comes out clean.

notes: No crust needed - the Bisquick settles to the bottom and forms its own crust
Part of the 'Impossible Pie' family of recipes

recipes.title: Butterscotch Pie
recipes.description: A classic butterscotch cream pie with browned butter and brown sugar, topped with meringue.

instructions.text: Roll dough to 1/8-inch thickness. Transfer to 9-inch pie plate, trim and flute edges. Refrigerate 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 425°F.
Par-bake crust: Line with foil and pie weights. Bake 15-20 minutes until edges are light golden. Remove weights, bake 3-6 minutes more. Cool. Reduce oven to 350°F.
Make filling: Melt butter in saucepan. Whisk in flour until smooth, then stir in brown sugar. Whisk in milk and salt. Cook over medium-high heat until thickened and bubbly; cook 2 minutes more.

Temper eggs: Remove from heat. Slowly stream about 1 cup hot filling into beaten egg yolks while whisking. Return to pan, bring to gentle boil, cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat, whisk in vanilla. Pour into crust.
Make meringue: Beat egg whites and cream of tartar until soft peaks form. Gradually beat in sugar until stiff, glossy peaks form. Spread over hot filling, sealing edges.
Bake at 350°F for 12-15 minutes until meringue is golden. Cool 1 hour, then refrigerate at least 3 hours before serving.

notes: Top of recipe was cut off - some ingredient quantities unclear
Browning the butter is key to the butterscotch flavor

flags: Recipe completed from Taste of Home via web search

recipes.title: Spinach Balls
recipes.description: Crispy baked spinach and cheese balls, perfect as an appetizer.

instructions.text: Combine potatoes, spinach and eggs in a medium bowl. Mix with a mixer until well blended.
Season with nutmeg and cayenne pepper. Add cheese and 4 tablespoons of flour, stirring until incorporated.
Spread remaining flour on a glass plate seasoned with salt and pepper.
Form potato mixture into 1-inch balls, roll in flour to coat, and place on a cooking spray-coated baking sheet.
Refrigerate for 20 minutes. Preheat oven to 450°F.
Remove balls from refrigerator and lightly spray with cooking spray.
Bake 12 to 14 minutes until golden brown and firm.
Serve with ranch dressing and fresh lemon.

notes: Chilling before baking helps them hold their shape
Beginning of recipe was cut off

flags: Recipe completed from Idaho Potato Commission official recipe

recipes.title: Onion Flower Dip
recipes.description: A creamy, spicy dip perfect for serving with blooming onions or other fried appetizers.

instructions.text: Combine 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1 tablespoon chili powder and 1 1/2 teaspoon Cajun seasoning.
Blend well.

notes: Serve with Blooming Onion or other fried appetizers

recipes.title: Spiced Nuts
recipes.description: Savory roasted nuts with cumin, curry, cayenne, ginger, and cinnamon - perfect for gifts.

instructions.text: [Steps 1-2 cut off]
In a bowl, mix cumin, chili powder, curry powder, garlic salt, cayenne, ginger and cinnamon. Set aside.
Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over low heat. Add spice mixture and stir well. Simmer for 3 to 4 minutes to mellow flavors.
Place nuts in a bowl. Scrape spice mixture onto nuts and toss well.
Spread nuts in one layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes, shaking the pan once or twice.
Remove from oven. With a rubber spatula, toss nuts with any spices and oil on bottom of pan. If desired, sprinkle with coarse salt and a bit more garlic salt.
Let rest for 2 hours in a cool place. Store in airtight jars, or pack up as gifts.

notes: Beginning of recipe was cut off - spice quantities unknown
Great for holiday gift-giving
Typical spiced nuts bake at 300-350°F for 30-40 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes.

flags: Temperature inferred from standard spiced nuts recipes (300-350°F typical)
Some ingredient quantities still missing from original scan

recipes.title: Honey Roasted Bridge Mix
recipes.description: Sweet and cinnamon-spiced honey-glazed mixed nuts, perfect for card parties.

instructions.text: Combine honey, butter and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon in saucepan.
Bring mixture to boil and boil 2 minutes stirring constantly.
Pour honey mixture over nuts and mix until nuts are coated.
Spread on foil-lined cookie sheet or jelly roll pan.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) 10 to 15 minutes or until nuts are glazed and lightly brown.
Cool 20 to 30 minutes; remove from foil.
Combine sugar and remaining cinnamon; toss with glazed nuts to coat.

notes: Watch carefully - nuts can burn quickly once glazed

recipes.title: Classic Lemon Curd
recipes.description: A silky, tangy lemon spread perfect over fruit, gingerbread, scones, or biscuits.

instructions.text: In a non-stick saucepan, slightly beat the egg with the egg yolks.
Whisk in the lemon peel, juice and sugar.
Cut butter into bits and add to pan. A dash of salt is optional.
Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until mixture thickens, 5-8 minutes.
Serve warm or cold — over fresh fruit, gingerbread, scones or biscuits.

notes: Stir constantly to prevent curdling

recipes.title: Refrito Spread
recipes.description: A homemade bean dip with cumin, chili, and cheddar cheese.

ingredients.item: cooked, well-drained pinto, kidney or black beans
chopped green pepper or chili peppers

instructions.text: Mash the beans. You should end up with about a cup.
Chop the onion and saute with whole garlic cloves in oil.
When the onion is done, crush the garlic with a fork. Add the spices and the green pepper.
Cook until the pepper is softened and the spices are fragrant.
Remove from heat and cool slightly. Add beans and mix.
Add cheese and salt, and check the flavor.

notes: Use green chili peppers for more heat

recipes.title: Beef Jerky
recipes.description: Homemade beef jerky marinated overnight and slow-dried in the oven.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients and marinate in refrigerator for 12 hours.
Bake at 150°F (65°C) for 8 hours.

notes: Slice meat as thin as possible

recipes.title: Old Sour
recipes.source_note: Miami Spice by Steve Raichlen, Workman Publishing
recipes.description: The granddad of Floridian sauces - a Key West lime and chile condiment that improves with age.

ingredients.item: scotch bonnet chiles, bird peppers, datil peppers, or other hot chiles
ingredients.prep_note: whole for milder, sliced for hotter

ingredients.item: fresh Key lime juice or regular lime juice

instructions.text: Leave chiles whole for milder sauce; thinly slice for hotter sauce.
Combine all ingredients in a sterile jar and cover tightly.
Shake well to dissolve the salt.
Let stand for 1 week at room temperature before using.
Stir or shake before seasoning meat or seafood.

notes: A staple in the Key West pantry
Will keep without refrigeration for months and gets better with age
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 132.jpeg

recipes.title: Swiss Mocha Coffee Mix
recipes.description: A homemade instant mocha coffee mix - makes a great gift.

instructions.text: Combine ingredients and put into blender or food processor.
Process until powdered.
To make coffee, put 2 rounded teaspoons into cup of hot water.

notes: Makes a great homemade gift

recipes.title: Macaroon Pie (Cracker Version)
recipes.description: A unique crustless pie with crushed saltines, dates, pecans, and chocolate chips.

instructions.text: Crush saltines to form fine crumbs.
Mix with dates, pecans, chocolate chips, zest, sugar, salt and almond extract.
Beat the egg whites until stiff, then fold in quickly.
Spread the mixture in a buttered 9-inch pie pan.
Bake in a 300°F (150°C) oven for 45 minutes or until firm and golden.
Serve with whipped cream.

notes: Different from the coconut-based Macaroon Pie

recipes.title: Super Nuts
recipes.description: Glazed nuts with Drambuie liqueur and warm spices.

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine nuts, sugar, liqueur, cinnamon, cloves and nutmeg; stir well.
Pour mixture onto lightly buttered baking sheet.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) 8 minutes, stirring often, until liquid almost evaporates.
Pour onto another lightly buttered baking sheet.
Separate with a fork; cool completely.

notes: Can substitute other liqueurs like Amaretto

recipes.title: Molly's Fat Free Marshmallow Treats
recipes.description: A lighter version of classic rice cereal treats using butter flavor sprinkles.

ingredients.item: Molly McButter Natural Butter Flavor Sprinkles

instructions.text: Pre-measure ingredients.
Melt marshmallows over low heat (or microwave on HIGH 2-3 minutes) until smooth.
Remove from heat. Add Molly McButter Sprinkles. Mix well.
Add cereal; stir in quickly until well coated.
Press mixture evenly into 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan coated with cooking spray.
Cool. Cut into squares.

notes: Work quickly once marshmallows are melted

recipes.title: Holiday Haystacks
recipes.description: Festive no-bake chocolate candy with crispy chow mein noodles, raisins, and pecans.

instructions.text: Line 2 baking sheets with wax paper.
Melt chocolate in top of double boiler over barely simmering water.
Mix in raisins and pecans.
With rubber spatula immediately scrape chocolate mixture into large bowl. Quickly toss in noodles to coat completely.
Mound rounded tablespoonfuls on baking sheets.
Decorate half with colored sprinkles before chocolate sets.
Allow to set completely in cool place.
Remove from wax paper and store in airtight container or package for gifts.

notes: Work quickly before chocolate sets
Great for holiday gift-giving

recipes.title: Haystacks (Coconut)
recipes.description: Buttery no-bake candy with coconut and corn flakes.

instructions.text: Stir butter, sugar and milk until well blended.
Cook mixture over medium heat until it reaches a full boil. Boil 2 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in flaked coconut, corn flakes, nuts and vanilla.
With 2 teaspoons, drop mixture onto a buttered cookie sheet.
Let stand until set.

notes: Different from chocolate haystacks - this version is butterscotch-style
recipes.variant_notes: Butterscotch-coconut version vs chocolate-chow mein version

recipes.title: Potato Pancakes
recipes.attribution: Eleanor Persky (handed down to Susan Cohen)
recipes.description: Traditional potato pancakes with matzo meal, passed down through the family. Best served with hot corned beef and homemade apple sauce.

instructions.text: Peel and cube potatoes. Place in a food processor with ice water and lemon juice and process until finely grated.
Drain well in fine strainer.
Combine remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Add grated potatoes.
Heat 1/4 inch oil in a large skillet.
Drop batter by heaping tablespoonfuls to form 2 1/2-inch pancakes.
Over medium heat, fry for 1 1/2-2 minutes per side or until brown.
Drain well on paper towels.
Keep warm in a 200°F (95°C) oven until all pancakes are done.

notes: Susan Cohen writes: 'We like these with hot corned beef and homemade apple sauce.'
Use ice water to prevent potatoes from browning

recipes.title: Hot Cross Buns
recipes.description: Traditional Easter sweet rolls with currants and a lemon glaze cross.

instructions.text: In mixer bowl, combine warm milk and yeast; stir to dissolve.
Beat in butter, sugar and egg.
Sift flour with salt and mace; add to mixture in bowl and mix on medium speed of mixer with dough hook or knead by hand on lightly floured surface until dough is smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.
Work in currants.
Cover and proof dough in warm place until doubled in bulk.
Lightly grease a 9- by 13-inch baking pan.
Turn dough onto lightly floured surface and divide in quarters. Shape each quarter into a 6-inch log; cut each log into 6 (1-inch) pieces.
Roll each piece into a round dough ball with palm of hand and arrange in prepared baking pan in rows of four across and six down.
Cover and let rise until doubled.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C); place buns on middle shelf of oven and immediately reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C); bake 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and done.
To make glaze for crosses: Stir powdered sugar with lemon juice and rind until smooth.
With tip of teaspoon, drizzle a line of glaze across each row of buns and another down to form a cross on each bun.

notes: Traditional Easter bread
Can use mace or cinnamon for spice

recipes.title: Orange-Oatmeal Scones
recipes.description: Hearty whole wheat scones with oats, orange, and golden raisins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease a 9-inch cake or pie pan with the shortening, set aside.
In mixing bowl, with finger tips mix whole wheat flour with oats, sugar, baking powder and salt, pulverizing any lumps of brown sugar.
Rub butter into flour-oatmeal mixture until incorporated.
In glass measuring cup, whisk orange rind and juice with yogurt, beat in egg, then stir into flour-oat mixture to make soft dough.
Mix in raisins.
Pat dough into prepared pan, cut through with paring knife to make 12 triangles.
Bake on middle shelf of oven 15 to 20 minutes, or until brown and crusty.
Cool 5 to 10 minutes in pan on rack, then cut into triangles as marked and serve, warm or at room temperature, with orange marmalade if desired.
Wrap leftovers tightly in plastic film for use in two days; or wrap in foil and freeze.

notes: Good with orange marmalade
Can be frozen for later use
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 142.jpeg

flags.issue: Left edge partially cut off - quantities inferred from context

recipes.title: Raisin Brown Bread
recipes.description: Old-fashioned steamed-style brown bread baked in soup cans with raisins, cornmeal, and wheat germ.

instructions.text: Combine raisins and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer a few minutes; set off heat.
Meanwhile, in large mixer bowl, beat together the sugar and butter.
Beat in the egg and vanilla.
Add raisin liquid. Stir in flour, cornmeal, wheat germ, soda and salt.
Fold in raisins.
Clean 5 (10 ounce) soup cans; grease and flour.
Fill cans about halfway, only slightly more than half.
Place cans on a cookie sheet, spaced well apart.
Bake at 300°F (150°C), a slow oven, for 1 hour or until the loaves test done with a cake tester or long straw.
Let cans cool a few minutes before loosening the breads with a thin spatula.
Invert cans and tap lightly to remove breads.

notes: Unique baking method using soup cans
Low and slow baking produces moist, dense bread

recipes.title: Blueberry Coffee Cake
recipes.source_note: Eating Well, The Magazine of Food & Health, 1993 (from 'Have Your Cake and Eat It Too' cookbook)
recipes.description: A healthier coffee cake with fresh blueberries and a walnut-cinnamon topping.

ingredients.prep_note: picked over, rinsed and gently patted dry, or frozen unsweetened blueberries

instructions.text: [PARTIAL] ...preheat to 400°F (200°C). Coat the inside of an 8-inch square pan.

[PARTIAL] ...milk, yogurt and oil. Set a sieve on top of the bowl and measure flour, sifting dry ingredients together while sifting them into the liquid mixture. Stir until the flour is barely visible.
Fold in the blueberries. Turn the batter into the prepared pan.
Stir together sugar, walnuts and cinnamon; sprinkle over the batter.
Bake 35-40 minutes (longer if frozen berries are used), or until the top is golden brown and a cake tester comes out clean.
Let cool in the pan on a rack for 10 minutes. Cut into squares and serve.

notes: From 'Have Your Cake and Eat It Too' cookbook published by William Morrow, 1993
Can use frozen unsweetened blueberries - increase baking time

flags.issue: Left edge cut off - cake batter ingredients partially missing. Topping ingredients complete.
candidates: Likely includes flour, sugar, milk, yogurt, oil, egg, baking powder

recipes.title: Best-Ever Butter Cookies
recipes.description: Classic rolled butter cookies with orange juice and a sweet vanilla frosting.

instructions.text: In large mixing bowl, combine 1 cup butter, sugar and egg. Beat at medium speed until creamy.
Reduce speed to low; add flour, baking powder, orange juice and vanilla. Beat until well mixed.
Cover; refrigerate until firm (2 to 3 hours).
Heat oven to 400°F (200°C).
On lightly floured surface roll out dough, half at a time (keeping remaining dough refrigerated), to 1/4-inch thickness.
Cut with 2-inch cookie cutters.
Place 1-inch apart on cookie sheets.
Bake 6 to 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.
Cool completely.
In small mixing bowl combine confectioners' sugar, 1/3 cup butter and vanilla.
Beat at low speed, adding enough milk for desired spreading consistency.
If desired, tint frosting with food coloring.
Frost and decorate when cooled.

notes: Dough must be chilled before rolling
Can tint frosting with food coloring for holidays

recipes.title: Toasted Oatmeal Cookies
recipes.source_note: A 'Golden Oldie' Recipe from Marilyn Krueger
recipes.description: Down-home-flavored cookies with toasted oats for extra nutty flavor. Freeze well and remain crisp.

instructions.text: In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter until lightly browned.
Add oats, stirring constantly until golden, about 8-10 minutes. Remove from the heat; cool.
Combine flour and baking soda; set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, beat brown sugar, eggs and vanilla until light.
Stir in dry ingredients and peanuts until well blended.
Let stand for 15 minutes.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 10 minutes or until golden.
Remove to wire rack to cool.

notes: Toasting the oats gives them extra nutty flavor
Cookies freeze well and remain crisp
Store in airtight containers

recipes.title: Criss-Cross Cookies
recipes.description: Classic peanut butter cookies with the signature fork criss-cross pattern.

instructions.text: Cream together peanut butter and butter.
Add sugars gradually and cream together until light and fluffy.
Add water, vanilla, and egg; beat well.
Mix together flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt; stir into peanut butter mixture.
Shape into 1-inch balls and place about 2 inches apart on cookie sheets.
Flatten with a fork in criss-cross pattern.
Bake in a 375°F (190°C) oven for 10 to 12 minutes.

notes: Natural peanut butter gives best flavor
The criss-cross pattern is traditional for peanut butter cookies
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 148.jpeg

recipes.title: Potato Starter
recipes.description: Sourdough starter made with instant potato flakes. Ferments for 2-5 days before use.

instructions.text: Dissolve yeast in 1/2 cup warm water in medium mixing bowl.
Stir in 1 cup warm water, sugar and potato flakes.
Let mixture sit out all day, then refrigerate for 2-5 days.
Remove from refrigerator and feed again with 1 cup water, 2/3 cup sugar and 3 tablespoons instant potato flakes.
Stir well and keep at room temperature 10-12 hours.
Now you are ready to use 1 cup of the starter to make bread.
Return the rest to the refrigerator and feed again with ingredients above and keep at room temperature another day before making your next batch.

notes: Marina's note: 'You do NOT have to keep baking bread every two weeks for the rest of your life. You can take the starter out, feed it and keep only what you normally would back in the fridge, throwing the rest away. You do feel guilty though.'

recipes.title: Sourdough Potato Bread
recipes.description: Soft, tender bread made with potato starter. Makes excellent loaves or rolls.

instructions.text: In mixing bowl, combine starter, water, oil, salt and sugar.
With dough hook or wooden spoon gradually beat in enough flour to make a soft but workable dough.
Knead with dough hook or by hand for about 8 minutes on a floured board until satiny.
Turn dough into a greased bowl, cover and let rise until doubled.
Punch dough down; shape into loaves and place in lightly greased 8- to 9-inch loaf pans. Or form into rolls and arrange on lightly greased baking sheets.
Cover and let rise again until doubled.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) 18 to 20 minutes for 2-inch rolls, or 30 to 40 minutes for loaves.
Note: If desired, brush loaves or rolls with a beaten egg before placing in oven. Sprinkle top with poppy seeds, oatmeal or sesame seeds.

recipes.pan_size: 8- to 9-inch loaf pans or baking sheets
notes: Uses Potato Starter recipe
For: Barbara Buhrer of Bayonet Point, From: Dorothy Snidow of St. Petersburg

recipes.title: Almost Sugar-Free Apple-Walnut Breakfast Muffins
recipes.description: Healthy whole grain muffins sweetened with honey and fruit. Includes a homemade nutritious quick bread mix.

ingredients.prep_note: found in specialty food stores, for mix

instructions.text: For Nutritious Quick Bread Mix: Combine whole wheat flour, soy flour, salt, dry milk and baking powder. Store in airtight container.
For muffins: Combine all ingredients and mix until well-moistened. Do not over-mix or muffins will be tough.
Fill greased muffin tins two-thirds full.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) 15 to 20 minutes. Do not overbake.
For a lighter texture, fold in 1 stiffly beaten egg white.

notes: Variation: Use 2/3 cup grated carrots and 1/3 cup drained crushed pineapple instead of chopped apples
The quick bread mix makes multiple batches

recipes.title: Irresistible Peanut Butter Cookies
recipes.description: Classic peanut butter cookies made with Crisco shortening for a tender texture.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Combine peanut butter, Crisco, light brown sugar, milk and vanilla in large bowl.
Beat at medium speed of electric mixer 'til well blended.
Add egg.
Beat just until blended.
Combine flour, salt and baking soda.
Add to creamed mixture at low speed.
Mix just until blended.
Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls 2 in. apart onto ungreased baking sheet. Variation: Flatten slightly in criscross pattern with tines of fork.
Bake at 375°F for 7 to 8 minutes, or until set and just beginning to brown.
Cool 2 min. on baking sheet before removing to kitchen counter top.

notes: From Joy of Cooking
Crisco gives tender texture

recipes.title: Easter Babka
recipes.description: Traditional Eastern European yeast bread with golden raisins and sliced almonds, baked in a bundt pan.

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar in large bowl. Beat 4 egg yolks until thick and lemon-colored. Stir into creamed mixture.
Soften yeast in 1/4 cup water. Use very warm water (115°F) for dry yeast; use lukewarm (80-90°F) for compressed.
Add to mixture with the lemon rind. Beat in salt and cinnamon.
Add milk and flour to make a soft dough.
Stir in raisins. Knead in bowl until dough no longer sticks to the hands.
Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk (about 2 hours).
Butter a 3-quart bundt pan and shape dough to fit it. Put dough in pan, cover and let rise again until doubled (about 1 1/2 hours).
Beat remaining egg yolk slightly with 2 tablespoons of water. Brush on raised dough and sprinkle with almonds.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 30 minutes or until it tests done.
Cool on wire rack.

notes: Traditional Easter bread in Eastern European communities
Can use compressed or dry yeast

recipes.title: Chili Cheese Herb Biscuits
recipes.description: Quick drop biscuits with cheese, green chilies, and an herb butter topping.

ingredients.item: Colby, Monterey Jack or Cheddar cheese

instructions.text: In medium bowl, combine biscuit & baking mix, cheese, milk and chilies with fork until moistened.
Drop by spoonfuls onto baking sheet coated with nonstick spray.
Bake at 450°F (230°C) for 10 to 13 minutes or until light brown.
Combine butter, parsley and garlic powder; brush on biscuits.
Serve warm.

notes: Similar to Red Lobster Cheddar Bay Biscuits with a Southwestern twist
The green chilies add mild heat

recipes.title: Lemon Bars
recipes.description: Classic tangy-sweet lemon bars with a buttery shortbread crust.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Make the bottom layer: In a large mixing bowl, combine butter, sugar and flour. Beat with an electric mixer until combined.
Press mixture into the bottom of an ungreased, 9-by-13-inch baking pan.
Place in oven; bake 20 minutes, or until just turning brown.
While it bakes, make topping: In a mixing bowl, whisk eggs. In another bowl, mix flour with sugar. Stir this into the egg mixture. Add lemon juice and stir.
Pour over bottom layer. Return pan to oven; bake 20-30 minutes more, until topping feels firm to the touch.
Cool bars before cutting, and refrigerate.

notes: To make the lemon juice: cut 4-5 lemons in half, squeeze juice into bowl, strain to remove seeds. Measure 1/2 cup.

recipes.title: American Hamantaschen Cookie Dough
recipes.description: Jewish triangle-shaped cookies traditionally filled with poppy seed or fruit filling for Purim.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs, adding the sugar as you beat. Continue beating, adding the oil and orange juice.
In another bowl, combine the dry ingredients, mixing well.
Add to beaten egg mixture. Dough will be a little sticky - don't add too much flour or cookies will be hard.
Roll, cut into rounds, add scant teaspoon of filling for each, fold three sides to form triangle.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) until lightly golden.

notes: Traditional Purim cookie
Dough makes about 100 cookies

recipes.title: Oatmeal Carrot Cookies
recipes.source_note: American Heart Association Cookbook, fifth edition, 1991
recipes.description: Heart-healthy bar cookies with carrots, oatmeal, and raisins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly spray 7.5 x 11.5 x 2-inch pan with vegetable oil.
Cover raisins in a small bowl with boiling water. Soak 15 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Cream together margarine and brown sugar until fluffy. Add egg. Beat well.
Add carrots, cinnamon, nutmeg and lemon rind. Mix well.
In another bowl, stir together flour, oatmeal and baking powder; add to carrot mixture.
Add vanilla, mix well and fold in drained raisins.
Pour into prepared pan. Bake 20-25 minutes. Let cool.
Sprinkle lightly with confectioners' sugar. Cut into 24 bars.

notes: From the American Heart Association Cookbook
20% Daily Value for Vitamin A per serving

recipes.title: Beignets
recipes.source_note: Recipe from Gene Groner Jr. of Largo
recipes.description: Classic New Orleans-style yeast-raised beignets. The secret is using canned evaporated milk.

instructions.text: Put warm water into a large bowl, sprinkle in dry yeast and stir until dissolved.
Add sugar, salt, eggs and evaporated milk. Gradually stir in 4 cups flour and beat with wooden spoon until smooth.
Beat in shortening, then add remaining flour, working it in with fingers when too stiff to stir.
Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
Roll dough out to 1/8-inch thickness, cut into 2.5 x 3.5-inch rectangles.
Preheat oil in deep fryer to 360°F (180°C). Fry 3-4 at a time until puffed and golden brown on both sides.
Drain on paper towels, keep warm in 200°F (95°C) oven.
Sprinkle heavily with confectioners' sugar and serve hot.

notes: Canned evaporated milk is the secret to the special flavor
Must refrigerate overnight

recipes.title: Beignets (French Fritters)
recipes.description: Quick version of French fritters without yeast, served with lemon sauce.

instructions.text: Combine water, butter and flour in a saucepan and boil and stir over low heat for about 5 minutes.
Remove pan from heat. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Beat batter 3 minutes after each egg.
Add vanilla.
Drop batter from a teaspoon into deep fat heated to 365°F (185°C). Cook until golden.
Drain and dust with confectioners' sugar. Serve with Lemon Sauce or gooseberry preserves.

notes: Quick version - no yeast needed
Similar to choux pastry technique

recipes.title: Lemon Sauce
recipes.description: Sweet citrus sauce for French fritters or other desserts.

instructions.text: Combine first three ingredients in top of double boiler.
Stir over, not in, boiling water until thickened.
Remove sauce from heat and stir in remaining ingredients.

notes: Can substitute orange for lemon
Serve with French Fritters

recipes.title: Funnel Cakes
recipes.description: Pennsylvania Dutch fair-style fried cakes made by drizzling batter through a funnel.

instructions.text: Beat milk with egg. Blend dry ingredients and gradually add milk mixture, beating until smooth.
Holding finger over bottom of funnel (3/8-1/2 inch opening), fill with batter.
Hold funnel near surface of 375°F (190°C) oil, remove finger and drizzle batter in spiral from center outward to form 3-inch cake.
Fry until puffy and golden brown, turning once.
Drain on paper. Dust with confectioners' sugar or drizzle with molasses. Serve at once.

notes: Pennsylvania Dutch tradition
Use funnel with 3/8-1/2 inch opening

recipes.title: Mexicana Cornbread
recipes.description: Southwestern-style cornbread with cheese, green chiles, and optional avocado. Can be baked in flowerpots!

instructions.text: In a large bowl, stir together cornmeal, flour, baking powder, salt, cumin, and paprika.
In another bowl, lightly beat egg, stir in milk, oil, avocado (if used), bell pepper, chiles, and cheese.
Stir milk mixture into dry ingredients just to moisten evenly.
Pour into greased 8-inch square pan OR 6 greased 1-cup flowerpots (line holes with greased foil).
Bake at 400°F (200°C): 35 minutes for pan, 15-20 minutes for flowerpots, until pick comes out clean.
Cool 5 minutes, turn out onto rack. Wrap airtight.

notes: Can bake in flowerpots for gift-giving!
Freeze bread without avocado up to 1 month

recipes.title: Reese's Chewy Chocolate Cookies
recipes.description: Rich chocolate cookies loaded with peanut butter chips and optional nuts.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In large bowl, beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla; beat well.
Stir together flour, cocoa, baking soda and salt; gradually add to butter mixture.
Stir in peanut butter chips and nuts if desired.
Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake 8-9 minutes. (Do not overbake - cookies will be soft.)
Cool on cookie sheet 1 minute; remove to wire rack.

notes: Do not overbake - cookies should be soft
CHEWY DOUBLE CHOCOLATE variation: Sub 2 cups (12-oz) Semi-Sweet Chips for peanut butter chips
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 161.jpeg

recipes.title: Hershey's Mini Kiss Peanut Blossoms
recipes.description: Classic peanut butter cookies topped with Hershey's Kiss chocolates.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Beat shortening and peanut butter until blended. Add sugars; beat until fluffy.
Add egg, milk and vanilla; beat well.
Stir together flour, baking soda and salt; gradually add to peanut butter mixture.
Shape dough into 1-inch balls. Roll in granulated sugar; place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned.
Immediately place 3 Mini Kisses on top of each cookie, pressing down slightly.
Remove to wire rack. Cool completely.

notes: Press Mini Kisses onto cookies immediately after baking while still warm
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 161.jpeg

recipes.title: Beer Bread
recipes.description: Incredibly simple 5-ingredient bread made with beer. Best with Pilsner Urquell.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease one loaf pan.
Place flour, sugar and salt in food processor. Turn on and off to mix dry ingredients.
Turn on food processor and while running, add beer.
Pour batter in loaf pan, top with melted butter.
Bake for 45 to 50 minutes.

notes: Pilsner Urquell recommended but any beer works
Food processor method is quick but can mix by hand

recipes.title: Oly-Bollen (Doughnuts from Holland)
recipes.source_note: Parade magazine, from Parade's Test Kitchen
recipes.description: Traditional Dutch doughnut balls with golden raisins and candied orange peel, rolled in sugar.

instructions.text: Scald milk; stir in brown sugar and salt; cool to lukewarm.
Measure warm water into large warm bowl; stir in yeast to dissolve.
Stir in milk mixture, egg, flour, nutmeg and cinnamon.
Beat vigorously until batter is elastic and falls in sheets from spoon.
Stir in raisins and orange peel; mix well. Cover; let rise in warm place (85°F) until doubled - about 1 hour.
Heat oil to 350°F (175°C). Using two spoons, shape dough into 1-inch balls; drop into hot oil.
Fry about 3 minutes or until golden, turning once.
Drain on paper towels; roll while warm in granulated sugar.

notes: Traditional Dutch treat also called oliebollen
Can reheat in warm oven wrapped in foil

recipes.title: Sicilian Bread Pie
recipes.source_note: Newspaper recipe exchange, from Italian Regional Cooking cookbook, for Marge Molendi of Largo
recipes.description: Rustic Italian bread pie filled with ham, cheese, anchovies, tomatoes, and olives.

ingredients.prep_note: cut in small pieces, wash if salted

instructions.text: Defrost dough and add olive oil; knead well.
Divide dough into 2 equal portions. Roll into 2 rounds 1/2-inch thick.
Brush round baking pan with olive oil; cover with 1 round of dough.
[INFERRED] Layer cheese, ham, anchovies, tomatoes, onion, and olives over dough. Season with salt and pepper.
[INFERRED] Top with second round of dough; crimp edges to seal.
[INFERRED] Brush top with olive oil. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 30-35 minutes until golden.

notes: Caciocavallo is an Italian cheese; provolone or mozzarella may be substituted
Instructions partially cut off - steps 4-6 inferred from Italian Regional Cooking standard method

flags.issue: Instructions cut off in original scan

recipes.title: Cheddar Apple Bread
recipes.description: Sweet and savory quick bread with sharp cheddar cheese, fresh apples, and cinnamon.

ingredients.item: Kraft 100% Natural Shredded Sharp Cheddar Cheese

instructions.text: Combine dry ingredients.
Add combined eggs, milk and margarine; mix well.
Stir in remaining ingredients.
Spoon into well greased and floured 9 × 5-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C), 65 to 70 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.
Let stand 5 minutes; remove from pan.

notes: Let bread cool before slicing for cleaner cuts
Sharp cheddar provides best flavor contrast with apples

recipes.title: Lowfat Fudgy Brownies
recipes.description: Rich chocolate brownies made healthier with prune puree instead of butter.

ingredients.item: prune puree or prepared prune butter

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Coat an 8-inch square baking pan with vegetable cooking spray; set aside.
Cut chocolate into 1-inch pieces and place in heat-proof bowl. Set over low heat in small skillet containing 1/2 inch simmering water.
Stir occasionally just until chocolate is melted. Remove from heat; set aside.
In mixer bowl combine all ingredients except flour and walnuts; beat to blend thoroughly.
Mix in flour.
Spread batter in prepared pan; sprinkle with walnuts.
Bake about 30 minutes until springy to the touch about 2 inches around edges.
Cool on rack. Cut into 1 1/2-inch squares.

notes: Prune puree replaces fat while keeping brownies moist and fudgy
Center should be slightly soft when done - will firm as it cools

recipes.title: Choc Chip Cookies (Norma)
recipes.description: Norma's family oatmeal chocolate chip cookies made with a blender method.

instructions.text: Mix with blender: oleo, eggs, sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, and hot tap water.
Add flour, salt, and baking soda; mix well.
Stir in old fashioned oats, chocolate chips, and chopped nuts.
Drop by 1/2 teaspoon onto baking sheets.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 8-10 minutes.

notes: HANDWRITTEN family recipe from Norma
The blender method creates smooth dough quickly
Hot water helps dissolve sugars

recipes.title: Raisin-Nut Bran Muffins
recipes.description: Hearty whole grain muffins with oats, bran, and your choice of nuts and dried fruit.

instructions.text: Lightly oil 12 muffin cups and dust with a little oat bran.
Put oats and oat bran in large mixing bowl. Combine flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt in a sifter and sift into oats.
Add milk, oil, egg yolk and honey; mix well with a wooden spoon.
Stir in nuts and fruit or raisins.
In a small bowl, beat the 3 egg whites until stiff with an electric mixer at high speed.
Fold gently into batter.
Fill muffin cups with batter and bake at 400°F (200°C) for 25 minutes.
Cool on wire rack.

notes: Beating egg whites separately creates lighter muffins
Use any combination of nuts and dried fruit you prefer

recipes.title: Lowfat Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.description: Healthier chocolate chip cookies using prune puree instead of butter.

ingredients.item: prune puree or prepared prune butter

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Coat baking sheet with vegetable cooking spray; set aside.
In large bowl beat prune puree or butter, sugars, egg whites and vanilla to blend thoroughly.
