In small bowl mix flour, baking soda and salt. Stir dry ingredients into prune mixture; mix completely.
Stir in chocolate pieces.
Drop tablespoonfuls onto prepared baking sheets; flatten slightly.
Bake about 10 minutes until lightly browned around edges.
Remove to racks to cool completely.

recipes.pan_size: Baking sheets, coated with cooking spray
notes: Prune puree keeps cookies moist while reducing fat
Do not overbake - cookies will firm as they cool

recipes.title: Flea-Flicker Corn Bread
recipes.description: Savory cornbread loaded with Italian sausage, creamed corn, scallions, and cheddar cheese.

instructions.text: In large skillet, over medium heat, cook sausage until done, stirring to break up meat; drain on paper towels.
In large bowl, combine cornmeal, flour, baking powder, baking soda and sugar.
In small bowl, beat egg, milk, corn and margarine; stir into dry ingredients just until moistened.
Stir in scallions and half sausage.
Spread batter into greased 9-by-9-by-2-inch baking pan; sprinkle with remaining sausage and cheese.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden.
Cut into squares and serve warm.

notes: Football-themed name - great for game day!
Use sweet or hot sausage per preference

recipes.title: Reese's Peanut Butter Bars
recipes.description: Rich peanut butter cookie bars topped with chocolate chips - like a giant Reese's cup in bar form.

ingredients.item: Hershey's Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips or Milk Chocolate Chips

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease 13×9×2-inch baking pan.
Melt butter. Add peanut butter; stir until melted.
Stir in sugar and vanilla. Add eggs; with spoon, stir until well blended.
Add flour, baking powder and salt; stir until blended.
Stir in chocolate chips. Spread batter into prepared pan.
Bake 35 minutes or until top is golden brown and edges are firm.
Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Cut into bars.

notes: Add ice cream and top with Hershey's Syrup to make a Super Sundae!
Can use semi-sweet or milk chocolate chips

recipes.title: Jam Thumbprint Cookies
recipes.description: Healthier thumbprint cookies with whole-wheat flour, light butter, and fat-free cream cheese.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly coat two baking sheets with nonstick vegetable-oil spray.
Combine flours and walnuts; set aside.
In a large bowl, cream together light butter, cream cheese and sugar.
Add vanilla and stir in flour mixture.
Shape dough into 1-inch balls. Press centers with thumb; fill depression with about 1/2 teaspoon jam.
Set cookies on baking sheets, about 2-inches apart.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes, or until light golden. Let cool on wire rack.

recipes.pan_size: Baking sheets, coated with cooking spray
notes: Healthier version using light butter and fat-free cream cheese
Use any flavor jam or preserves you prefer

recipes.title: Heath Bar Cookies
recipes.source_note: Newspaper clipping, Marian Binney of Clearwater mentioned
recipes.description: Addictive toffee bark made with saltine crackers, butter-brown sugar caramel, and chocolate - often called 'Christmas Crack'.

instructions.text: Cover cookie sheet with heavy-duty foil. Arrange saltine crackers close together on foil. Fill in spaces with broken crackers.
In saucepan, bring butter and brown sugar to a boil and boil 1 minute, stirring.
Pour over saltines and spread to coat.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 8 minutes.
Sprinkle chocolate chips over crackers. Wait a minute until softened and spread with a knife.
Sprinkle chopped nuts over top.
Refrigerate until hard. Break into pieces and store in airtight container in refrigerator.

recipes.pan_size: Cookie sheet lined with heavy-duty foil
notes: Also known as 'Christmas Crack' or 'Saltine Toffee'
Marian Binney of Clearwater makes a similar recipe using graham crackers

recipes.title: Orange-Raisin-Pecan Bread
recipes.description: Moist quick bread bursting with orange flavor, raisins, and pecans.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Combine ingredients in order listed. Mix just until blended.
Pour into greased 9-by-5-inch pan.
Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until top is nicely browned and pick inserted into center comes out clean.
Cool in pan 10 minutes. Turn out of pan onto rack to cool completely.
Wrap in plastic wrap or foil.

notes: Let bread cool completely before slicing for best texture
Great toasted with butter

recipes.title: Cornflake Macaroons
recipes.description: Light meringue-style cookies with cornflakes, coconut, and almond extract.

instructions.text: Beat egg whites until soft peaks form.
Add salt and sugar gradually and beat until stiff.
Fold in remaining ingredients.
Drop by teaspoonful onto greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: Egg whites must be at room temperature for best volume
Don't overbake - cookies should be golden, not dark

recipes.title: Slow-Cooker Chicken Tortilla Soup
recipes.description: A quick, no-fuss version of chicken tortilla soup - put everything in the slow cooker and turn it on. Garnish with baked corn tortilla strips!
recipes.cook_time: 8 hours (slow cooker) or 3-4 hours on High

instructions.text: Place chicken, tomatoes, enchilada sauce, onion, green chiles, and garlic into a slow cooker. Pour in water and chicken broth, and season with cumin, chili powder, salt, pepper, and bay leaf. Stir in corn and cilantro.
Cover, and cook on Low setting for 6 to 8 hours or on High setting for 3 to 4 hours.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Lightly brush both sides of tortillas with oil. Cut tortillas into strips, then spread on a baking sheet.
Bake in preheated oven until crisp, about 10 to 15 minutes. To serve, sprinkle tortilla strips over soup.

notes: 4-star rated recipe on Allrecipes
Can use rotisserie chicken for convenience
Remove bay leaf before serving

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Pie
recipes.attribution: Paula H. Deen, The Lady & Sons restaurant, Savannah, GA
recipes.source_note: Los Angeles Daily News feature by Natalie Haughton, from 'The Lady & Sons Just Desserts' cookbook
recipes.description: Paula Deen's creamy Southern sweet potato pie with cream cheese.

instructions.text: In bowl of an electric mixer, beat cream cheese and sweet potatoes together. Add sugar and half-and-half; continue to beat until mixture is fluffy.
Add melted butter and eggs; mix well.
Beat in cinnamon and vanilla until well-mixed.
Pour into unbaked pie shell.
Bake in center of a preheated 350°F (175°C) oven 50 to 60 minutes or until set.
Serve with dollop of whipped cream.

notes: From Paula Deen's Savannah restaurant The Lady & Sons
Can use fresh mashed sweet potatoes if preferred

recipes.title: Chocolate Bourbon Pecan Cake
recipes.attribution: Paula H. Deen, The Lady & Sons restaurant, Savannah, GA
recipes.source_note: Los Angeles Daily News feature by Natalie Haughton, from 'The Lady & Sons Just Desserts' cookbook
recipes.description: Rich flourless chocolate cake with bourbon and pecans, topped with chocolate ganache.

ingredients.item: semisweet chocolate squares OR semisweet chocolate chips

instructions.text: To make batter, melt chocolate and butter in top of a double boiler over slightly simmering water (don't let top pan touch water). Remove from heat, leaving pot with chocolate over water; set aside.

Whisk egg yolks and 1/4 cup sugar in a metal mixing bowl, place bowl over slightly simmering water and whisk while heating to 140°F (yolks will feel warm to the touch). Remove from heat and beat yolk-sugar mixture with an electric mixer to ribbon stage. (When you lift beaters, mixture will flow back onto surface like a ribbon.)
Add bourbon to chocolate mixture, then fold yolk-sugar mixture into chocolate mixture.
Mix flour with pecans and fold into chocolate mixture. Using electric mixer, beat egg whites and remaining 1/4 cup sugar to form soft peaks, then fold into chocolate mixture.
Turn batter into greased and floured 9-inch springform pan, spreading evenly.
Bake in preheated 325°F (165°C) oven 20 to 25 minutes (cake should test done with a toothpick — but dry).
Allow cake to cool in pan, then place in freezer for at least 2 hours. Once it's frozen, remove sides of springform pan. Invert cake onto wire rack and remove bottom of springform pan.

To make ganache: bring cream to a boil and pour over chocolate chips in a bowl. Whisk until completely smooth. Set wire rack containing cake onto a sheet pan with sides. Pour lukewarm ganache over cake, coating completely and repouring if necessary to cover well. Gently jiggle wire rack to help drain excess ganache. Ganache will lose its shine when set. Remove cake from wire rack with a wide spatula and place on a serving plate.

notes: Must freeze cake before unmolding and glazing
Bourbon can be omitted if preferred, add 1 tsp vanilla instead
From Paula Deen's Lady & Sons restaurant

recipes.title: Broccoli Spaghetti Parmesana
recipes.source_note: Mann's Broccoli Wokly product recipe card
recipes.description: Quick garlic pasta with broccoli and Parmesan cheese - can be served hot or cold.

instructions.text: Bring water and garlic salt to a boil in a pot. Cook spaghetti according to directions on spaghetti package.
Five minutes before spaghetti is done cooking, add Broccoli Wokly. Drain.
Place spaghetti and broccoli in a large bowl and toss with olive oil, butter and garlic.
Add salt, pepper and Parmesan cheese to taste. May be served hot or cold.

notes: Garlic may always be increased depending on personal preference
Great as a main dish or side

recipes.title: Campbell's Creamy Chicken & Vegetables
recipes.description: Quick skillet chicken with creamy mushroom sauce and mixed vegetables.

ingredients.item: Campbell's Reduced Fat Cream of Mushroom Soup

instructions.text: Sprinkle chicken with garlic powder.
Spray skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium-high heat 1 min.
Cook chicken 10 min. or until browned. Set aside.
Add soup, milk, lemon juice, basil and vegetables. Heat to a boil.
Return chicken to pan. Cover and cook over low heat 10 min. or until chicken is done.

notes: Uses reduced-fat cream of mushroom soup for lighter version
'Campbell's Makes Everything Mm! Mm! Better'

recipes.title: Impossible Lasagne Pie
recipes.description: Impossibly Easy Because It Makes Its Own Crust! A quick lasagna-style pie using Bisquick.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 400°F (200°C). Spread cottage cheese in greased 9-inch pie plate.
Cook ground beef; drain. Stir in 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese, salt, oregano and tomato paste; spoon over cottage cheese.
Stir milk, baking mix and eggs with fork until blended. Pour into plate.
Bake 30 to 35 min or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 1 to 2 min or until melted.

notes: High Altitude: Heat oven to 425°F. Decrease milk to 3/4 cup. Increase bake time to 35 to 40 min.

recipes.title: V8 Vegetarian Chili
recipes.description: Quick vegetarian chili made with V8 100% Vegetable Juice and two kinds of beans.

instructions.text: In large saucepan over medium heat, heat oil. Add onion, green pepper, garlic, chili powder and cumin and cook until onion is tender.
Add vegetable juice. Heat to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook 5 min.
Add beans and heat through. Serves 4.

notes: Quick weeknight vegetarian meal
V8 adds vegetable nutrition

recipes.title: Carrot-Lemon Marmalade
recipes.attribution: Mrs. Olga Echart, San Antonio, Texas
recipes.source_note: Newspaper/magazine clipping (partial - left side cut off)
recipes.description: Prize-winning marmalade with carrots, lemon, and maraschino cherries for texture and color.

ingredients.prep_note: finely chopped (use fine blade of food grinder or chop very finely)

instructions.text: Use fine blade of food grinder to process carrot and lemon, or chop very finely by hand.
Combine chopped carrot, chopped lemon, sugar, salt, and water in a large pot.
Bring to a boil. Cook over medium-high heat for 10 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add maraschino cherries. Cook an additional 3 to 5 minutes or until mixture sheets from a metal spoon (reaches setting point).
Pour into clean, hot sterilized jelly glasses; seal with paraffin or lids according to canning guidelines.

notes: Some quantities were reconstructed from standard marmalade recipes (original recipe clipping was partially cut off)
Maraschino cherries add texture and color - this was noted as a 'prize-winning' marmalade
Original attribution: Mrs. Olga Echart, San Antonio, Texas
Reference: Traditional carrot marmalade recipes use approximately 3 cups sugar per 3/4 cup each of carrot and lemon

flags.issue: Some quantities reconstructed from standard marmalade recipes due to original clipping being cut off

recipes.title: Cabbage Soup
recipes.description: Simple, healthy cabbage soup with three international variations: Mexican, Provencal, and Oriental.

ingredients.item: large head Savoy or green cabbage

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in large pot; heat to a boil.
Simmer gently until cabbage is tender, about 25 minutes. Yields 16 to 18 cups.

notes: MEXICAN VARIATION: To 1/3 of recipe, add 1 or 2 dried chilies (soaked in hot water 15 min, stemmed, seeded and chopped), 1/2 cup minced fresh cilantro, 1 serrano or jalapeno chili minced, and 1 1/2 cups roasted sweet corn kernels. Two to three cloves roasted garlic can be added. Serve with salsa.

PROVENCAL VARIATION: To 1/3 of recipe, add 1 (15-oz) can drained navy or small white beans, 1/4 cup minced fresh basil, 1 tbsp red or white wine vinegar, 2 tsp minced fresh rosemary, 1 tsp coarsely ground black pepper and 2 diced, seeded tomatoes.

ORIENTAL VARIATION: To 1/3 of recipe, add 1 tbsp reduced sodium soy sauce, 1 to 2 tbsp seasoned rice vinegar, 1 small can sliced water chestnuts or bamboo shoots, 1 tsp Szechwan peppercorns or red pepper flakes and 1 cup bean sprouts.

recipes.title: French Onion Omelet
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens Prize Tested Recipes, $200 Winner, February 1995
recipes.description: Imagine the rich flavor of French onion soup in this easy, oven-baked omelet with caramelized onions and Swiss cheese.

instructions.text: In a 10-inch ovenproof skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add red onion, shallots (if desired), and sugar. Cook for 12 to 15 minutes or till tender and golden, stirring often.
Remove 1/4 cup cooked onion. Stir green onion, mustard, and thyme into skillet.
In a bowl beat together eggs, water, salt, and pepper. Stir in 3/4 cup of the cheese.
Pour into skillet. Bake in a 375°F (190°C) oven for 10 to 15 minutes or till set.
Top with remaining cheese and reserved onion. Cut into wedges.

notes: $200 Prize Winner in 'Awesome Omelet Category'
Can use regular skillet and transfer to oven-safe dish

recipes.title: Dilled Omelet Florentine
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens Prize Tested Recipes, $100 Winner, February 1995
recipes.description: Spinach-stuffed French omelets for a hearty brunch, served with hash browns.

instructions.text: In a medium mixing bowl combine eggs, milk, and a dash each of dillweed, garlic salt, and pepper. Using a fork, beat till combined but not frothy. Set aside.
For filling, in a medium saucepan stir together cream cheese, spinach, mushrooms, green onion, 1 tsp dillweed, and 1/4 tsp each garlic salt and pepper. Heat and stir till very hot; keep warm.
In a 10-inch skillet with flared sides, heat 1 tablespoon margarine. Lift and tilt pan to coat sides. Add half of the egg mixture.
As eggs set, run a spatula around the edge, lifting to allow uncooked portion to flow underneath. When set but still shiny, remove from heat.
Spoon filling across omelet center; fold sides over.
Top omelets with mozzarella cheese and tomato. If desired, garnish with fresh dill.

notes: $100 Prize Winner in 'Awesome Omelet Category'
Makes 4 individual omelets
Serve with hash browns for a hearty brunch

flags.issue: Right side of recipe partially cut off

recipes.title: Laughner's Millionaire's Pie
recipes.description: The crown jewel of desserts from Laughner's cafeteria - an ultra-rich pie with coconut, chocolate chips, and pecans.

ingredients.item: unbaked 10-inch pie shell, in its pan

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C).
Toss together the coconut flakes, chocolate chips and chopped pecans. Place in pie shell.
Mix sugars, salt and melted margarine. Beat in corn syrup and vanilla.
Gently fold eggs into sugar mixture. Pour evenly over ingredients in prepared pie shell.
Bake 55-65 minutes, or until deep golden brown on top and nearly set in center.
Cool at room temperature.

notes: From famous Laughner's Cafeteria in Indiana - 'The Crown Jewel' of their desserts
Laughner's, 20 N Franklin Road at I-465; (317) 356-3388

flags.issue: Left side partially cut off - coconut/chips/pecans quantities estimated

recipes.title: Classic Noodle Pudding
recipes.description: Sweet kugel-style noodle pudding with cream cheese, cottage cheese, raisins, and cinnamon.

instructions.text: Spray 11 × 7 × 2-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
In medium bowl stir cream cheese, cottage cheese, eggs and sugar until well blended.
Stir in raisins, margarine, vanilla and cinnamon.
Add egg noodles; mix well. Pour into prepared baking dish.
Bake in 350°F (175°C) oven 35-40 minutes.
Let stand 20 minutes before serving.

notes: Also known as kugel
Great for holidays or as a side dish

recipes.title: Citrus Pork Skillet
recipes.description: Quick skillet pork with orange juice glaze, carrots, and egg noodles.

instructions.text: In small bowl combine cumin, salt and pepper. Add pork; toss to coat.
In large skillet heat corn oil over medium-high heat. Add pork and garlic; saute 2 minutes or until browned.
In small bowl blend broth, orange juice, vinegar and brown sugar. Reserve 1/4 cup broth mixture.
Pour remaining broth mixture into skillet. Add carrots; bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium; cook 7-8 minutes.
Blend corn starch into reserved broth mixture. Stirring constantly, pour into skillet.
Add green onions. Bring to boil; boil 1 minute.
Toss with egg noodles. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Quick weeknight dinner
Orange-citrus glaze complements the pork

recipes.title: Cheddar Potato-Topped Meatloaf
recipes.description: Classic meatloaf topped with cheesy mashed potatoes and baked until golden.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F (190°C). In large bowl, combine meatloaf ingredients, mixing lightly but thoroughly. Press beef mixture into bottom of 9-inch square baking pan.
Bake in 375°F oven 20 to 25 minutes or until no longer pink and juices run clear. Pour off drippings.
Meanwhile in 2-quart microwave-safe dish, combine all potato topping ingredients except cheese.
Microwave at HIGH 11 to 12 minutes, stirring once halfway.
Spread potatoes over beef mixture to edge of pan; sprinkle with cheese.
Broil 3 to 4 inches from heat 5 to 7 minutes or until top is lightly browned.
To serve, cut meatloaf into six rectangular pieces.

notes: Cook's Tip: One package (10 oz) frozen green beans or mixed vegetables may be substituted for peas and carrots.

recipes.title: Salisbury Steak with Mushroom Gravy
recipes.description: Classic comfort food - seasoned beef patties with rich mushroom gravy.

instructions.text: In medium bowl, combine Salisbury steak ingredients, mixing lightly but thoroughly. Shape into four oval 1/2-inch thick patties.
Heat large nonstick skillet over medium heat until hot. Place beef patties in skillet; cook 7 to 8 minutes or until no longer pink and juices run clear, turning once. Remove from skillet; keep warm.
Add gravy ingredients to same skillet. Cook over medium heat 3 to 5 minutes or until mushrooms are tender; serve with Salisbury steak.

notes: Makes 4 servings (serving size: 1 beef patty and 1/3 cup gravy)
Serve with Creamy Horseradish Potatoes (recipe on page 3B)

recipes.title: Broccoli & Cheese Casserole
recipes.description: Quick and easy cheesy broccoli casserole with a buttery breadcrumb topping.

ingredients.prep_note: Regular, 98% Fat Free or 25% Less Sodium

instructions.text: Stir soup, milk, mustard, broccoli and cheese in 1 1/2-qt. casserole.
Mix breadcrumbs with butter in bowl and sprinkle over broccoli mixture.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 30 min. or until hot.

notes: Rice is Nice: Add 2 cups cooked white rice to the broccoli mixture.
Cheese Change-Up: Use mozzarella cheese for Cheddar.

recipes.title: Garlic Cauliflower
recipes.description: Simple steamed cauliflower with a garlicky paprika-spiced olive oil dressing - low-carb friendly.

instructions.text: Separate cauliflower into florets. Steam cauliflower in the microwave or boil until tender, about 8-10 minutes. Drain and place in serving bowl.
While cauliflower is cooking, heat olive oil in a small skillet and sauté garlic over medium heat for 1 minute.
Remove from heat and add remaining ingredients. Stir to mix well.
Pour over cauliflower, and serve immediately.

notes: Low-carb: only 2g carbohydrates per serving
91.2% calories from fat - keto friendly

recipes.title: The Original Chex Party Mix (Microwave)
recipes.description: The classic Chex Party Mix made easy in the microwave - a holiday favorite!

ingredients.item: garlic-flavor bite-size bagel chips or regular-size bagel chips

instructions.text: In large microwavable bowl, microwave butter uncovered on High about 40 seconds or until melted.
Stir in seasonings. Gradually stir in remaining ingredients until evenly coated.
Microwave uncovered on High 5 to 6 minutes, thoroughly stirring every 2 minutes.
Spread on paper towels to cool. Store in airtight container.

notes: Reduced-Fat Recipe: To reduce the fat to 2 grams and the calories to 80 per serving, use 3 tablespoons margarine instead of 6 tablespoons butter, omit mixed nuts and use fat-free bagel chips.
For more summer recipes go to www.chex.com
recipes.variant_notes: 2006 microwave version with bagel chips

recipes.title: Peppermint Candy Shortbread Cookies
recipes.description: Buttery shortbread cookies with crushed peppermint candy and vanilla frosting.

instructions.text: MIX butter, sugar, crushed candy and vanilla thoroughly using an electric mixer. Gradually blend in flour and corn starch.
FORM into 1-inch balls and place on parchment paper lined baking sheets. Gently press down on each cookie to flatten using fingers or a flat bottomed drinking glass.
[INFERRED] Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 25-30 minutes until edges are lightly golden.
Frosting: Combine confectioners sugar, milk, vanilla. Drizzle or spread on cooled cookies, top with crushed peppermint.

recipes.pan_size: Baking sheets lined with Reynolds Parchment Paper
notes: Instructions cut off at bottom - baking step inferred
Perfect for Christmas/holiday baking
Must use real butter, no substitutes

flags: Baking instructions completed from standard shortbread cookie technique

recipes.title: Crispy Chicken Wings
recipes.description: Oven-baked crispy chicken wings coated in seasoned breadcrumbs - perfect for parties.

instructions.text: Rinse chicken wings; drain. Remove wing tip portion. Separate remaining sections at joint so there are two pieces.
Mix seasoned bread crumbs, flour, salt, and pepper to taste. Coat wing sections in flour mixture.
Lay on cookie sheet with sides (15 x 10 x 1-inch) that has been sprayed with vegetable oil spray. 6 pounds chicken wings fit on 1 cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 50 minutes.
Remove from baking sheet as soon as done so wings don't stand in meat drippings. Can be made ahead and served after refrigeration. Serve with dipping sauces.

notes: Can be made ahead and refrigerated
Serve with your favorite dipping sauces

recipes.title: Spinach Dip in Rye Round
recipes.description: Classic creamy spinach dip served in a hollowed rye bread bowl with bread cubes for dipping.

ingredients.prep_note: thawed and squeezed completely free of water (do not cook)

instructions.text: Mix the spinach, onion, parsley, olives, mayonnaise, sour cream, celery salt, tarragon, sugar, and pepper. Chill for 25 minutes.
Hollow out loaf of bread by pulling bite-size pieces. Fill hollow with spinach dip and refrigerate until serving.
Serve with bread cubes surrounding round loaf.

notes: Can be made a day ahead: Hollow out bread and put dip inside for 24 hours. Store bread cubes in plastic bag in refrigerator until ready to serve.

recipes.title: Philly Cheesy Chili Topper
recipes.description: Quick microwave appetizer with cream cheese, chili, and cheddar - serve with crackers.

instructions.text: Place unwrapped block of cream cheese on microwavable plate; top with chili and cheese.
Microwave on HIGH 45 seconds to 1 minute or until cheddar cheese is melted.
Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve with assorted Nabisco crackers.

notes: Super quick appetizer for game day or parties

recipes.title: Easy Homestyle Mac & Cheese
recipes.description: Creamy homemade macaroni and cheese with a crispy cornflake topping.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F (175°C). Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain.
Melt butter in 3-quart saucepan until sizzling; stir in flour, mustard and onion powder.
Add milk; cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture boils and thickens (5 to 7 minutes).
Reduce heat to low; stir in cheese. Cook until cheese is melted (3 to 5 minutes). Add cooked macaroni; mix well.
Spoon into ungreased 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with cornflakes.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until heated through.

notes: TIP: Add 1 cup chopped cooked ham, 1/2 cup chopped red or green bell pepper, or 1/2 cup drained mushroom stems and pieces

recipes.title: Favorite Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: Simple one-layer chocolate cake made with sour milk and boiling water for extra moistness.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour an 8-inch square baking pan; set aside.
Combine sugar and butter in large bowl. Beat at medium speed, scraping bowl often, until creamy.
Add sour milk, melted chocolate, egg and vanilla. Continue beating until smooth.
Reduce speed to low; add flour, baking soda and salt. Beat until well mixed.
Add boiling water; continue beating until smooth.
Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Dust cake with powdered sugar or serve with dollop of whipped cream, if desired.

recipes.pan_size: 8-inch square baking pan, greased and floured
notes: *Sour milk substitute: Add 3/4 teaspoon vinegar or lemon juice plus enough milk to equal 1/4 cup; let stand 5 minutes

recipes.title: Easy Chicken & Cheese Enchiladas
recipes.description: Quick and delicious chicken enchiladas with creamy Cream of Chicken soup sauce.

ingredients.item: Campbell's Condensed Cream of Chicken Soup
ingredients.prep_note: Regular, 98% Fat Free or Healthy Request

instructions.text: Stir the soup, sour cream, picante sauce and chili powder in a medium bowl.
Stir 1 cup picante sauce mixture, chicken and cheese in a large bowl.

Divide the chicken mixture among the tortillas. Roll up the tortillas and place them seam-side up in an 11 x 8-inch shallow baking dish. Pour the remaining picante sauce mixture over the filled tortillas. Cover the baking dish.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 40 min. or until the enchiladas are hot and bubbling. Top with the tomato and onion.

notes: For more recipes, visit CampbellsKitchen.com

recipes.title: Angel Lush
recipes.source_note: Publix Apron's Simple Meals recipe featuring Katie Brown
recipes.description: Light and refreshing layered dessert with angel food cake, pineapple pudding, and fresh berries.

ingredients.item: JELL-O Vanilla Flavor Instant Pudding & Pie Filling

ingredients.prep_note: such as strawberries, blueberries, or raspberries, rinsed

instructions.text: Combine in medium bowl, dry pudding mix and pineapple. Gently stir in whipped topping.
Slice cake horizontally into 3 layers. Place bottom cake layer on serving plate; top with 1/3 of the pudding mixture. Repeat layers two times.
Chill cake at least 1 hour. Top with berries just before serving. Store leftovers in refrigerator.

notes: Featured in Publix Apron's Simple Meals
JELL-O Brand and Cool Whip are proud sponsors of the Katie Brown Workshop on Public Television

recipes.title: Silver Palate Chili For a Crowd
recipes.description: Hearty crowd-pleasing chili with beef, Italian sausage, beans, and a complex spice blend.

instructions.text: Combine onions, sausage, and ground chuck in a large saucepan or Dutch oven and cook over medium-high heat until the meats are well browned (about 10 minutes).
Remove excess fat and stir in tomato paste, garlic, cumin, chili powder, mustard, basil, oregano, salt and pepper.
Add tomatoes, wine, parsley and beans.
Simmer uncovered for 15 minutes.
Add olives and simmer 5 minutes more to heat through.
Serve with cheese and crackers.

notes: When choosing chopped meat for chili, beef chuck adds great flavor. And you never can have too many spices. Look for dark-red kidney beans. Lemon juice brightens all the tastes!
INCOMPLETE: Only ingredients visible - instructions cut off

recipes.title: Baked Pork Chops and Potatoes
recipes.description: Simple one-dish meal with bone-in pork chops baked on a bed of sliced potatoes and onions.

instructions.text: Slice enough potatoes to make a 2-inch layer in baking pan. Season with salt and pepper.
Place chops on top, season and cover with onions. Sprinkle with more pepper.
Pour milk into pan and bake at 350°F (175°C) until chops are tender, taking care not to let them dry out. Add more milk if needed.

notes: For more variety, add a can of cream of mushroom soup before baking

recipes.title: Spaghetti Casserole
recipes.description: Layered pasta bake with seasoned ground beef, cottage cheese, and melted mozzarella.

instructions.text: Saute ground beef, onion and green pepper; drain well. Stir in spaghetti sauce.
Cook spaghetti and drain. Stir in margarine and salt.
Beat eggs; add Parmesan cheese and mix with cooked spaghetti. Place in greased 9-inch square pan.
Spread cottage cheese (or ricotta) over spaghetti. Pour meat mixture over cheese.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 25 to 30 minutes. During last 5 or 10 minutes, sprinkle with shredded mozzarella cheese. Return to oven until cheese is melted.

notes: Ricotta cheese works even better than cottage cheese

recipes.title: Spiced Bundt Cake
recipes.description: Moist apple bundt cake with warm spices and a tangy citrus glaze - Americans love bundt cakes!

ingredients.prep_note: peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes (about 3 1/2 cups)

instructions.text: [INCOMPLETE - Baking instructions not visible in image. Standard bundt cake method would apply: sauté apples in butter with brown sugar, mix dry ingredients, cream wet ingredients, combine and fold in apples and walnuts, bake in greased bundt pan.]

notes: Recipe has citrus glaze with lemon
Sautéed apples lend a rich, smooth flavor
Instructions cut off in image

recipes.title: Pantry Tomato Soup
recipes.description: Silky tomato soup with dill and allspice, garnished with crème fraîche and chives.

instructions.text: Heat butter and oil in large pot. Add onions and cook until softened. Add garlic and allspice; cook 1 minute.
Add dill, broth, tomatoes, and sugar. Bring to boil, reduce heat, and simmer 20-25 minutes.
Puree the soup in batches, adding more broth if necessary. Return to the pot; adjust the seasonings and heat through.
Serve dolloped with crème fraîche and a sprinkling of snipped chives.

recipes.pan_size: Large pot, blender or immersion blender
notes: PARADE Food Editor Sheila Lukins adapted these recipes from her book 'Ten' (Workman)

recipes.title: Tuna Casserole '90s Style
recipes.description: Classic comfort food tuna noodle casserole with mushroom soup, wine, and dill.

instructions.text: Mix soup, milk, dillweed and a generous grinding of black pepper. Whisk vigorously until fairly smooth.
Quarter the mushrooms and stir them into the soup mixture along with the peas.
Drain the tuna and break it up with a fork. Add to the soup mixture along with the noodles and stir until evenly distributed.
Sprinkle with the cracker crumbs. Bake in the center of the preheated oven for about 40 minutes, until bubbly and noodles are tender.

notes: For white wine you can substitute Gallo's Dry Cocktail sherry or dry Vermouth. The purists say you should put the same wine in the dish you will drink with the meal.

recipes.title: Tuna-Broccoli Casserole
recipes.source_note: From 'The Diabetic's Healthy Exchanges' (Perigree Books), uses Campbell's Hearty Choice soup
recipes.description: Reduced-fat one-dish tuna casserole with broccoli, water chestnuts, and cheese - diabetic friendly.

ingredients.prep_note: packed in water, drained and flaked

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Spray an 8-by-8 inch baking dish with butter-flavored cooking spray.
In a large bowl, combine macaroni, broccoli, tuna, water chestnuts, and Cheddar cheese.
In a medium bowl, combine mushroom soup, yogurt, dry milk powder, cornstarch, Worcestershire sauce, and garlic. Add soup mixture to macaroni mixture. Mix well to combine.
Pour mixture into prepared baking dish. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese evenly over top. Cover and bake 30 minutes.
Uncover and continue baking 10 minutes. Place baking dish on a wire rack and let set 5 minutes. Cut into 6 servings.

notes: Reduced-fat tuna casserole from 'The Diabetic's Healthy Exchanges' cookbook
Uses Campbell's Hearty Choice reduced-fat soup

recipes.title: Turkey Dressing
recipes.source_note: Tennessee Pride Country Sausage product recipe
recipes.description: Classic sage and sausage stuffing/dressing - stuff the turkey or bake separately.

instructions.text: Cook sausage in large skillet until browned. Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Cook onion and celery in drippings in skillet until tender.
Combine sausage, cooked vegetables, sage, marjoram, bread cubes, and parsley in large mixing bowl; blend well.
Stir in chicken broth to moisten. Season with salt and pepper.

Stuff mixture into turkey and roast according to standard roasting directions. Or, dot with butter, cover, and bake in greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish for 30-40 minutes at 350°F (175°C). Uncover and bake 10 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: Can stuff turkey or bake as side dish
Makes about 12 cups

recipes.title: Sourdough Bread (Bread Machine)
recipes.description: Bread machine sourdough using a sourdough starter - basic setting with timer option.

instructions.text: Measure all ingredients into bread pan in the order listed above, beginning with the column on the left, followed by the column on the right.
Select Basic setting. Select crust setting if other than 'Medium'.
Press the 'Start/Stop' button to begin the breadmaking process. The display will begin counting down the minutes until the end of the cycle.
When the baking is complete, the display will read 0:00 and the unit will signal. You may choose to press the 'Start/Stop' button to cancel the 'Keep-Warm' cycle if desired.
Remove the bread and enjoy!

notes: All ingredients at room temperature (70-80°F/21-27°C)
Once the 'Start/Stop' button is pressed, the selected function(s) cannot be altered
To stop, press 'Start/Stop' and hold for 1-3 seconds until signal sounds

recipes.title: Everyday Sourdough
recipes.description: Artisan sourdough bread with overnight rise - a family's all-purpose go-to loaf with detailed baker's schedule.

instructions.text: BAKER'S SCHEDULE: Thursday-Saturday: Feed your starter until bubbly and active. Saturday Evening: Make the dough, and let rise overnight. Sunday Morning: Shape the dough, let rise again, score, and bake.

MAKE THE DOUGH: In the evening, whisk the starter and water together in a large bowl with a fork. Add the flour and salt. Combine until a stiff dough forms, then finish mixing by hand to fully incorporate the flour. Cover with a damp towel and let rest for 30 minutes. Replenish your starter with fresh flour and water, and store according to preference.

After the dough has rested, work the mass into a fairly smooth ball by grabbing a portion of the dough and folding it over, pressing your fingertips into the center. Repeat, working your way around the dough until it begins to tighten, about 15 seconds.

BULK RISE: Cover the bowl with a damp towel and let rise overnight at room temperature. This will take about 8 to 10 hours at 70°F (21°C). The dough is ready when it no longer looks dense and has doubled in size.

SHAPE: In the morning, coax the dough onto a lightly floured work surface. Shape it into a round: start at the top and fold the dough over toward the center. Turn the dough slightly and fold over the next section. Repeat until you have come full circle. Flip the dough over and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, line an 8-inch (20-cm) bowl with a towel and dust with flour. With floured hands, gently cup the dough and pull it toward you in a circular motion to tighten its shape. Using a bench scraper, place the dough into the bowl, seam side up.
SECOND RISE: Cover the bowl and let rest for 30 minutes to 1 hour. The dough is ready when it looks puffy and has risen slightly but has not yet doubled in size.
Preheat your oven to 450°F (230°C). Cut a sheet of parchment paper to fit the size of your baking pot, leaving enough excess around the sides to remove the bread.

SCORE: Place the parchment over the dough and invert the bowl to release. Sprinkle the dough with flour and gently rub the surface with your hands. Score the dough with the cross-cut pattern or any way you'd like. Use the parchment to transfer the dough to the baking pot.

BAKE: Bake the dough on the center rack for 20 minutes, covered. Remove the lid, and continue to bake for 30 minutes. Then, carefully remove the loaf from the pot and bake directly on the oven rack for the last 10 minutes to crisp the crust. When finished, transfer to a wire rack. Cool for 1 hour before slicing.

recipes.pan_size: Dutch oven or baking pot with lid, 8-inch bowl for proofing
notes: Handwritten notes on original: 'Preheat to 500° w/ dutch oven inside. Drop temp to 425° & bake w/lid for 25min. Drop temp to 380° remove lid, & bake for 30min.'
Sourdough is best consumed on the same day it is baked. To maximize freshness, cool completely and store at room temperature in a plastic bag for up to 1 day.

recipes.title: Paul Prudhomme's Not Yo' Mama's Red Beans
recipes.source_note: Tampa Tribune 1996, from 'Fork in the Road' (William Morrow)
recipes.description: Complex Cajun red beans with a 2-day process - soak overnight, cook low and slow with homemade seasoning mix.

instructions.text: Day 1: Add enough water to red beans to cover them by 3 or 4 inches and soak overnight in the refrigerator. As the beans absorb the water, they will more than double in volume.
Day 2: Combine the seasoning mix ingredients in a small bowl. Drain beans and set aside.

Heat a 5-quart pot or Dutch oven (350 degrees - about 4 minutes). Add 2 cups onions, bell peppers, celery and 1 tablespoon of seasoning mix. Stir and cook until vegetables start to turn brown, about 5 minutes.
Add 1/2 cup of stock, scrape the bottom of the pot to clear all the browned bits and cook 3 minutes. Add the remaining 1 cup of onions, stir and cook 5 minutes.
Add the drained beans, 5 cups of stock and the remaining seasoning mix. Stir and cook for 45 minutes, scraping the bottom of the pot occasionally to check for sticking.

Add 1 cup grape juice and continue to cook for 25 minutes. Caution: At this point, the starches in the beans start to break down and sticking will occur more often. It is important to check and clear the bottom of the pot frequently.
Add the remaining stock and grape juice, turn the heat to medium and cook until the beans are tender and the liquid is thick, about 30 to 35 minutes.
Presentation: Serve beans over cooked rice.

notes: Source: Chef Paul Prudhomme's 'Fork in the Road' (William Morrow)
Two-day process with overnight soak
Watch carefully for sticking in final cooking stages

recipes.title: Layered Macaroni (Pastitsio)
recipes.description: Greek-style layered pasta casserole with garbanzo beans, tomatoes, cinnamon, and a creamy béchamel topping.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly spray a 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Cook pasta according to package directions; drain well, and set aside.
In a large skillet, saute onion in oil over medium-high heat for 5 minutes, or until translucent. Stir in cinnamon, garbanzos and tomatoes. Cook 7 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

In a medium saucepan, over medium heat, melt butter. Add flour and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Gradually add milk, whisking until smooth. Continue cooking, stirring constantly, until mixture is thickened and has almost come to a boil. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, toss pasta with 1 cup of the cream sauce. Place half of the pasta in the prepared baking dish, top with garbanzo bean mixture, and add a final layer of the remaining pasta.
Spread remaining cream sauce evenly over the top of the torta, and sprinkle with Parmesan, if desired.
Bake, uncovered, for 40 to 45 minutes, or until top is golden.

notes: Greek-inspired vegetarian casserole
Can use soy milk for dairy-free option

recipes.title: Garlic Potato Sauce
recipes.description: Greek-style skordalia - a creamy garlic and potato sauce/dip with lemon and olive oil.

instructions.text: In a large pot, cover potatoes with water, bring to a boil, and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain potatoes, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid.
In a food processor or blender, combine potatoes, reserved cooking liquid, garlic, and lemon juice. Pulse to mix, add bread crumbs, and pulse again briefly.
Add olive oil 1 tablespoon at a time, pulsing between additions. Season to taste with salt and pepper and process until smooth and creamy.

recipes.pan_size: Large pot, food processor or blender
notes: Traditional Greek skordalia sauce
Great with grilled meats, vegetables, or bread

recipes.title: Do-The-Hustle Potatoes (Scalloped Potatoes)
recipes.description: Quick scalloped potatoes with evaporated milk and Swiss cheese - ready in 25 minutes.

instructions.text: Bring milk to a boil in a saucepan. Add garlic; reduce heat, and simmer 1 minute. Remove from heat.
Arrange half of potato slices in a 13-by-9-by-2-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with half of cheese; top with half of milk mixture.
Repeat layers. Bake, uncovered, at 425°F (220°C) for 25 minutes.

notes: Quick and lighter version of scalloped potatoes
Uses evaporated milk for creaminess without heavy cream

recipes.title: Captain "Hook Him" Cake
recipes.description: Moist rum-soaked bundt cake with pecans, yellow cake mix, and pudding - topped with buttery rum sauce.

instructions.text: Combine pecans and 1 tablespoon sugar; sprinkle in bottom of a 12-cup Bundt pan coated with cooking spray. Set aside.
Combine cake mix, pudding mix, 1/2 cup water, 1/2 cup rum and applesauce in a large mixing bowl. Beat at medium speed of a mixer until smooth.
Gradually add egg substitute, 1/4 cup at a time, and beat until blended.
Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 1 hour or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack 1 hour (do not invert).
Sauce: Combine 1 cup sugar, remaining 1/2 cup rum, butter and 1/4 cup water in a medium saucepan; bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring often. Boil 1 minute. Let sauce cool.
Prick surface of cake at 1-inch intervals with a wooden pick. Pour sauce evenly over cake. Let stand at least 2 hours before inverting and serving.

notes: Let cake stand at least 2 hours to absorb rum sauce
Do not invert pan until after sauce is absorbed

recipes.title: Broiled Crispy Chicken
recipes.description: Quick single-serving Asian-flavored broiled chicken thighs with soy and Mandarin jah-jan sauce.

instructions.text: If chicken is frozen, thaw in microwave. Line pie pan with foil.
Place chicken on foil in single layer. Season with soy sauce, then jah-jan sauce. Sprinkle with salt. Add sugar.
Broil 15 minutes, until browned and crisp on top.
Turn over and brown bottom side, about 5 minutes longer.

notes: Simple single-serving recipe
Mandarin jah-jan sauce adds umami depth

recipes.title: He's A Softie On The Inside (Herb-Crusted Pork Tenderloin)
recipes.description: Tender pork loin with a flavorful herb-mustard crust featuring fennel, rosemary, and basil.

instructions.text: Combine mayonnaise and mustard in a small bowl; stir well. Stir in fennel seeds and rosemary, basil, salt and pepper.
Coat pork thoroughly with mixture. Chill 1 hour.
Place pork on a rack in a roasting pan coated with cooking spray.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 30 minutes or until meat thermometer registers 160°F (71°C).
Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

notes: Rest meat 5 minutes before slicing
Internal temperature should reach 160°F (71°C)

recipes.title: Waldorf-Astoria Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: Famous dense chocolate cake from the legendary Waldorf-Astoria Hotel, baked in a pipestem pan.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Blend sugar and butter, and add the eggs.
Add cooled melted chocolate.
Sift flour, baking powder and salt into sugar and butter, alternating with the milk. Add vanilla and nuts.
Bake in a greased pipestem pan for 45 minutes to one hour (usually takes 1 hour or a bit more). Do not invert pan when cake is done.
Let cool for 15 minutes, then remove to rack. Cool completely before frosting.

notes: Do not invert pan while cake is still hot
Classic recipe from the famous Waldorf-Astoria Hotel
Frosting recipe referenced but not shown

flags.issue: Frosting recipe referenced as 'at left' but not visible in image

recipes.title: He'll Get Hot Under The Collar (Stuffed Jalapenos)
recipes.description: Baked cream cheese-stuffed jalapeño poppers with three cheeses.

instructions.text: Cut peppers in half lengthwise; remove seeds.
Combine cheeses; spoon evenly into pepper halves.
Place in a 13-by-9-by-2-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray.
Bake, uncovered, at 350°F (175°C) for 30 minutes or until lightly browned.
Serve warm with salsa.

notes: Wear gloves when handling jalapeños
Lighter version using reduced-fat cheeses

recipes.title: Midnight Pudding
recipes.description: Elegant chocolate pudding with a dramatic white chocolate garnish - double boiler method.

instructions.text: Melt semisweet chocolate in top half of a double boiler over medium heat. Stir chocolate constantly with rubber spatula until completely melted and smooth, then remove from heat and set aside.
Heat half-and-half, 1/4 cup sugar, and the cocoa in a 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. When hot, whisk to dissolve sugar. Bring to a boil.
While cream is heating, whisk egg yolks, remaining sugar and cornstarch in a bowl until slightly thickened and lemon colored.
Pour boiling half-and-half mixture slowly into egg yolks and stir to combine.
Return mixture to saucepan and heat over medium-high heat, stirring constantly until it begins to boil and becomes quite thick, about 30 seconds.
Remove pan from heat and transfer mixture to a large bowl. Add melted chocolate. Then, place bowl in ice water and stir pudding until it is cold.
Fold in all but 2 tablespoons of the white chocolate into pudding.
To serve, place 3/4 cup of pudding into each of four dessert bowls and sprinkle half a tablespoon of white chocolate over top of each.

notes: Use ice bath to quickly cool the pudding
Reserve white chocolate pieces for garnish

recipes.title: Not Neiman-Marcus' Cookie Recipe
recipes.description: Legendary oatmeal chocolate chip cookies with ground oatmeal, grated chocolate bar, and chocolate chips - makes a huge batch!

ingredients.prep_note: ground to fine powder in blender or food processor

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cream butter and both sugars in a large mixing bowl. Add eggs and vanilla.
In separate bowl, combine flour, powdered oatmeal, salt, baking powder and baking soda. Stir dry ingredients into butter and egg mixture until incorporated.
Add grated chocolate bar and stir until distributed. Add chocolate chips and nuts.
Roll cookie dough into 1 to 1½-inch balls and place 2 inches apart on a cookie sheet. Bake 6 to 10 minutes or until bottoms just begin to brown.
Remove cookie sheet from oven and let cool until cookies are set, about 3 minutes. Use spatula to remove cookies from pan to waxed paper. Let cool completely before storing.

notes: Famous 'Neiman Marcus cookie' urban legend recipe
Grind oatmeal to fine powder for best texture

recipes.title: Fenneled Olives
recipes.description: Greek olives marinated with fennel, garlic, citrus peel, and honey - refrigerate at least 24 hours.

instructions.text: Puree fennel seeds, garlic, orange juice and vinegar in a blender, or with a mortar and pestle, until a liquid paste is formed. Pureeing will take 2 or 3 minutes in a blender.
With a rubber spatula, scrape the fennel mixture onto olives.
Stir orange peel, lemon peel and honey into the olives.
Cover and refrigerate at least 24 hours, stirring or shaking occasionally.

notes: Must marinate at least 24 hours for best flavor
Great appetizer or antipasto

recipes.title: Baked Potato Soup
recipes.description: Creamy loaded baked potato soup with cheese, bacon bits, and green onion garnish.

instructions.text: Scrub potatoes, prick with fork and bake at 375°F (190°C) for 1 hour. Potatoes should yield slightly when pressed.
Halve potatoes, scoop out pulp and cut into 1/4 to 1/2-inch pieces. Measure 2 cups potato pulp and puree with stock in blender until smooth and creamy.
Melt margarine in large pot over medium heat. Stir in flour and cook, stirring constantly, until flour is light golden brown.
Add onions and cook until onion is soft and translucent. Reduce heat to low and slowly add potato/chicken stock mixture, stirring constantly.
Add remaining potato pieces along with parsley, pepper, garlic powder and salt.
Add heavy cream and cook 30 to 45 minutes. Adjust seasonings to taste.
Serve with grated cheese, bacon bits and chopped green onions.

notes: Loaded baked potato soup - comfort food classic
Garnish generously with toppings

recipes.title: Easy Chicken Pot Pie
recipes.description: Quick and easy chicken pot pie with Bisquick topping - pie is strictly upper crust!

ingredients.item: Campbell's condensed cream of chicken soup
Bisquick Original or Reduced Fat baking mix

instructions.text: Heat oven to 400°F (200°C). Mix vegetables, chicken and soup in ungreased 9-inch pie plate.
Stir remaining ingredients with fork until blended. Pour into pie plate.
Bake 30 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: High Altitude: Heat oven to 425°F (220°C)
Quick weeknight dinner

recipes.title: Updated Chicken Paprikash
recipes.description: Classic Hungarian chicken paprikash with sweet paprika and sour cream sauce, served over wide noodles.

ingredients.prep_note: cored, seeded, cut into strips (or 1 red and 1 yellow/green)

instructions.text: In a large, deep skillet or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken in a single layer and brown on both sides, seasoning to taste with salt and pepper. You may have to do this in two batches. Remove chicken and set aside.
Drain off all but 2 tablespoons of fat from the pan. Add bell peppers and onion; cook on medium-high, stirring frequently, until onions are transparent, about 6 minutes.
Reduce heat to low and add cayenne and paprika. Cook, stirring frequently, 4 minutes.
Add broth and tomatoes; stir to combine. Increase heat to high. Add chicken; bring to boil. Reduce to medium-low, cover and simmer until chicken is completely cooked and tender, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine flour and sour cream; stir until blended. Place chicken on serving platter, leaving remaining mixture in pan.
Stir sour cream mixture into sauce. Bring to simmer but do not boil. Add thyme, simmer for 3 minutes.
Pour sauce over chicken. Serve immediately over cooked pasta, such as wide noodles.

recipes.pan_size: Large deep skillet or Dutch oven
notes: Classic Hungarian comfort food
Do not boil after adding sour cream or it will curdle

recipes.title: Mexicali Corn Casserole
recipes.description: Easy microwave corn casserole with corn bread mix, sour cream, and green chilies.

instructions.text: Place butter in 3-quart casserole. Microwave at high 30 to 60 seconds, or until melted.
Blend in remaining ingredients except paprika.
Microwave at high 2 to 4 minutes, or until cheese melts and mixture begins to set, stirring several times during cooking.
Pour into 8-by-8-inch baking dish. Cover with wax paper.
Reduce power to 50% (medium). Microwave 12 to 18 minutes, or until set, rotating dish 1/4 turn every 3 minutes.
Sprinkle with paprika.

notes: Microwave recipe
Can also bake conventionally at 350°F for 45-50 minutes

recipes.title: One Dish Chicken & Stuffing Bake
recipes.description: Easy weeknight dinner with herb stuffing, chicken breasts, and mushroom soup gravy.

instructions.text: Mix stuffing, 1 1/4 cups boiling water and 4 tbsp margarine*.
Spoon stuffing across center of 3-qt shallow baking dish. Place chicken on each side of stuffing. Sprinkle paprika over chicken.
Mix soup, milk and parsley. Pour over chicken.
Bake covered at 400°F (200°C) for 30 min. or until chicken is no longer pink.

notes: *For lower fat stuffing reduce margarine to 1 tbsp
Quick one-dish meal

recipes.title: Caesar Salad
recipes.description: Classic Caesar salad with two dressing options - traditional with egg yolks or almost fat-free version.

instructions.text: First rub your salad bowl with garlic.
For the traditional dressing, beat the eggs until they begin to thicken. Whisk the oil in, one tablespoon at a time; then add the remaining ingredients and whisk until smooth.
To make the low-fat version, combine the listed fat-free ingredients in a bowl and whisk smooth.
Toss lettuce and croutons in the dressing just before serving.

notes: Two dressing options provided
Traditional uses raw egg yolks - use pasteurized eggs if concerned
Fat-free version uses Kraft Free Mayonnaise
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 920.jpeg

recipes.title: Roasted Potato and Garlic Soup
recipes.description: Elegant roasted potato soup with a whole head of roasted garlic, served with homemade croutons.

instructions.text: Peel and cube 2 of the potatoes. Place the garlic bulb, cut side up, on top of the potatoes. Drizzle olive oil over all. Bake, covered, in a 400°F (200°C) oven about 50 minutes or until garlic cloves feel soft and potatoes are tender. Cool slightly.

Squeeze the garlic bulb to remove the paste from the cloves. In a blender container or food processor bowl, combine the garlic paste, peeled potatoes, about half the onion, half of the chicken broth, all of the flour, and pepper. Cover and blend till nearly smooth.
Pour the pureed mixture into a medium saucepan. Stir in the unpeeled cooked potato, remaining onion and broth, and half-and-half.
Cook and stir over medium heat till slightly thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 minute more. If necessary, stir in additional half-and-half to make the soup the desired consistency.
To serve, ladle into soup bowls. If desired, top each serving with Homemade Croutons and a sprig of rosemary.

notes: BH&G 75th Anniversary featured recipe
Roasted garlic adds deep flavor

recipes.title: Homemade Croutons
recipes.description: Crispy baked Italian-seasoned croutons from sourdough bread.

ingredients.item: cubed sourdough bread or rye bread

instructions.text: Spread cubed sourdough or rye bread in a single layer in a shallow baking dish.
Stir together melted margarine or butter and Italian seasoning; pour over bread cubes. Bake in a 400°F (200°C) oven for 5 to 10 minutes. Stir bake 5 to 10 minutes more or until crisp and brown.

notes: Great on soups and salads

recipes.title: Key Lime Pie
recipes.description: Classic Florida Key Lime Pie with sweetened condensed milk and fluffy meringue topping.

instructions.text: Pour sweetened condensed milk into mixing bowl; add lime juice, peel, salt and yolks. Beat until well blended. Turn filling into pie shell.
To make meringue, add cream of tartar to egg whites and beat until stiff. Add sugar gradually, beating until smooth and glossy.
Spread meringue over lime filling. Bake at 425°F (220°C) a few minutes or until meringue is brown.
Cool before serving.

notes: Classic Florida dessert
Key limes are smaller and more tart than Persian limes
Watch meringue carefully - browns quickly!

recipes.title: Cornbread Salad
recipes.description: Southern layered cornbread salad with tomatoes, bacon, and mayonnaise - a potluck favorite.

instructions.text: Combine tomatoes, peppers, onion, pickles and bacon. Drain off excess juice and combine with mayonnaise.
Crumble cornbread and combine with vegetable mixture. Toss gently.
Spread mayonnaise over top. Cover and chill overnight.

notes: Must chill overnight for best flavor
Southern potluck classic

recipes.title: Texas Cornbread Salad
recipes.description: Hearty Texas-style cornbread salad with cream-style corn and prepared mustard.

instructions.text: Crumble together cornbread and bacon. Add tomatoes, onions, green pepper, salt, pepper, corn and mustard.
Stir in enough mayonnaise to moisten salad and make it hold together. (You may need more mayonnaise than specified.)
Refrigerate until serving time. Best if made a day ahead.

notes: Note: Make cornbread with yellow corn meal. Add 1 small can green chili peppers and a pinch of sage before baking.
Best if made a day ahead

recipes.title: Tennessee Cornbread Salad
recipes.description: Layered Tennessee-style cornbread salad with sweet pickle juice dressing.

instructions.text: Crumble half the cornbread into the bottom of a large serving bowl.
In another bowl, combine tomatoes, green pepper, onion, pickles and bacon, blending well. Spoon half the vegetable mixture over cornbread.
Stir together mayonnaise and pickle juice. Spread half the dressing over vegetables.
Repeat layers to use remaining ingredients. Garnish as desired.
Cover tightly and chill 2 to 3 hours before serving.

notes: Layered presentation
Pickle juice adds tangy flavor to dressing
Chill 2-3 hours minimum

recipes.title: Louis Pappas' Famous Greek Salad
recipes.description: Legendary composed Greek salad from Tampa's iconic Louis Pappas restaurant - an elaborate presentation with potato salad, feta, shrimp, and anchovies.

instructions.text: Make a salad from potatoes, onions, parsley, green onion and moisten with salad dressing.
Line platter with lettuce. Place 3 cups potato salad in a mound in the center of the platter. Cover with remaining lettuce that has been shredded.
Arrange watercress on top. Place tomatoes around the outer edge with a few on top. Place cucumber wedges between tomatoes, making a solid base.
Slices of feta should be arranged on the top, with green pepper slices over all. On the top, place sliced beets with a shrimp on each slice and an anchovy fillet on the shrimp.
Olives, radishes and green onions can be arranged as desired.
Sprinkle with vinegar, oil and oregano. Serve with garlic-topped, toasted Greek bread.

notes: Famous Tampa restaurant recipe
Elaborate composed presentation - a meal in itself
Louis Pappas is a Tampa Bay landmark

recipes.title: Jamaican-Style Pork Stew
recipes.description: Caribbean-influenced pork stew with rum, allspice, and molasses - rich island flavors.

instructions.text: Heat oil in large pan. Dust pork with flour and brown in oil a few pieces at a time. Remove with slotted spoon and set aside.
Saute onion and garlic 5 minutes. Add rum and cook over high heat 1 minute, scraping up any browned bits. Return pork to skillet.
Add tomatoes, red pepper flakes, pepper, allspice and beef broth. Mix well. Bring to boil and add potatoes.
Reduce heat and simmer, covered, 45 to 60 minutes. Remove cover and simmer 10 minutes more to thicken sauce if necessary.
Stir in molasses and season with salt to taste. Serve plain or over rice.

recipes.pan_size: Large deep pan or Dutch oven
notes: Caribbean island flavors
Allspice and rum are signature Jamaican ingredients

recipes.title: Potato Latkes
recipes.description: Classic Jewish potato pancakes (latkes) for Hanukkah - with humorous editorial notes about the 'optional' onion debate.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients. Mix well.
Drop pancake mixture by tablespoonsful into a hot skillet generously greased with butter or shortening.
Fry until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with applesauce and/or sour cream.

notes: Carol Note: That 'optional' business can make or break your latkes. Better plan on making two batches, one with, one without. Say a blessing before starting - maybe that will help.
Carol Note: Which one, butter or shortening? And what's 'shortening'? Oil? Crisco? How much is [cut off]
Traditional Hanukkah recipe
Serve with applesauce and sour cream

flags.issue: Carol's second note cut off at bottom of image

recipes.title: Cheesy Ham and Potato Casserole
recipes.source_note: E-Z Cook-In All Purpose Casserole No. 307
recipes.description: Layered ham and potato casserole with cheddar cheese - microwave or conventional oven versions.

ingredients.prep_note: leftover turkey or chicken may be substituted

instructions.text: Mix together potatoes and diced meat. Spread half the mixture in E-Z Cook-In All Purpose Casserole.
In bowl, combine flour, celery seeds, salt, pepper and cheddar cheese. Sprinkle half this mixture over potatoes and meat.
Spread remaining potatoes and meat on top.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese mixture; dot with butter or margarine.
Heat the milk and cream in a 2 cup glass measure on full power for 1½ minutes; pour over potatoes and meat. Sprinkle with paprika.
Microwave on full power (uncovered) for 9½ to 10½ minutes. Give pan one half turn halfway through cooking time.
Cover loosely with waxed paper; let stand for 6 to 8 minutes.

recipes.pan_size: E-Z Cook-In casserole or baking dish
notes: FOR CONVENTIONAL OVENS: Add 1/3 cup milk additional. Preheat oven to 375°. Place casserole on cookie sheet and bake for 35 to 40 minutes until potatoes are tender.

recipes.title: Granola Chews
recipes.description: Chewy apricot-raisin granola treats - three cooking methods provided (oven, electric frypan, microwave).

instructions.text: OVEN: 22 minutes cooking time. Stir together oats, almonds, wheat germ and sesame seeds in bowl. Set aside.
Place brown sugar, butter, honey, water and salt in 3-quart saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, 7 minutes, or until butter melts and mixture is slightly thickened.
Pour brown sugar mixture over oat mixture. Stir until well blended. Pour into 15½x10½x1-inch jelly-roll pan.
Bake in 400-degree oven 15 minutes or until oats are lightly toasted, turning with spatula every 5 minutes.
Pour mixture back into jelly-roll pan, spreading mixture to edges of pan. Press mixture down slightly, using a spatula. Let stand 30 minutes.
Stir in apricots and raisins. Break into small pieces. Store in airtight container up to 1 week.

notes: ELECTRIC FRYPAN: Cook at 260°F, stirring constantly, 5 minutes until butter melts. Stir in oats, almonds, wheat germ, sesame seed. Cook, stirring frequently, 10 minutes.

MICROWAVE OVEN: 20 minutes. Combine brown sugar, butter, honey, water and salt in 3-quart glass bowl. Microwave on High 4 minutes. Stir. Microwave 4 minutes more. Stir in oats, almonds, wheat germ and sesame seed. Microwave on Medium (50%) 3 minutes. Stir. Microwave 9 minutes more.

recipes.title: Danish Ham and Cheese Cake
recipes.description: Elegant savory cheesecake appetizer with ham, three cheeses, tomato, and olives - serves 20 as hors d'oeuvres.

ingredients.prep_note: see recipe, or sliced French bread
mellow or aged, to melt completely

instructions.text: Butter 1½-quart souffle dish; set aside. Cut cheese approximately ⅜-inch thick.
Fit enough of the slices in bottom of dish to cover completely. Line sides of dish with 2-inch wide slices of cheese, fitting pieces closely together.
Reserve enough sliced cheese to cover top; dice remaining cheese and set aside.
Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft; remove from heat. Cool slightly.
Stir in remaining ingredients except garnish, crackers or bread, and spoon into cheese-lined dish, pressing gently.
Cover top completely with reserved cheese slices.
Bake in 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool completely.

notes: Can be assembled a day ahead and refrigerated; allow extra 5-10 minutes baking time
Both French bread and 'homemade' Blue Cheese Crackers compliment this delicious party-starter
Unlike souffles, this recipe always works

flags.issue: Some ingredient quantities not specified - cheese types and ham amount unclear

recipes.title: Carrot and Date Salad with Gorgonzola Dressing
recipes.source_note: From 'Down to Earth' by Georgeanne Brennan
recipes.description: Simple elegant salad with grated carrots, dates, and creamy Gorgonzola dressing.

ingredients.item: crumbled Gorgonzola, Maytag or other blue cheese
dandelion, arugula or young lettuce leaves

instructions.text: Using a vegetable peeler or paring knife, peel the carrots. Grate them on the large holes of a hand-held grater to make 1 cup. Set aside.
Chop the dates into pieces about the size of corn kernels and set them aside as well.
In a bowl, combine cheese, olive oil, vinegar and pepper, mashing and whisking the cheese to make a thick dressing.
Add carrots and dates to dressing and turn them until they are well-coated.
Transfer to a serving bowl or to individual salad plates and garnish with dandelion, arugula or lettuce. Serve at once.

notes: From Georgeanne Brennan's 'Down to Earth' cookbook
Serve immediately for best texture

recipes.title: Onion Roasted Potatoes
recipes.source_note: Lipton Onion Recipe Soup Mix product recipe
recipes.description: Simple and delicious roasted potatoes seasoned with Lipton onion soup mix.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C).
In large plastic bag, add all ingredients. Close bag and shake until potatoes are evenly coated.
Empty potatoes into shallow baking or roasting pan; discard bag.
Bake, stirring occasionally, 40 minutes or until potatoes are tender and golden brown.
Garnish, if desired, with chopped parsley.

notes: Classic Lipton recipe - simple and delicious
The plastic bag method ensures even coating

recipes.title: Kim Chee (Korean Cabbage Relish)
recipes.description: Traditional Korean fermented cabbage relish with garlic, ginger, and chili - ferment 1-5 days.

ingredients.prep_note: cut into 1½-inch lengths, then shredded lengthwise
finely chopped, or Tabasco to taste

instructions.text: Put cabbage in a bowl and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons salt; mix thoroughly but gently; let stand for 30 minutes.
In small bowl, combine scallions, garlic, red chili pepper and ginger root.
Rinse cabbage twice under running cold water and combine it with scallion mixture and 1 tablespoon salt.
Transfer mixture to an earthenware or glass crock or large jar; add water just to cover and let mixture stand in a cool place, tossing it occasionally, for 1 to 5 days.
Serve the Kim Chee at room temperature or slightly chilled. It may be stored in the refrigerator in a tightly covered jar.

notes: Traditional Korean fermented side dish
Ferment longer for stronger flavor
Store refrigerated in tightly covered jar

recipes.title: Cholesterol-Free Mayonnaise
recipes.description: Homemade mayonnaise using egg substitute and polyunsaturated oil - no cholesterol.

instructions.text: In a blender, combine egg substitute, vinegar, sugar, dry mustard, salt, celery salt, paprika, cayenne and 1/4 cup of oil.
Cover; blend at medium until mixed, about 5 seconds.
Continue blending; add remaining oil in a fine stream through the small top opening until mixture is thick.
Scrape sides as necessary.

notes: Cholesterol-free alternative to regular mayonnaise
Use polyunsaturated oil for heart health

recipes.title: Hot Dan's Dressing
recipes.description: Versatile mustard-based dressing for coleslaw, potato salad, or deviled eggs.

ingredients.item: half and half or undiluted evaporated milk

instructions.text: Combine mustard, sugar, vinegar, half and half and salt in a small bowl; beat with rotary beater until light and fluffy.

notes: Good for cole slaw, potato salad or deviled eggs
For Deviled Eggs: Use 3 tablespoons of the dressing for mixing with the mashed yolks of 6 hard-cooked eggs
For Potato Salad: Use all the dressing to mix with 6 cups sliced, cooked potatoes, 1/2 cup chopped celery and 1/4 cup chopped green onions

recipes.title: No-Frills Granola Bars
recipes.description: Simple homemade granola bars with oats, almonds, sunflower seeds, and corn syrup.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, mix dry ingredients, add liquids and stir together.
Press mixture firmly into a greased 9-by-13 or 10-by-15 pan with spatula or waxed paper.
Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cut into bars while warm.
Once bars are cool, remove from pan and wrap individually. Store in cool, dry place for up to two weeks or in the refrigerator indefinitely.

notes: Coconut-Almond Bars variation: Add 1 1/2 cups coconut, increase almonds to 1 cup and vegetable oil to 3/4 cup
Any of the following may be added: dried fruits, chocolate chips, sesame seeds, chopped nuts of your choice

recipes.title: Granola Crunch
recipes.description: Crunchy oven-toasted granola with coconut, sesame seeds, and optional raisins - great as cereal or snack.

ingredients.prep_note: dry, unsweetened may be used if preferred

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 225 degrees.
In a large bowl, mix thoroughly first 5 ingredients.
In a separate bowl, combine honey and oil.
Add to dry ingredients, stir well. Add the cold water, a little at a time, mixing until crumbly.
Pour mixture into a large, shallow baking pan that has been lightly greased. Distribute evenly to edges of pan.
Place on middle rack of oven and bake for 1-1/2 hours, stirring every 15 minutes. Add almonds and continue to bake for 30 minutes or until mixture is dry and light brown in color.
It should feel crisp to the touch.
Turn off oven and allow mixture to cool in oven. Add raisins. Remove from oven, cool and store in tightly covered container in cool, dry place.

notes: Can be enjoyed as a breakfast cereal, bagged as a snack or made into bars (see Granola Crunch Bars)

recipes.title: Granola Crunch Bars
recipes.description: Easy baked bars made from Granola Crunch cereal and eggs.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300 degrees.
Combine Granola Crunch and eggs thoroughly.
Spread on greased cookie sheet, pressing into oblong shape about 6-by-8 and 1/4 inch thick. Press firmly.
Impress bars 1-1/2 inches wide and 2 inches long.
Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 5 minutes, then break apart.
Cool completely, wrap and store in covered container.

notes: Uses Granola Crunch cereal as base

recipes.title: Pigskin Barbecue
recipes.description: A fork-tender Boston butt pork roast slow-simmered in a tangy barbecue sauce with peppers and onions.

instructions.text: Randomly pierce the surface of the roast with a sharp knife.
In large heavy pot, over medium heat, brown roast on all sides in hot oil.
In small bowl, combine water, tomato sauce, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, pepper sauce, celery seed and chili powder.
Pour sauce over roast and bring to boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer 2 hours or until fork-tender, basting roast with sauce frequently.
During last 30 minutes, stir in onion and red or green pepper.
Thicken sauce with cornstarch, if desired. Slice or chop roast to serve.

notes: Piercing the roast allows the sauce to penetrate and flavor the meat

recipes.title: Garlicky White Bean Salad
recipes.description: A flavorful white bean salad with garlic, herbs, and lemon - perfect for summer gatherings.

ingredients.prep_note: juice and grated rind [RECONSTRUCTED - standard for bean salads]

instructions.text: Cover beans with cold water and soak overnight.
Drain beans and place in a pan with the stock, garlic, bay leaves and thyme. Simmer until beans are tender-firm, about 1 hour.
Drain and discard bay leaf. Combine cooked beans with remaining ingredients except parsley in a glass bowl.
Cover and chill thoroughly. Garnish with parsley.

notes: Some quantities reconstructed from standard white bean salad recipes (original clipping was cut off)
Added olive oil which is standard in bean salads but was likely in cut-off portion
Source: The Tampa Tribune, Salads section

flags: Some ingredients reconstructed - original clipping was partially cut off on right side
Added olive oil and clarified lemon quantity based on standard white bean salad recipes

recipes.title: Fruit Salad
recipes.description: A light fruit salad with canned fruits and sugar-free pudding mix for a creamy texture.

ingredients.item: crushed pineapple in its own juice

instructions.text: Mix pineapple and fruit cocktail together.
Add oranges and cherries, if desired.
Add sugar-free instant pudding mix, gradually add to desired pudding consistency.
Stir in bananas.
Refrigerate. Stir before serving.

notes: Using sugar-free pudding makes this a lighter dessert option

recipes.title: Ann Landers' Meatloaf
recipes.description: A classic meatloaf recipe from the famous advice columnist, using onion soup mix for extra flavor.

instructions.text: Beat loaf ingredients thoroughly (ground round, eggs, bread crumbs, ketchup, Accent, warm water, and onion soup mix).
Put into loaf pan.
Cover with 2 strips bacon, if you like that flavor.
Pour 1 8-ounce can of tomato sauce over all.
Bake 1 hour at 350°F (175°C).

notes: Accent is a brand name for MSG (monosodium glutamate) - can be omitted if preferred
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 937.jpeg

recipes.title: Sauerkraut Hot Dish
recipes.description: A hearty Midwestern hot dish with pork, sauerkraut, noodles, and cream of mushroom soup - a family favorite for gatherings.

instructions.text: In a large skillet, brown meat.
Add the onions and celery; cook until onions are transparent.
Stir in sauerkraut, noodles, soup and mushrooms; season with salt and pepper.
Spoon into a greased 2-qt. casserole.
Cover and bake at 350°F (175°C) for 1-1/2 hours or until the meat is tender. Stir occasionally.

notes: From the contributor: 'We often serve this hearty dish at family gatherings, and the men especially seem to enjoy it. My sister gave me this recipe about 15 years ago, and it has been a favorite ever since. The blend of ingredients is a pleasant surprise.'

recipes.title: Nothing-Fancy Meatballs in Darned Good Marinara Sauce
recipes.description: Simple, flavorful meatballs baked in the oven and served with a quick homemade marinara sauce.

ingredients.item: firm-textured white or whole wheat bread
red wine, beer, beef broth or milk

ingredients.prep_note: pulled in pieces, with their juices

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place bread in blender container, cover and turn into coarse crumbs by pulsing motor on and off. Pour crumbs into mixing bowl.
To blender container, add wine (or broth or milk) onion and garlic; cover and blend on medium speed until onion is coarsely pureed, stopping motor once or twice to push onion into blades.
Pour over crumbs; add beef, egg and seasonings. Mix thoroughly by hand.
Divide and shape into 16 meatballs, using a 2-ounce ice cream scoop if you have one.
Arrange meatballs in single layer in 9-x 13-inch baking pan, place on middle shelf of oven and bake 30 minutes, or until meatballs are lightly browned.
While meatballs bake, make sauce: In 1-quart saucepan over medium heat, heat oil briefly. Add garlic; cook and stir 1 minute.
Add tomatoes, tomato paste and basil; bring to a simmer, turn heat to low and cook uncovered 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in grated cheese. Add browned meatballs, bring again to a simmer, cover and cook 15 minutes.
Serve hot on split sub rolls or over pasta, with additional grated cheese, if desired.

notes: Exchanges: 1 vegetable, 3 meat, 3 fat

recipes.title: Sausage and Sauerkraut Casserole
recipes.description: A simple casserole combining pork sausage, macaroni, tomatoes, and sauerkraut - a family recipe for over 50 years.

instructions.text: Cook macaroni according to package directions.
Meanwhile, brown sausage in a skillet; drain, reserving 1 tablespoon drippings.
Add tomatoes and sauerkraut to pork and cook for 2 minutes.
Drain macaroni; stir into skillet along with cheese.
Spoon into a greased 8-in. square baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, at 350°F (175°C) for 20 minutes.

notes: From the contributor: 'This recipe has been in our family for over 50 years, and it's always been our favorite casserole! Now that our four children are grown and gone, I don't often make family-sized meals...but we still enjoy this casserole often, because it's so simple to prepare and reheats nicely.'
If Cooking for Two: Casserole makes delicious leftovers since it reheats well.

recipes.title: Mexican Pork Chops and Beans
recipes.source_note: Reynolds Oven Cooking Bags recipe card
recipes.description: Tender pork chops baked with salsa, kidney beans, and colorful peppers in an oven cooking bag for easy cleanup.

ingredients.item: sweet peppers (green, yellow, orange or red)

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Shake flour in Reynolds Oven Cooking Bag; place in 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Add salsa, lime juice, chili powder and garlic powder to bag. Squeeze bag to blend ingredients.
Place pork chops in bag. Spoon beans and peppers around pork chops.
Close bag with nylon tie; cut 6 half-inch slits in top.
Bake until pork chops are tender, 35 to 40 minutes.
Let stand in bag 5 minutes before serving.

notes: Equipment needed: 1 large size (14"x20") Reynolds Oven Cooking Bag
Use Reynolds large oven cooking bag for best results
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 259.jpeg

recipes.title: Chicken Waldorf Salad
recipes.source_note: Kraft General Foods / Miracle Whip recipe card, 1991
recipes.description: A classic Waldorf salad variation with cubed chicken, apples, celery, raisins, and walnuts in a creamy dressing.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients until blended.
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

notes: Can substitute mayonnaise for Miracle Whip if preferred

recipes.title: Savory Baked Chicken
recipes.source_note: Kraft / Miracle Whip 'Top It Hot' recipe card
recipes.description: Tender baked chicken marinated in a zesty lemon-oregano dressing mixture.

instructions.text: Combine salad dressing, lemon juice and seasonings; mix well.
Pour over chicken; chill several hours or overnight.
Reserve salad dressing mixture; place chicken, skin side up, on rack in baking pan.
Bake at 425°F (220°C), 40 minutes, brushing occasionally with salad dressing mixture.

notes: Marinating overnight gives best flavor

recipes.title: Homestyle Chicken and Biscuit Dumplings
recipes.source_note: Reynolds Oven Cooking Bags recipe card
recipes.description: Comfort food classic with chicken drumsticks, vegetables, and fluffy buttermilk biscuit dumplings cooked in an oven bag.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Shake flour in Reynolds Oven Cooking Bag; place in 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Add gravy mix, garlic powder and water. Squeeze bag to blend ingredients.
Place carrots and celery in bag in even layer. Sprinkle chicken with seasonings; place on top of vegetables.
