Pour batter on top of nut mixture. Do not mix.
Beat butter, powdered sugar, and cream cheese until smooth.
Drop cream cheese mixture by teaspoon on top of batter (do not drop by edge of pan).
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 55 minutes.

notes: Also called Earthquake Cake - the cream cheese sinks and creates 'fault lines'
Do not mix layers - they create marbled effect when baked

recipes.title: Refrigerator Oatmeal Cookies
recipes.description: Crispy slice-and-bake oatmeal cookies made with lard for extra goodness.

instructions.text: Cream shortening (lard), gradually add brown and white sugar, beating until light.
Add well-beaten eggs and vanilla and mix well.
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together several times. Stir into first mixture.
Add rolled oats and nuts and stir until thoroughly mixed.
Form into long rolls and chill in refrigerator several hours, preferably overnight.
Slice very thin and bake on ungreased cookie sheet at 350°F (175°C) for 7 to 8 minutes.
Bake slightly longer if cookies are cut thicker.

notes: Lard gives these cookies extra crispness and flavor

recipes.title: Ginger Snaps
recipes.description: Crisp, spicy ginger snap cookies with bread crumbs for extra crunch.

instructions.text: Sift together flour, sugar, soda, salt, cinnamon, and ginger.
Add crumbs, molasses, shortening, and water. Mix together thoroughly.
Roll thin on lightly floured board and cut with cookie cutter.
Bake on ungreased baking sheet at 375°F (190°C) for 10 minutes.

notes: Bread crumbs add extra crispness to these cookies

recipes.title: Pineapple Cookies
recipes.description: Soft, fruity drop cookies made with crushed pineapple and chopped nuts.

instructions.text: Cream shortening. Add sugar slowly and continue creaming.
Add eggs, slightly beaten. Blend well.
Add vanilla and pineapple.
Mix and sift dry ingredients. Add to first mixture gradually.
With the last addition of flour mixture, add nut meats.
Drop cookies from teaspoon on a greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) about 12 minutes.

notes: Use undrained pineapple for moist, flavorful cookies

recipes.title: Monkey Bread
recipes.description: Classic pull-apart yeast bread with buttery diamond-shaped pieces baked in a tube pan.

instructions.text: Dissolve yeast in warm water.
Melt 1/2 cup butter, add salt, sugar, and evaporated milk. Stir until sugar dissolves.
Stir butter mixture into yeast mixture.
Beat in flour all at once until batter is smooth and elastic.
Knead until satiny smooth.
Cover and raise until double (about 1 hour).
Punch down, roll out to rectangle 18x12 inches.
Cut into diamond shapes about 3 inches.
Dip each piece in melted oleo (remaining 1/2 cup) to coat all sides.
Place overlapping in ungreased 12-cup tube pan.
Raise until double.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes.

notes: Pull apart to serve - no slicing needed

recipes.title: Black Bread
recipes.description: A dark rye bread with cocoa, molasses, and caraway seeds for rich, complex flavor.

instructions.text: In large bowl, combine all-purpose flour, yeast, cocoa, and caraway seeds.
Measure molasses in 2-cup measure, then pour into saucepan.
Use same cup, add 1 cup warm water to remaining molasses. Mix in butter, sugar, and salt.
Heat just until butter melts, stir to blend.
Add to flour mixture. With electric mixer, mix 1/2 minute at low speed, then turn to high and mix for 3 minutes.
Combine 1 cup rye flour and mix into dough. Then add more rye flour to make soft dough.
Turn onto floured board and knead until smooth.
Cover and let rest 20 minutes.
Punch dough and divide in half. Shape into 2 loaves.
Put in oiled pans. Let rise to double.
Bake until done.

notes: Cocoa gives the bread its dark color without chocolate flavor
Temperature inferred - original did not specify

flags: Baking temperature not specified in original - standard rye bread temp used

recipes.title: Quick 'n Easy Key Lime Pie with Foolproof Meringue
recipes.description: A quick key lime pie with cooked cornstarch-stabilized meringue that won't weep.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C).
In a small saucepan, combine cornstarch, sugar, and water. Cook and stir until thick and clear. Set aside.
Beat egg yolks slightly. Stir in condensed milk. Add lime juice and blend well.
Spread filling in warm pie crust.
Whip egg whites and salt until soft peaks form.
Continue beating while spooning in the warm cornstarch mixture. Continue whipping until stiff peaks form.
Spread meringue over filling, sealing to edge of crust.
Bake at 300°F (150°C) for about 30 minutes.
Cool completely on a rack out of drafts before refrigerating.

notes: The cornstarch stabilizes the meringue to prevent weeping

recipes.title: Min's Famous Lemon Pie
recipes.description: A classic lemon meringue pie with a tangy filling and fluffy meringue topping.

instructions.text: Combine cornstarch, 1 1/4 cups sugar, lemon juice, and lemon rind.
Beat egg yolks and add to cornstarch mixture.
Gradually add boiling water, stirring constantly.
Heat to boiling point and boil gently 4 minutes, stirring all the time.
Pour into baked pie shell.
Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry.
Gradually beat in the 6 tablespoons sugar.
Spread meringue over top of pie, carefully sealing in all the filling.
Bake in hot oven at 425°F (220°C) for 4-5 minutes or until browned.
Cool on cake rack away from drafts. Serve cold.

notes: Cool away from drafts to prevent meringue from weeping

recipes.title: Impossible Taco Pie
recipes.description: A Bisquick-based impossible pie with seasoned ground beef, green chilies, and cheese.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Spray a large pie pan.
Cook ground beef and onion until well done. Drain fat.
Stir in taco seasoning.
Spread meat mixture in pie plate. Put chilies on top.
Beat milk, Bisquick mix, and eggs until smooth.
Pour gently over meat mixture.
Bake 35 minutes or until knife comes out clean.
Top with cheese and tomatoes. Bake another 8-10 minutes.

notes: No Bisquick version: Use 3/4 c. flour, 1/4 c. butter, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/4 tsp salt instead

recipes.title: New England Doughnuts (Mom's)
recipes.description: Old-fashioned cake doughnuts with nutmeg, made with Spry shortening.

instructions.text: Cream shortening with sugar.
Add well-beaten egg and milk.
Sift together flour, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg.
Add dry ingredients to wet mixture and mix well.
Roll out dough to 1/2 inch thick.
Cut with doughnut cutter.
Fry in hot oil until golden brown on both sides.

notes: Spry can be substituted with any vegetable shortening

recipes.title: Spice Cake
recipes.description: A moist spice cake made with strong coffee, sour milk, and raisins, topped with egg white frosting.

instructions.text: Cream shortening with brown sugar.
Add egg yolks (reserve whites for frosting).
Add coffee and spices.
Add sour milk with baking soda dissolved in it.
Fold in chopped raisins.
Add flour gradually until batter is proper consistency.
Bake in greased pan at 350°F (175°C) until done.
Frost with egg white frosting.

notes: Use whites of eggs for frosting (7-minute frosting style)

flags: Flour amount flexible - 'enough to make batter'
Temperature not specified - standard cake temp used

recipes.title: Crazy Cake with Fudge Frosting
recipes.description: A classic Depression-era chocolate cake made without eggs, milk, or butter, topped with quick fudge frosting.

instructions.text: For cake: Mix flour, 2 cups sugar, 6 tbsp cocoa, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
Add water and oil. Beat until smooth.
Pour into greased 9x13 pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 25-30 minutes.
For frosting: Combine 1 cup sugar, cocoa, butter, milk, and salt in saucepan.
Bring to a full boil and boil for 1 1/2 minutes.
Remove from heat, add vanilla, and spread on cooled cake.

notes: Also known as Wacky Cake or Depression Cake
No eggs, milk, or butter in the cake itself

recipes.title: Snickerdoodles
recipes.description: Classic cinnamon-sugar coated cookies with cream of tartar for that signature tangy flavor.

instructions.text: Mix shortening, 1 1/2 cups sugar, and eggs together.
Sift flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt. Stir into creamed mixture.
Chill dough.
Mix 2 tsp sugar and 2 tsp cinnamon together for rolling.
Roll dough into balls the size of small walnuts.
Roll balls in cinnamon-sugar mixture.
Bake until lightly browned.

notes: Cream of tartar gives these their distinctive tangy flavor
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 845.jpeg

flags: Temperature not specified - standard cookie temp used

recipes.title: English Toffee
recipes.description: Classic buttery toffee with pecans, cooked in a skillet.

instructions.text: Melt oleo in skillet until it bubbles but does not brown.
Add sugar, water, and pecans.
Cook over moderate heat until sugar is light brown.
Pour into greased pan.
Blot excess oleo with paper towel.
Cool and break into pieces.

notes: Blotting excess butter helps the toffee set properly

recipes.title: English Toffee (Dorie's Chocolate-Topped)
recipes.description: Buttery toffee cooked to hard crack stage, topped with melted chocolate and nuts.

instructions.text: Cook sugar and butter together to 310°F (hard crack stage).
Remove from heat and stir in 1/2 cup almonds or pecans.
Spread on flat surface to cool.
Melt 12 oz chocolate bar over hot water.
Pour melted chocolate over cooled candy.
Break up when cool.

notes: Use a candy thermometer for best results
recipes.variant_notes: Chocolate-topped version with candy thermometer method

recipes.title: Homemade Granola
recipes.description: A large batch of hearty homemade granola with oats, wheat germ, nuts, seeds, and coconut.

instructions.text: Mix all dry ingredients together.
Mix all liquid ingredients together.
Combine wet and dry mixtures. Should taste like cookie dough for sweetness and salt.
Crumble mixture into small pieces like pastry dough.
Spread on baking sheets.
Bake at 250°F (120°C) for 2 hours, stirring every 15-20 minutes.
Be careful not to burn. Makes about 11 pounds.

notes: Large batch recipe - can be halved
Store in airtight containers

recipes.title: Homemade Granola (Honey-Molasses Version)
recipes.description: Large batch granola with option for honey or honey-molasses sweetener.

instructions.text: Mix all dry ingredients together.
Add liquids and mix well together.
Cook in 250°F (120°C) oven, stirring every 15 minutes for 2 hours or until dry.

notes: Two sweetener options: brown sugar + 1/2 c honey, OR 2 c honey + 1/4 c molasses
recipes.variant_notes: Includes Wheatena and molasses option

recipes.title: Crazy Cake with Peanut Butter
recipes.description: Depression-era chocolate cake with vinegar, topped with fudge frosting and peanut butter.

instructions.text: Mix flour, 2 cups sugar, 6 tbsp cocoa, baking soda, and salt.
Add vinegar, oil, vanilla, and water. Mix well.
Pour into greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 30 minutes.
Cool slightly and spread peanut butter on top.
For frosting: Combine 1 cup sugar, 1/4 cup cocoa, liquid, butter, and salt.
Bring to good boil, cook for 1 1/2 minutes.
Add vanilla and beat to spreading consistency.
Spread over peanut butter layer.

notes: Double frosting recipe and cook 3 min for fudge consistency
Peanut butter layer goes under the frosting
recipes.variant_notes: Adds peanut butter layer between cake and frosting

recipes.title: No Bake Oatmeal Fudge Cookies
recipes.description: Quick no-bake cookies with chocolate, peanut butter, and oatmeal.

instructions.text: Combine sugar, milk, butter, and cocoa in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil and boil for 1-2 minutes (to soft ball stage).
Remove from heat.
Add peanut butter, vanilla, and oatmeal. Mix well.
Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper.
Let cool and set.

notes: Work quickly - mixture sets fast
Marked as 'Best recipe' on original card

recipes.title: Shortbread Cookies
recipes.description: Simple, buttery shortbread cookies with just three ingredients.

instructions.text: Mix soft butter and sugar together.
Stir in flour and mix well.
Chill dough.
Roll to 1/3 inch thickness.
Cut out shapes.
Bake at 300°F (150°C) for 20 minutes.
Do not let them get brown.

notes: Add 1/4 tsp baking powder for pop tarts variation
Low temperature keeps cookies pale and tender

recipes.title: Christmas Morning Casserole
recipes.description: A make-ahead breakfast casserole with sausage, eggs, bread, and cheese - perfect for Christmas morning.

instructions.text: Cook sausage until done, crumble, and drain in colander to remove fat.
Beat eggs slightly.
Cube bread slices.
Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into greased 9x13 inch pan.
Refrigerate at least 12 hours (overnight).
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 1 hour.

notes: Must be made ahead and refrigerated overnight
Perfect for Christmas morning - prep the night before
recipes.variant_notes: File 657, 1077, and special named version show a 4x crowd-size version: 32 eggs, 24 bread slices, 4 lb sausage, 2 qts milk, 4 cups cheese, 4 tsp dry mustard, 4 tsp salt

recipes.title: Pie Crust (Graham Cracker Type - Healthy)
recipes.description: A healthier pie crust alternative made with wheat germ, soy flour, oatmeal, and yeast, pressed like graham cracker crust.
recipes.servings_yield: 3 pie crusts (2 large, 1 small) OR 2 medium

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together with fork until well combined.
Divide into 3 portions (2 large and 1 small, or 2 medium).
Pat around edge and bottom of pie pans evenly, as for graham cracker crust.
Bake in 300°F (150°C) oven for about 10 minutes or until browned lightly.

notes: High protein, healthy alternative to graham cracker crust
Good for no-bake pie fillings
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 855.jpeg

recipes.title: Heart Smart Party Mix
recipes.description: A healthier version of party mix using reduced oil and featuring oat cereal.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 250°F (120°C).
Mix all cereals, pretzels, and peanuts together in a large roasting pan.
Whisk together oil, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, paprika, and cayenne.
Pour oil mixture over cereal mixture and toss to coat.
Bake for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes.

notes: Lower oil than traditional party mix
Adjust cayenne to taste

recipes.title: Min's Drop Sugar Cookies
recipes.description: Soft drop sugar cookies with cinnamon, flattened with a sugar-dipped glass.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Sift together flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
Cream oleo and 1 cup sugar with vanilla.
Add egg and cream until mixture is fluffy.
Add flour mixture to sugar mixture and mix until smooth.
Add 2 tablespoons milk.
Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Flatten with bottom of glass dipped in sugar.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) until lightly browned.

notes: Dip glass in water first, then sugar, for best flattening

recipes.title: Ma Cooper's Molasses Cookies
recipes.description: Old-fashioned soft molasses cookies with warm spices.

instructions.text: Cream sugar and shortening together.
Add molasses, cinnamon, ginger, and salt.
Dissolve baking soda in 1 cup hot water and add to mixture.
Add enough flour to make a dough that can be rolled.
Roll out and cut with cookie cutter.
Bake until done.

notes: Flour amount is flexible - add until dough is rollable
Recipe continues on back of card (not shown)
Image restored - contains handwritten annotations

flags: Recipe continues on back of card - some details may be missing
Temperature not specified - standard cookie temp used

recipes.title: Ma Cooper's White Cookies
recipes.description: Soft, cakey white cookies flavored with nutmeg, made with sour milk.

instructions.text: Cream sugar and shortening together.
Add eggs and beat well.
Add sour milk.
Dissolve baking soda in 1/3 cup sweet milk and add.
Add baking powder, salt, and nutmeg.
Add enough flour to make a soft dough.
Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheet and bake until done.

notes: Temperature not specified - standard cookie temp used
Image restored - contains handwritten annotations

flags: Temperature not specified

recipes.title: Homemade Graham Crackers
recipes.description: Homemade graham crackers made with whole wheat flour, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.

instructions.text: Cream butter and brown sugar together.
Mix flour, salt, baking powder, and cinnamon together.
Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture alternately with water.
Mix well and let stand 30 minutes.
Roll on floured board to 1/8 inch thick.
Cut into 2-inch squares and mark with fork if desired.
Bake on oiled cookie sheet at 350°F (175°C) for 20 minutes.

notes: Let dough rest for best rolling
Score with fork to resemble store-bought

recipes.title: Freda's Molasses Cookies
recipes.description: Soft, spiced molasses cookies made with ginger and cinnamon.

instructions.text: Cream shortening and sugar together.
Add eggs, molasses, and cold water. Cream together.
Sift together ginger, cinnamon, flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture.
Chill dough.
Roll out and cut, or drop by spoonfuls.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 8-10 minutes.

notes: Chill dough for easier handling

recipes.title: Ida's Drop Molasses Cookies
recipes.description: Soft molasses drop cookies with cold strong coffee for extra depth of flavor.

instructions.text: Cream shortening and sugar.
Add well-beaten eggs and molasses.
Mix flour, salt, soda, cinnamon, and ginger.
Add dry ingredients alternately with cold coffee.
Drop from teaspoon onto cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes.

notes: Cold strong coffee adds depth to the molasses flavor

recipes.title: Peanut Brittle
recipes.description: Classic homemade peanut brittle with raw peanuts, cooked to golden perfection and pulled thin.

instructions.text: Mix sugar, Karo syrup, and 1 cup cold water in heavy saucepan.
Cook until soft ball/crack stage (275°F/135°C).
Add butter and raw peanuts.
Cook until peanuts are well done (golden brown), stirring constantly.
Remove from heat.
Mix baking soda, vanilla, and salt dissolved in 2-3 tsp cold water.
Quickly stir soda mixture into hot candy (it will foam).
Pour onto 3 buttered cookie sheets.
Pull thin when cool enough to touch.

notes: Use raw peanuts - they cook in the candy
Pull while still warm for thin brittle

recipes.title: Mino's B.S. Cookies (Butterscotch Oatmeal)
recipes.description: Hearty oatmeal cookies with peanut butter, butterscotch chips, grated carrots, and raisins.

instructions.text: Cream peanut butter and butter together.
Add brown and white sugar, beating until light.
Combine oats, flour, salt, and baking powder.
Beat egg with milk.
Stir both mixtures into peanut butter batter.
Fold in carrots, raisins, and butterscotch chips.
Drop by tablespoon, 2 inches apart, onto ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 10 minutes.

notes: B.S. stands for Butterscotch
Grated carrot adds moisture and nutrition

recipes.title: Jean's Egg Nog
recipes.description: A rich, cooked egg nog with vodka, made from scratch with egg yolks and cream.

instructions.text: Combine milk and heavy cream in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil or simmer.
Beat egg yolks with sugar until light.
Slowly add hot milk mixture to egg yolks, tempering.
Return to heat and cook until thickened slightly.
Remove from heat and add vanilla.
Cool, then stir in vodka.
Chill before serving.

notes: Can substitute rum or bourbon for vodka
Chill thoroughly before serving

recipes.title: Best Peanut Butter Cookie
recipes.description: Classic peanut butter cookies with the signature fork marks, using both brown and white sugar.

ingredients.prep_note: or 1 tsp molasses added to white

instructions.text: Cream shortening and peanut butter together.
Add granulated and brown sugar, mixing well.
Blend in egg.
Mix flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture.
Roll dough into balls.
Place on cookie sheet and flatten with fork (making criss-cross pattern).
Bake at 375°F (190°C) until lightly brown.

notes: Classic fork marks create signature look
Can use 1 tsp molasses + white sugar instead of brown sugar

recipes.title: Rhubarb Cake (Simple Dump)
recipes.description: A simple rhubarb dump cake with jello, marshmallows, and cake mix - minimal effort, maximum flavor.

instructions.text: Place cut rhubarb in bottom of 9x13 pan.
Sprinkle sugar over rhubarb.
Sprinkle dry jello over sugar.
Add marshmallows.
Prepare cake mix according to package directions and pour over top.
Bake until done.

notes: Layer ingredients - do not mix
Temperature not specified - standard cake temp used

flags: Temperature not specified

recipes.variant_notes: Simplified version with more marshmallows

recipes.title: Eleanor's Zucchini Bread
recipes.description: A moist, cinnamon-spiced quick bread made with grated zucchini (or squash).

instructions.text: Mix together: eggs, oil, sugar, vanilla, and grated squash.
In another bowl, combine flour, salt, cinnamon, baking soda, and baking powder.
Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients and mix well.
Pour into 2 greased loaf pans.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 60-75 minutes.

notes: 3 tbsp cinnamon is generous - adjust to taste
Can use zucchini or yellow squash

recipes.title: Butterscotch Cookies - Mom Baker's
recipes.description: Classic butterscotch cookies with brown sugar and nuts.

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar together.
Add beaten eggs.
Sift soda and cream of tartar with 2 cups flour.
Add dry mixture to creamed mixture with vanilla.
Add remaining flour and nuts.
Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10-12 minutes until golden.

notes: Temperature not specified on card - 350°F is standard for similar cookies
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 878.jpeg

recipes.title: Zucchini Bread with Coconut
recipes.source_note: handwritten recipe card with coffee grinder illustration
recipes.description: Moist zucchini bread with coconut and nuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two loaf pans.
Beat eggs, add sugar and oil, mix well.
Add grated zucchini and mix.
In separate bowl, combine flour, coconut, cinnamon, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and nuts.
Add dry ingredients to wet mixture and stir until combined.
Divide batter between prepared pans.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour or until toothpick comes out clean.

notes: Contains coconut which distinguishes this from other zucchini bread recipes
recipes.variant_notes: This version includes coconut

recipes.title: Zucchini Casserole (Meal Dish)
recipes.description: Hearty layered casserole with ground beef, zucchini, rice, and cheese.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Brown ground beef with onion. Season with garlic salt and oregano. Drain excess fat.
Cook instant rice according to package directions.
Slice zucchini 1/4" thick and boil until tender. Drain well.
Layer half the zucchini in bottom of greased casserole dish.
Cover with beef mixture and rice.
Spoon cottage cheese over meat layer.
Add remaining zucchini.
Spread mushroom soup over top and sprinkle with grated cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 30-45 minutes until bubbly and cheese is melted.

notes: Temperature not specified - 350°F is standard for casseroles

flags: Temperature and bake time inferred

recipes.title: Whole Wheat Nut Bread (Good)
recipes.description: Healthy whole wheat bread with applesauce, soy flour, raisins, and nuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a loaf pan well.
Mix dry ingredients: whole wheat flour, soy flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
Add beaten eggs and milk with stirring.
Add applesauce and brown sugar, stir lightly.
Add raisins and nuts.
Let dough stand 20 minutes in well-oiled pan.
Bake at 350°F for one hour, or until toothpick comes out clean.

notes: Marked 'GOOD' on original card
Contains soy flour for extra protein
Rest time before baking is important
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 881.jpeg

recipes.title: Date Cake (Good)
recipes.description: Moist date cake with nuts, using the classic soda-soaking method for dates.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x13 pan or bundt pan.
Dissolve baking soda in warm water. Pour over cut-up dates and soak for a few minutes.
Cream butter and sugar until fluffy.
Add egg and mix well.
Add soaked dates with liquid.
Add vanilla, nuts, flour, salt, and baking powder. Mix until combined.
Pour into prepared pan and bake at 350°F for 45-50 minutes until toothpick comes out clean.

notes: Marked 'Good' on original card
Soaking dates in soda water softens them and adds moisture
Temperature not specified - 350°F is standard
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 882.jpeg

recipes.title: Impossible Lemon Pie
recipes.description: Self-crusting lemon coconut pie made in a blender - the crust forms itself during baking.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 10-inch pie pan.
In blender, combine sweetened condensed milk, water, lemon juice, eggs, butter, and vanilla.
Blend on low for 3 minutes.
Pour into greased pie pan.
Let stand 5 minutes.
Sprinkle coconut over top.
Bake at 350°F for 35-40 minutes, until knife comes out clean.
Cool before serving.

notes: Part of the 'Impossible Pie' family where crust forms during baking
Blender method creates smooth filling

recipes.title: Fig Bar Cookies
recipes.description: Homemade fig bars with a sweet fig filling wrapped in tender cookie dough.

instructions.text: Make filling: Combine chopped figs, sugar, water, and lemon juice in a saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring, until thick like jam. Cool completely.
Make dough: Mix brown sugar, eggs, and vanilla together.
Stir in flour, baking soda, and salt. Mix until dough forms.
Turn out on floured board and knead a few times until smooth.
Roll dough into a 12x14 inch oblong.
Cut dough into 4 strips, each 3 1/2" wide and 12" long.
Spoon filling in a mound down the center of each strip.
Using a spatula, turn in sides of each strip to enclose filling. Press edges together.
Turn seam side down. Use sharp knife to cut each strip into 10 pieces.
Place on greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 10-12 minutes or until puffed and firm to touch.

notes: Similar to commercial Fig Newtons but homemade
Let filling cool completely before assembling

recipes.title: Jan's Caramel Corn
recipes.description: Crunchy oven-baked caramel corn with a long bake time for extra crispness.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 200°F (95°C).
In a saucepan, combine brown sugar, corn syrup, butter, cream of tartar, and salt.
Cook over medium heat, stirring until mixture comes to a boil.
Boil for 5 minutes without stirring.
Remove from heat and stir in baking soda (mixture will foam).
Pour over popped corn in a large roasting pan and mix well to coat.
Bake at 200°F for 2 hours, stirring 2-3 times during baking.
Remove and spread on wax paper to cool. Break into pieces.

recipes.pan_size: large roasting pan or cookie sheet
notes: Long low-temperature bake creates extra crispy caramel corn
Stir during baking for even coating
recipes.variant_notes: Similar base recipe but uses 200°F for 2 hours instead of 250°F for 1 hour

recipes.title: Date Filled Sugar Cookies
recipes.description: Classic rolled sugar cookies with a sweet date filling.

instructions.text: Make filling: Combine dates, sugar, and water in saucepan. Simmer 5 minutes until thick.
Add lemon juice and pinch of salt to filling. Cool completely.
Cream shortening and sugars until fluffy.
Add egg, milk, and vanilla. Mix well.
Sift together flour, salt, and baking soda. Add to creamed mixture.
Chill dough for 1 hour.
Roll dough 1/8 inch thick. Cut into rounds.
Place filling on half the rounds, top with remaining rounds, press edges to seal.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 10-12 minutes until lightly golden.

notes: Chill time helps dough roll easily
Temperature not on card - 375°F is standard for filled cookies

recipes.title: Drop Filled Cookies with Dates
recipes.description: Soft drop cookies filled with a sweet date mixture.

instructions.text: Make filling: Combine dates, water, and sugar. Cook slowly until thick. Cool.
Mix soft shortening, brown sugar, and eggs together until creamy.
Stir in sour milk or buttermilk (or water).
Add flour, baking soda, and salt. Mix well.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet.
Top each with small amount of date filling, then another small amount of dough.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 8-10 minutes.

notes: Can substitute water for sour milk if needed
Work quickly with warm dough

recipes.title: Anise Snaps
recipes.description: Crisp, thin cookies flavored with anise seed - a traditional European-style cookie.

instructions.text: Sift together cake flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, and salt.
Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add beaten eggs and beat well.
Mix well, then add flour mixture and anise seed.
Blend until smooth dough forms.
Chill dough several hours or overnight.
Roll dough 1/8 inch thick on floured surface.
Cut into shapes.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) until lightly brown, about 8-10 minutes.

notes: Must chill dough before rolling
Traditional European-style cookie
Anise gives distinctive licorice flavor

recipes.title: Apricot Preserves
recipes.description: Simple homemade apricot preserves with just fruit, water, and sugar.

instructions.text: Wash and pit apricots.
Place apricots in water and simmer until soft, about 10 minutes.
Remove apricots with slotted spoon and puree until smooth.
Stir sugar into apricot puree.
Cook slowly over low heat until mixture is thick, about 40 minutes, stirring frequently.
Spoon into hot sterilized jars and seal.

notes: Use fully ripe apricots for best flavor
Stir frequently to prevent scorching

recipes.title: Orange Julius
recipes.description: Creamy orange smoothie made with pudding mix and Dream Whip.

instructions.text: Combine orange juice, vanilla pudding mix, and Dream Whip in blender.
Blend for 30 seconds until smooth and frothy.
Serve immediately.
Optional: Substitute strawberries for a strawberry version.

notes: Can substitute frozen strawberries as noted on card
Best served immediately while frothy

recipes.title: Chewy Muesli
recipes.description: Homemade granola-style muesli with oats, almonds, honey, and dried fruit.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix together rolled oats, sliced almonds, and cinnamon in a large bowl.
Soften honey to make it pourable (warm briefly if needed).
Stir honey into oat mixture until well coated.
Spread on baking sheet and bake at 350°F.
Stir well every 10 minutes until oats are golden, about 40-50 minutes total.
Remove from oven and stir in raisins and dried fruit while still warm.
Cool completely and store in airtight container.

notes: Stir frequently for even browning
Add fruit after baking to keep it chewy
Similar to homemade granola

recipes.title: Bob Meaker's Mustard Sauce
recipes.description: Unique mustard sauce thinned with beer and aged for 3 days.

instructions.text: Leave salad dressing in jar.
Add Colman's mustard, salt, sugar, and cayenne pepper to jar.
Mix with mixer or whisk until well combined.
Thin to consistency of thick cream with beer.
Recap jar and age 3 days before using.

notes: Beer adds unique flavor and helps thin the sauce
Must age 3 days for best flavor
Image restored - contains handwritten annotations

recipes.title: Ultimate 7-Layer Dip
recipes.description: Classic layered Mexican dip with beans, sour cream, salsa, and toppings.

instructions.text: Mix beans and taco seasoning mix together.
Spread bean mixture onto bottom of 9-inch pie plate.
Layer remaining ingredients over bean mixture: sour cream, salsa, lettuce, cheese, green onions, and olives.
Cover and refrigerate several hours or until chilled.
Serve with tortilla chips or assorted crackers.

notes: Can be made ahead and refrigerated
Classic party appetizer

recipes.title: Jalapeno Pepper Jelly
recipes.description: Sweet and spicy pepper jelly, perfect for appetizers with cream cheese.

instructions.text: Cut up peppers and put with vinegar in blender or food processor to grind.
Combine pepper mixture with sugar in a large saucepan and bring to a boil.
Boil 4 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand 1 minute.
Add pectin and food coloring if desired.
Pour into hot, sterilized jars to within 1/8-inch of top.
Wipe top and threads with clean, damp cloth. Put hot lid on with sealing compound next to jar.
Screw band on evenly and tightly. Invert jar for a few seconds so hot jelly can destroy any mold or yeast on lid.
Cool, test for seal, remove bands and store.

notes: Wear gloves when handling hot peppers
Great served over cream cheese with crackers
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 898.jpeg

recipes.title: Rhubarb Conserve
recipes.description: Sweet conserve combining rhubarb, dried peaches, and crushed pineapple.

instructions.text: Chop dried peaches into little chunks with a sharp knife or kitchen scissors.
Soak peaches overnight in 1 cup of water.
Next morning, sterilize 4 pint jars.
Combine soaked peaches (with liquid), rhubarb, pineapple, and sugar in a large pot.
Cook until conserve looks thick, clear and shiny. A good test for thickness is when a portion spooned onto a cool plate sets quickly.
Pour into the 4 sterilized pint jars and cover surface with melted paraffin.

notes: Heavenly with hot toast or biscuits
Also delicious as a sauce over ice cream
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 899.jpeg

recipes.title: Sausage Cheese Balls
recipes.description: Savory sausage and cheese appetizer balls, perfect for parties.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Shred cheese if not pre-shredded.
Mix all ingredients together until well combined.
Form into 1-inch balls.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake 15 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: Can be frozen uncooked
For firmer texture, add extra 3 cups biscuit mix and 2 cups shredded cheese

recipes.title: Chili Rellenos
recipes.description: Simple fried jalapeno and cheese cakes.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together until well combined.
Heat oil in skillet over medium heat.
Drop mixture by spoonfuls into hot oil to form little cakes.
Fry until golden brown on both sides.
Drain on paper towels and serve warm.

notes: Simple, quick appetizer
Adjust jalapeno amount to taste

recipes.title: Party Mix (4-Chex Variety)
recipes.description: Classic party mix using four varieties of Chex cereal.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 250°F (120°C).
Heat butter in large shallow roasting pan (about 15 x 10 x 2 inches) in oven until melted.
Remove from oven. Stir in seasoned salt and Worcestershire sauce.
Add all Chex cereals and nuts. Mix until all pieces are coated.
Bake in oven 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes.
Spread on absorbent paper to cool.

notes: Party Mix may be frozen, so make a double batch
Thaw at room temperature in container

recipes.title: Italian Seasoning Mix
recipes.description: Homemade Italian seasoning blend for dressings and marinades.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Store in airtight container.
Use to season dressings, marinades, or sprinkle on dishes.

recipes.title: Pretzel Bake (Seasoned)
recipes.description: Olive oil and herb seasoned pretzels, slow-baked for extra crunch.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 100°F (or lowest setting).
Mix all seasonings together in a small bowl.
Pour olive oil over pretzels in a large bowl and mix well.
Add seasoning mixture by spoonfuls, sprinkling and shaking to coat evenly.
Spread on baking sheet.
Bake 1-2 hours at 100°F, stirring occasionally.

notes: Very low temperature for long bake time creates extra crispy pretzels
Temperature unusually low - may need 200°F for standard ovens

recipes.title: Thumbprint Cookies (Whole Wheat)
recipes.description: Healthier thumbprint cookies made with whole wheat flour, honey, and olive oil.

instructions.text: Mix flour, honey, olive oil, salt, vanilla, and beaten eggs together well.
Gather dough into a ball and chill for 1 hour.
Roll dough in your hands to form small balls.
Dip balls in chopped nuts and place on cookie sheet.
Make a thumbprint indentation in the top of each cookie.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 12-15 minutes.
Fill thumbprints with jam or jelly after baking if desired.

notes: Healthier version using olive oil instead of butter
Temperature not on card - standard 350°F assumed
Fill with jam after baking

recipes.title: Pecan Crunch Crust
recipes.description: Crunchy pecan and bread crumb crust for pies or desserts.

instructions.text: Chop pecans in blender until finely ground.
Mix pecans, bread crumbs, melted shortening, and sugar together.
Press mixture onto bottom of greased cake pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10-12 minutes until golden, or use unbaked with no-bake fillings.

notes: Can be prebaked or used unbaked depending on filling
Temperature not specified - 350°F is standard

flags: Temperature and bake time inferred

recipes.title: Banana Pound Cake
recipes.description: Dense, rich pound cake with mashed bananas and pecans - perfect for banana bread lovers.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan.
Beat shortening at medium speed with electric mixer 2 minutes or until creamy.
Gradually add sugar, beating 5 to 7 minutes.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating just until yellow disappears.
Combine mashed banana, buttermilk, and vanilla.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add flour mixture to shortening mixture alternately with banana mixture, beginning and ending with flour mixture. Mix at low speed after each addition just until blended.
Stir in pecans.
Spoon batter into prepared pan.
Bake at 325°F for 1 hour and 30 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool in pan on wire rack 15 minutes; remove cake from pan, and cool completely on wire rack.

notes: Great for breakfast or dessert
Use very ripe bananas for best flavor

recipes.title: Creamy Cheese Grits
recipes.description: Southern comfort food - creamy grits made with chicken broth and sharp cheddar cheese.

instructions.text: Combine chicken broth and whipping cream in a large saucepan.
Bring to a boil.
Stir in grits and return to a boil.
Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in cheese until melted.
Cool 10 minutes before serving.

notes: For instant grits, use 2 1/3 cups grits and low sodium chicken broth
Classic Southern breakfast side dish
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 908.jpeg

recipes.title: The Lady's Cheesy Mac
recipes.attribution: The Lady & Sons Savannah Country Cookbook
recipes.description: Rich Southern-style baked macaroni and cheese from the famous Savannah restaurant.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cook macaroni according to package directions; drain.
Place hot macaroni in a large bowl and, while still hot, add the cheddar cheese. Stir to melt.
In a separate bowl, combine beaten eggs, sour cream, butter pieces, salt, and milk.
Add egg mixture to the macaroni mixture and stir to combine.
Pour into a casserole dish.
Bake at 350°F for 30-45 minutes until set.
Top with additional cheese if desired.

notes: From Paula Deen's famous Savannah restaurant
Add cheese while pasta is hot to help it melt

recipes.title: Baked Soy Beans
recipes.description: Old-fashioned baked beans made with soy beans, molasses, and salt pork.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Combine all ingredients except salt pork in a bean pot or casserole dish.
Cook salt pork in frying pan until browned.
Add rendered fat to beans.
Dice the browned salt pork and place on top of beans.
Bake at 350°F for 1 3/4 to 2 hours until bubbly and thickened.

notes: Healthier alternative using soy beans instead of navy beans
Traditional New England style with salt pork

recipes.title: Moors and Christians (Cuban Black Beans and Rice)
recipes.description: Traditional Cuban dish of seasoned black beans served over white rice - 'Moros y Cristianos' as the Cubans call it.

instructions.text: Place dried beans in large saucepan and add water to cover generously. Cover and let stand to soak overnight.
Simmer beans 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until tender, adding additional water if necessary. Drain.
In skillet, cook bacon until lightly browned. Remove bacon.
Add onion and garlic to bacon fat and cook until tender.
Add cooked onion and garlic with remaining ingredients except rice to beans and bacon in large saucepan.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer slowly 1 1/2 hours or until beans are tender.
Serve the dark 'Moors' (beans) spooned over the pale 'Christians' (rice) and garnish with raw chopped onion.

notes: Traditional Cuban comfort food
Also includes slow cooker method: cook on low 10-12 hours or high 4-5 hours
Regional context: Very popular in Tampa area due to Cuban influence

recipes.title: Janet's Cabbage Salad
recipes.description: Asian-style cabbage salad with ramen noodles, almonds, and sesame seeds.

instructions.text: Chop cabbage and onion, place in large bowl.
Brown broken ramen noodles and almonds (can toast in dry pan).
Add noodles, almonds, sesame seeds, and sunflower seeds to cabbage.
Whisk together sugar, vinegar, oil, and soy sauce for dressing.
Add sesame seeds to dressing if desired.
Pour dressing over salad and toss just before serving.

notes: Popular potluck salad
Don't add dressing until ready to serve to keep noodles crispy
Discard ramen seasoning packet or save for another use

recipes.title: Four Bean Salad
recipes.description: Classic marinated four-bean salad with sweet vinegar dressing.

instructions.text: Drain all canned beans and combine in a large bowl.
Slice green pepper and onion and add to beans.
In a separate bowl, combine oil, vinegar, sugar, and salt.
Stir until sugar dissolves.
Pour dressing over beans.
Let stand in refrigerator 24 hours before serving.
Drain before serving if desired.

notes: Must marinate 24 hours for best flavor
Classic potluck dish

recipes.title: Doris' Salad (Layered)
recipes.description: Make-ahead layered salad with lettuce, peas, cauliflower, and bacon.

instructions.text: Layer chopped lettuce in bottom of large bowl or 9x13 dish.
Add layer of uncooked (thawed) frozen peas.
Add layer of raw cauliflower pieces.
Add layer of crumbled bacon and sweet onion.
Frost the top with mayonnaise, spreading to edges to seal.
Sprinkle with shredded cheese.
Refrigerate for 24 hours.
Just before serving, toss and sprinkle generously with McCormick Salad Herbs.

notes: Must make 24 hours ahead
Don't toss until ready to serve
Mayo seals in freshness

recipes.title: Sweet and Pungent Bean Salad
recipes.description: Fresh string bean salad with sweet and tangy vinegar dressing.

ingredients.prep_note: or half green and half wax beans
low-salt canned beans may be used

instructions.text: Par-cook the beans until just barely tender. Drain, reserving liquid.
To the cooking liquid in pan, add sugar, seasonings, and vinegar.
Bring to a boil.
Put drained beans, onions, and green pepper in a bowl.
Add the boiling liquid mixture.
Cover and chill.
Drain and serve on lettuce, garnished with pimento strips.

notes: Use fresh beans for best texture
Can substitute canned low-salt beans for restricted diets

recipes.title: Layered Lettuce Salad (Witz Restaurant)
recipes.attribution: Witz Restaurant, East Cape Girardeau, Ill.
recipes.description: Restaurant-style 24-hour layered salad with creamy dressing.

ingredients.prep_note: washed and torn into bite-size pieces

instructions.text: In a 9-by-13-inch casserole dish, layer first the lettuce, then celery, then green pepper, then peas, then onion.
Mix together mayonnaise, salad oil, sugar, and Parmesan cheese.
Gently spread dressing over layered ingredients, sealing to edges.
Sprinkle cheddar cheese and bacon on top.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 24 hours.
Serve untossed, garnished with croutons.

notes: From Witz Restaurant, Route 146, East Cape Girardeau, Illinois
Must refrigerate 24 hours
Serve without tossing

recipes.title: Mission Inn Honey Mustard Dressing
recipes.description: Restaurant-style honey mustard dressing with poppy seeds.

instructions.text: Blend all ingredients together until smooth.
Refrigerate until ready to use.

notes: Restaurant recipe
Adjust Worcestershire and Tabasco to taste

recipes.title: Honey Mustard Dressing (Mickie Craig)
recipes.description: Creamy homemade honey mustard dressing, stores for up to 7 days.

instructions.text: Put all ingredients in a blender.
Process until combined and smooth.
Store in a glass jar in the refrigerator for up to 7 days.

notes: Use vegetable oil, not olive oil
Stores up to 7 days refrigerated

recipes.title: Mashed Whipped Sweet Potatoes
recipes.description: Sweet potato casserole with apples, almonds, and marshmallow topping.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Combine mashed sweet potatoes with almonds, apples, brown sugar, salt, cinnamon, vanilla, and melted butter.
Whip together until well combined.
Place in greased casserole dish.
Cover with mini marshmallows and sprinkle a little brown sugar over top.
Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes until marshmallows are golden.

notes: Classic holiday side dish
Almonds add nice crunch

recipes.title: Macaroni Salad (Neighbors)
recipes.description: Classic macaroni salad with tuna (or chicken/turkey), vegetables, and creamy dressing.

instructions.text: Cook macaroni in salted water until tender. Blanch in cold water and drain well.
Combine macaroni with celery, onion, optional radishes and cucumbers.
Chop hard-boiled eggs and add to mixture.
Drain tuna and flake into salad (or use chicken/turkey).
Make dressing: Mix mayonnaise, vinegar, mustard, salt, and pepper.
Add dressing to salad and mix well.
Store in refrigerator overnight or make early in the morning for best flavor.

notes: Better if made ahead and refrigerated overnight
Can substitute chicken or turkey for tuna
Dated Late 1973

recipes.title: Chicken Salad (Simple)
recipes.description: Simple chicken salad with peas, celery, and olives.

instructions.text: Bone and chop chicken meat.
Cook peas and drain.
Chop celery and olives.
Combine all ingredients with salad dressing made with sugar and vinegar.

notes: Recipe is minimal/incomplete
Dressing proportions not specified
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 926.jpeg

Dressing proportions not specified

recipes.title: Sweet Society Chips (Min's)
recipes.description: Sweet pickle chips made over 9 days with a sweet vinegar syrup.

ingredients.prep_note: unwashed, may use a few more

instructions.text: Days 1-4: Leave pickles whole. Heat fresh water to boiling each day and pour over pickles. Use fresh water each day. Do not cover and use no salt.
Day 5: Slice pickles 1/4 inch thick.
Make syrup: Combine vinegar, sugar, pickling spices, and salt. Bring to boiling point.
Add green food coloring if desired and pour syrup over sliced pickles.
Days 6, 7, 8: Drain syrup, bring to boil, and pour back over pickles.
Day 9: Drain syrup and bring to boil. Pack pickles in jars, pour hot syrup over, and seal.

notes: 9-day process
Original recipe says to drop chips in hot syrup before packing
Use unwashed cucumbers
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 507.jpeg

recipes.title: Salmon Patties (Croquettes)
recipes.description: Light and fluffy salmon patties using baking powder to make them airy.

instructions.text: Drain salmon, reserving 1/4 cup of the liquid.
Mix salmon well with fork, breaking up any bones.
Add baking powder to reserved salmon liquid and beat with fork until foaming (should foam up to about 3/4 cup).
Add foamy liquid to salmon along with egg, flour, and pepper.
Mix well - batter will be thin.
Add onion or garlic if desired.
Heat oil in skillet. Using two iced tea spoons, scoop and drop batter into hot oil.
Patties will turn themselves. Cook several minutes until golden on both sides.

notes: The baking powder makes these light and fluffy
Beating the baking powder into the salmon liquid creates the foamy texture
Patties will flip themselves when ready

recipes.title: Chicken and Dumplings
recipes.description: Classic stewed chicken with homemade dumplings.

instructions.text: Sprinkle chicken with 1/2 tsp salt and pepper. Place chicken, onion, celery, carrot, bouillon cubes and bay leaf in 5-quart Dutch oven.
Add water. Cover and bring to boil; reduce heat and simmer 45 minutes.
Mix together flour, parsley, baking powder and remaining 1 tsp salt.
Stir in mayonnaise and milk until well mixed.
Drop by tablespoonfuls onto chicken.
Boil gently uncovered 10 minutes, cover and cook 10 minutes more or until dumplings are fluffy.

notes: Mayonnaise in dumplings makes them tender
Less than an hour total cook time for chicken
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 931.jpeg

recipes.title: Baked Curry Chicken
recipes.description: Creamy curry chicken baked with condensed soup and mayonnaise.

instructions.text: Place chicken in 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Bake uncovered in 350°F oven about 30 minutes.
Mix together soup, mayonnaise, celery and curry powder.
Spread evenly over chicken.
Cover with foil and continue baking 30 to 40 minutes or until chicken is tender.

notes: Easy weeknight dinner
Curry gives mild, aromatic flavor

recipes.title: Oven Baked Mayonnaise Chicken
recipes.description: Crispy baked chicken coated in seasoned mayonnaise and bread crumbs.

instructions.text: Stir together mayonnaise, cheese, parsley, green onion, mustard, soy sauce and pepper.
Dip chicken pieces in mayonnaise mixture, then coat evenly in bread crumbs.
Place in shallow baking pan.
Bake in 350°F oven 1 hour or until chicken is tender.

notes: Mayonnaise keeps chicken moist
Creates crispy coating without frying

recipes.title: Cheese Bake (Macaroni Casserole)
recipes.description: Cheesy macaroni and ground beef casserole with green chilies.

instructions.text: Cook macaroni as directed on package; drain.
Brown ground beef in skillet, stirring to crumble; drain off excess fat.
Stir in contents of sauce mix envelope, milk and mayonnaise.
Remove seeds from chili peppers and chop coarsely; add peppers and macaroni to skillet.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Spoon into lightly-greased 1 1/2-quart casserole.
Melt butter; stir in crumbs and parsley flakes. Sprinkle over casserole.
Bake at 400°F for 15 to 20 minutes, until lightly browned.

notes: Green chilies are optional but add nice flavor
Quick weeknight meal
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 932.jpeg

recipes.title: Quadrettini Casserole
recipes.source_note: newspaper clipping - 'Ground Beef Can Be Gourmet Dish'
recipes.description: Italian-style casserole with ground beef, spinach, tomatoes, and noodles topped with Parmesan.

instructions.text: In a large saucepan melt butter and add oil. Add carrot, onion, celery and garlic; cook until tender.
Add ground beef and cook, stirring with fork, until browned.
Add tomato paste, tomatoes, salt, oregano, basil, thyme and Tabasco.
Simmer uncovered for 1 1/2 hours.
Cook noodles according to package directions; drain and rinse with cold water.
Cook spinach and drain well. Add noodles and spinach to sauce.
Turn into a 2-quart casserole, sprinkle with cheese.
Bake in a 350°F oven for 20 minutes or until heated through.

notes: Italian name means 'little squares' for the pasta shape
Can use chicken or bacon instead of beef
Freezes well

recipes.title: Maryland Lady Crab Cakes
recipes.source_note: newspaper clipping - response to reader request
recipes.description: Simple, traditional Maryland-style crab cakes.

instructions.text: Pick through crabmeat to remove any shell pieces.
Combine crabmeat, bread crumbs, and egg.
Mix gently to combine without breaking up crab too much.
Form into patties.
Pan fry in butter or oil until golden brown on both sides, or broil.

notes: Recipe is minimal but authentic Maryland style
Don't overmix - keep crab lumps intact
Cooking method not specified - can pan fry or broil

recipes.title: Chicken La Soy
recipes.source_note: newspaper clipping from Tampa chicken cooking contest
recipes.description: Asian-inspired baked chicken with soy sauce and seasonings.

instructions.text: Place chicken in single layer, skin side up, in baking pan.
Sprinkle flavor enhancer, beef bouillon, onion flakes, garlic flakes and pepper evenly over chicken.
Mix corn oil and soy sauce together.
Pour over chicken.
Bake in 400°F oven, covered, about 1 hour or until fork can be inserted in chicken with ease.

notes: Contest recipe from Tampa, Florida
MSG optional - can omit if preferred

recipes.title: Mrs. Wunderle's $5,000 Hearty Sausage Casserole
recipes.description: Prize-winning sausage casserole with pancake topping.

ingredients.item: bulk pork sausage or ground beef

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Brown sausage and onion; drain.
Stir in flour and seasonings.
Add tomatoes and vegetables; cook, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Simmer while preparing Topping.
For Topping: In medium bowl, combine all Topping ingredients except 1/2 cup cheese and paprika; blend well.
Pour hot meat mixture into shallow 2-quart casserole or 12x8-inch baking dish.
Spoon Topping over meat; sprinkle with reserved cheese and paprika.
Bake uncovered 20 to 25 minutes until golden brown. Serve immediately.

notes: $5,000 prize-winning recipe
Pancake topping is unique
Refrigerate any leftovers

recipes.title: Mrs. DeMarco's $5,000 Caramel Apple Cake
recipes.description: Prize-winning moist apple cake with caramel cinnamon frosting.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (325°F for glass pan). Grease 13x9-inch pan.
Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup; level off.
In large bowl, combine first nine ingredients (flour through eggs); beat 3 minutes at medium speed.
Stir in apples, nuts and raisins.
Pour into greased pan.
Bake 30 to 40 minutes until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool.
In small bowl, blend Frosting ingredients until smooth. Spread over cake.

notes: $5,000 prize-winning recipe
If using self-rising flour, omit salt, baking powder and soda
Glass pan requires lower temperature

recipes.title: The World's Greatest Meatloaf
recipes.description: Flavorful meatloaf with cheese and herbs, shaped like a roast.

instructions.text: Beat egg lightly in medium mixing bowl. Add MSG, salt, pepper, basil, thyme, ketchup, mustard and bread crumbs.
Dissolve bouillon cubes in boiling water; add to bowl and mix until all ingredients are well blended.
Mix in celery, onion and cheese.
Break ground beef and add to bowl; mix lightly but thoroughly with a fork.

To shape loaf like a roast: Take an 18-inch piece of 12-inch wide waxed paper, put meat mixture in center and fold paper over meat to make ends meet. Hold ends of paper; with other hand, push meat mixture toward fold, forming a roll.
Lift waxed paper, fold ends of meat toward center, repeat pushing and shaping until smooth compact roll 12 to 14 inches long is formed.
Slide roll onto baking sheet or shallow baking pan.
If a loaf shape and a moister meat loaf are desired, press meat mixture lightly into a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan.
Bake uncovered in 375°F oven for 60 to 70 minutes.

notes: Unique shaping technique creates roast-like appearance
MSG is optional
Cheese inside makes it extra moist

recipes.title: Teen Bean Bake
recipes.source_note: Pillsbury's 6th Bake-Off Junior Third Prize Winner
recipes.description: Franks and baked beans with a cornmeal topping - a Bake-Off prize winner.

instructions.text: Combine frankfurters, beans, ketchup, water and mustard in 12x8x2-inch baking dish.
Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt into large bowl. Stir in cornmeal.
Add egg, milk, shortening and onion all at once to dry ingredients; stir just to combine.
Spoon over beans.
Bake at 400°F for 35 to 40 minutes.

notes: Pillsbury Bake-Off prize winner
Kid-friendly recipe
Note on card: 'Uses Baked Beans'

recipes.title: Crisco Salmon Treats
recipes.description: Creamy salmon squares breaded and pan-fried until golden.

instructions.text: Make a white sauce by blending melted Crisco, flour and seasonings. Add milk and cook until thick. Cool slightly.
Stir in 1 egg, 1 cup of the crumbs, salmon, onion and lemon juice.
Pack into loaf pan and chill.
Cut slices from loaf, dip in remaining crumbs, then in egg beaten with water, and again in crumbs.
Fry in Crisco over medium heat, until nicely browned on all sides.
If desired, serve with spiced fruit.

notes: Includes Crisco pan frying guide
Can serve with spiced fruit

recipes.title: Liver Dumplings
recipes.description: Traditional German-style liver dumplings cooked in beef broth.

instructions.text: Grind beef liver fine.
Mix in eggs, bread crumbs, ground onion, and allspice until well combined.
Bring beef broth to a boil.
Drop liver mixture by spoonfuls into boiling broth.
Boil uncovered for 20 minutes.

notes: Traditional German recipe (Leberknödel)
Serve in broth as soup or drain and serve as main dish

recipes.title: Brown Rice Cheese Strata
recipes.source_note: newspaper clipping - 'Brown Rice is a Good Side Dish'
recipes.description: Layered casserole with brown rice, cottage cheese, and cheddar.

ingredients.item: tomato slices or green pepper rings

instructions.text: Cook brown rice as directed on package label.
Combine brown rice, cottage cheese, pimiento, egg and salt.
Cook celery and onion in butter until onion is tender, not brown.
Stir into brown rice mixture.
Spoon 1/2 of the brown rice mixture into a 2-quart casserole; sprinkle with 1/2 of the cheese.
Repeat, using remaining brown rice mixture and cheese.
Cover. Bake at 375°F until hot, 25 to 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with paprika. Garnish with tomato slices or green pepper rings, if desired.

notes: Nutritious meatless entree
Brown rice adds fiber and nutty flavor
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 943.jpeg

recipes.title: Herb Brown Rice
recipes.source_note: newspaper clipping - 'Brown Rice is a Good Side Dish'
recipes.description: Savory brown rice cooked with herbs and sautéed vegetables.

instructions.text: Cook brown rice as directed on package label; omit butter and add rosemary, basil and bay leaf to rice while cooking.
Cook celery, mushrooms, and garlic in butter until celery is tender, not brown.
Sprinkle with salt.
Add chives and stir into hot cooked brown rice.
Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

notes: Great side dish for meat, fish or poultry
Herbs added during cooking infuse the rice with flavor
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 944.jpeg

recipes.title: Scalloped Potatoes
recipes.description: Creamy scalloped potatoes using powdered milk, with optional ham.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 2-quart casserole dish.
Peel and thinly slice potatoes. Slice onion.
Melt 3 tbsp margarine over low heat; blend in flour, salt, and pepper.
Cook until mixture is smooth and bubbly; remove from heat.
Stir in SACO Mix'n Drink powder and water. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly.
Arrange 1/3 of the potatoes in prepared casserole dish.
Sprinkle 1/2 the onion and, if desired, ham over potatoes. Pour 1/3 of the milk mixture over all.
Repeat layers. Dot top with 1 tbsp margarine.
Cover and bake 30 minutes. Uncover and bake until potatoes are tender, 60 to 70 minutes longer.
Let stand 5 to 10 minutes before serving.

notes: Nutrition info: 270 calories, 8g fat, 2mg cholesterol, 428mg sodium per serving (without ham)
Can substitute regular milk for powdered milk and water

recipes.title: Casserole-Roasted Duck
recipes.description: Steam-roasted duck with crispy skin, served with Madeira or wine sauce.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 450°F.
Wash duck in cold water inside and out and pat dry with paper towels. Pull fat deposits from cavity.
With tip of sharp paring knife, score skin (not flesh) over breast and thighs to cross-hatch evenly in 1-inch diamonds.
Turn wing tips back and secure by tucking akimbo behind back.
Sprinkle duck inside and out with salt and pepper.
Arrange breast side up in heavy casserole (preferably enameled cast-iron) with tight-fitting lid.
Pour in boiling water or brown stock to depth of 1 inch; cover casserole and steam-roast duck 30 minutes.
Reduce oven to 350°F and continue to roast duck, covered, another 30 minutes.
Remove duck from casserole, pour off and reserve cooking liquid.
Return duck to casserole and roast, uncovered, 45 minutes-1 hour, or until juices run clear when flesh of thigh is pierced.
Transfer duck to serving platter and let stand 15 minutes before carving.
Meanwhile, skim fat from reserved cooking liquid. Bring liquid to a boil with optional tablespoon of Madeira or dry red wine. Serve piping hot in pitcher or sauceboat to pour over duck.

notes: Nutrition per 1/4 duck without skin: 223 calories, 12.4g fat, 99mg cholesterol, 72mg sodium, 26g protein
Scoring the skin helps fat render and creates crispy skin

recipes.title: Chicken or Ham Casserole
recipes.description: Layered casserole with meat, vegetables, taco seasoning, and Bisquick topping.

instructions.text: Lay meat on bottom of casserole dish.
Put kernel corn over meat.
Put cooked broccoli over that.
Add taco seasoning and a little cheese.
Mix 1 cup Bisquick with 1 cup milk and 2 eggs - beat well.
Pour Bisquick mixture over top.
Bake about 30 minutes until top is set and golden.
Add sour cream, lettuce, chopped tomatoes, and grated cheese to serve.

notes: Temperature not specified on card - 350°F assumed
Versatile recipe - use whatever meat you have

recipes.title: Peach Pie (Simple)
recipes.description: Classic peach pie with butter and a top crust.

instructions.text: Put peaches in pie shell.
Sprinkle dry ingredients (sugar, flour, salt) over peaches.
Dot with butter.
Add lemon juice if desired.
Add top crust and crimp edges.
Bake at 425°F for 30-40 minutes until golden brown.

notes: Adjust sugar based on sweetness of peaches

recipes.title: Cherry Dream Pie
recipes.description: No-bake cherry pie with cream cheese base and cherry jello topping.

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese with 1-2 tbsp milk.
Spread cream cheese mixture over baked pie shell.
Dissolve small package cherry Jello in 1 cup boiling water.
Cool to syrupy consistency.
Add 1 can cherry pie filling to jello mixture.
Chill until partially set.
Pour into crust over cream cheese layer.
Chill until firm.
Add whipped cream to serve.

notes: No-bake refrigerator pie
Let jello cool to syrupy before adding pie filling
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 528.jpeg

recipes.title: Peach Pie
recipes.description: Simple handwritten peach pie with butter and flour topping.

instructions.text: Put peaches in pie shell.
Mix sugar, flour, and salt; sprinkle dry ingredients over peaches.
Dot with butter and add lemon juice if desired.
Add top crust.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 30-40 minutes until golden brown.

notes: Handwritten version - simpler than magazine clipping version
recipes.variant_notes: Handwritten family version with slightly different proportions

recipes.title: Ginger Chicken
recipes.source_note: handwritten recipe card (From the Kitchen of: Fran - Grandma Baker)
recipes.description: Pan-seared chicken with fresh ginger, soy sauce, and lime.

instructions.text: Peel ginger and mince (reserve some sliced ginger for cooking).
Put oil in skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken skin side down and cook until browned.
Season with salt, pepper, and sliced ginger.
Bake until chicken is tender (about 30-35 minutes at 375°F/190°C).
Return skillet to burner; add chicken broth and soy sauce.
Stir until sauce is slightly reduced.
Stir in lime juice and minced ginger before serving.

notes: Real ginger is specified - do not substitute ground ginger
The lime adds brightness to balance the ginger heat
From Grandma Baker's personal collection

flags: Baking temperature inferred from standard chicken recipes

recipes.title: Barilla Four Layer No-Boil Lasagna
recipes.description: Easy no-boil lasagna using oven-ready noodles with Italian sausage or ground beef.

ingredients.item: Barilla Lasagna & Casserole Sauce or Marinara Sauce

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Spray 13x9x3-inch deep baking pan with no-stick cooking spray.
Remove 16 lasagna noodles from box. DO NOT BOIL.
In medium bowl, beat eggs. Stir in ricotta, 2 cups mozzarella, and Parmesan.
Layer lasagna by slightly overlapping sheets. Lasagna will expand to edges during cooking. Spread fillings to edges to seal in and cook lasagna during baking.
Layer 1: Spread 1 cup sauce on bottom of baking pan.
Layer 2: Place 4 uncooked noodles, ⅓ ricotta mixture, half of browned meat, 1 cup mozzarella, and 1 cup sauce.
Layer 3: Place 4 uncooked noodles, ⅓ ricotta mixture, and 1½ cups sauce.
Layer 4: Place 4 uncooked noodles, remaining ricotta mixture and browned meat, and 1 cup sauce.
Layer 5: Place 4 uncooked noodles and remaining sauce.
Bake, covered with foil until bubbly, 50-60 minutes.
Uncover. Add remaining 1 cup mozzarella and bake 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Let stand 15 minutes before cutting.

notes: For 2-inch deep pan: make 3 layers using 12 uncooked noodles. Spoon half jar of sauce on bottom; layer with 4 noodles, half ricotta mixture and browned meat, and remaining sauce from first jar. Add 1 cup mozzarella. Layer 4 noodles, remaining mixture and browned meat and half the second jar of sauce. Top with 4 noodles, remaining sauce and bake as directed.

recipes.title: Golden Baked Chicken
recipes.description: Crispy baked chicken coated in potato flakes and Parmesan cheese without frying. The paprika gives the chicken pieces a pleasant punch, plus pretty color.

ingredients.prep_note: 3 to 4 pounds each, cut up and skin removed

instructions.text: In a bowl, combine the potato flakes, Parmesan cheese, parsley, paprika, garlic salt, onion powder, and pepper.
Dip chicken pieces into melted butter, then into potato flake mixture to coat.
Place on two greased 15-inch x 10-inch x 1-inch baking pans.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 50-60 minutes or until chicken juices run clear.

notes: A large batch recipe - makes 12 servings
Perfect for holiday gatherings

recipes.title: Corned Beef Casserole
recipes.description: Simple noodle casserole with canned corned beef and American cheese.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cook noodles according to package directions; drain.
In a large bowl, combine corned beef, cream of chicken soup, milk, cheese, and onion.
Fold in cooked noodles.
Transfer to a greased 2-quart casserole dish.
Bake uncovered at 350°F (175°C) for 30 minutes or until heated through and bubbly.

notes: Instructions inferred from standard casserole preparation - original card shows only ingredient list

recipes.title: Impossible Taco Pie
recipes.description: The pie that does the impossible by making its own crust. A Mexican-inspired pie with ground beef and Bisquick.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 400°F (200°C). Lightly grease pie plate, 10x1½ inches.
Cook and stir ground beef and onion in 10-inch skillet until beef is brown; drain.
Stir in taco seasoning mix. Spread in pie plate; sprinkle with chilies.
Beat milk, baking mix, and eggs until smooth, 15 seconds in blender on high or 1 minute with hand beater.
Pour into plate. Bake 35 minutes.
Top with tomatoes; sprinkle with cheese.
Bake until cheese is golden brown and knife inserted in center comes out clean, 8 to 10 minutes longer.
Cool 5 minutes.
Serve with dairy sour cream, chopped tomatoes, and shredded lettuce if desired.

notes: High Altitude Directions (3500 to 6500 feet): No adjustments are necessary.
Bisquick creates a self-forming crust during baking
