recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.11 - Salads

instructions.text: Layer cabbage and onion, sprinkle with sugar.
Heat vinegar with celery seed and mustard seed to boiling.
Add oil, bring to boil again.
Pour over cabbage while hot. Do not stir.
Cover and refrigerate. Will keep 2 weeks.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.11 - Salads section
Keeps 2 weeks refrigerated

recipes.title: Sauerkraut Salad
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.11 - Salads

instructions.text: Combine vegetables.
Mix sugar, oil and vinegar.
Pour over vegetables and refrigerate overnight.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.11 - Salads section

recipes.title: Sawdust Salad
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.11 - Salads

instructions.text: Dissolve gelatin in hot water, add cold water.
Chill until slightly thickened.
Fold in pineapple, bananas and marshmallows.
Pour into mold and chill until firm.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.11 - Salads section

recipes.title: Sweet-Sour Five Bean Salad
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.11 - Salads

instructions.text: Drain all beans.
Add onion.
Mix remaining ingredients and pour over beans.
Refrigerate overnight or longer.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.11 - Salads section

recipes.title: 24-Hour Salad (Vegetable)
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.11 - Salads

instructions.text: Layer in order: lettuce, celery, eggs, peas, onion.
Spread mayonnaise over top, sprinkle with sugar.
Cover and refrigerate 24 hours.
Before serving, top with bacon and cheese.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.11 - Salads section

recipes.title: 24-Hour Salad (Fruit)
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.12 - Salads

instructions.text: Combine all fruits, marshmallows and coconut.
Fold in sour cream.
Refrigerate 24 hours before serving.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.12 - Salads section

recipes.title: French Dressing
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.12 - Dressings

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in jar.
Shake well.
Refrigerate. Remove garlic after 24 hours.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.12 - Dressings section

recipes.title: French-Type Salad Dressing
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.12 - Dressings

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in jar.
Shake well before using.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.12 - Dressings section

recipes.title: Asparagus Casserole
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.13 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Place asparagus in casserole.
Mix soup and milk, pour over asparagus.
Top with cheese and crumbs, dot with butter.
Bake at 350°F for 30 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.13 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Baked Beans
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.13 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Mix beans with sugar, ketchup, mustard and onion.
Pour into casserole, top with bacon.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.13 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Green Bean Casserole
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.13 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Mix beans with soup and milk.
Pour into casserole.
Bake at 350°F for 25 min.
Top with onions, bake 5 min more.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.13 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Green Bean Casserole (Alternate)
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.13 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Combine beans, water chestnuts and soup.
Pour into casserole, top with almonds.
Bake at 350°F for 30 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.13 - Vegetables section
Alternate version with water chestnuts

recipes.title: Harvard Beets
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.13 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Mix sugar and cornstarch in saucepan.
Add vinegar and 1/4 cup beet liquid.
Cook until thick, stirring constantly.
Add butter and beets, heat through.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.13 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Flav-Fries
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.14 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Place potatoes in baking dish.
Dot with butter, sprinkle with soup mix.
Add water.
Cover and bake at 400°F for 45 min. Uncover last 10 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.14 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Broccoli Casserole
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.14 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Place broccoli in casserole.
Mix soup, mayonnaise and cheese, pour over broccoli.
Top with crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 30 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.14 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Broccoli Casserole (Italian Style)
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.14 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Cook broccoli until tender, drain.
Mix eggs, crumbs, cheese, garlic, salt and pepper.
Add broccoli and toss.
Pour into greased casserole, drizzle with olive oil.
Bake at 350°F for 20 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.14 - Vegetables section
Italian-style preparation

recipes.title: Sweet & Sour Carrots
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.14 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Cook carrots until tender.
Melt butter, add sugar and vinegar.
Add carrots and toss to coat.
Season with salt.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.14 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Calicao Beans
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.14 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Brown beef and bacon with onion, drain.
Combine all beans in casserole.
Add meat mixture.
Mix ketchup, sugar, vinegar and mustard, pour over beans.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.14 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Baked Cauliflower Deluxe
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.15 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Cook cauliflower until tender, place in casserole.
Pour soup over cauliflower, top with cheese and crumbs.
Dot with butter.
Bake at 350°F for 30 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.15 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Fried Celery
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.15 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Melt butter in skillet.
Add celery and stir-fry 2 min.
Add broth, cover and cook 3 min.
Season with salt and pepper.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.15 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Eggplant Casserole
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.15 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Cook eggplant until tender, drain.
Mix with soup, milk and half the cheese.
Pour into casserole, top with remaining cheese and crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 30 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.15 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Squash Casserole
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.15 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Cook squash and onion until tender, drain.
Mix soup and sour cream, add to squash.
Mix stuffing with butter.
Layer half stuffing, squash mixture, remaining stuffing.
Bake at 350°F for 30 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.15 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Squash Custard
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.16 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Mix squash with eggs, milk, sugar and spices.
Pour into buttered casserole.
Dot with butter.
Bake at 350°F for 45 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.16 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Sweet Potato and Apple Scallop
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.16 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Layer potatoes and apples in casserole.
Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon, dot with butter.
Pour orange juice over all.
Bake at 350°F for 45 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.16 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Vegetables Fritters
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.16 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Mix flour, baking powder and salt.
Add egg and milk, stir until smooth.
Fold in vegetables.
Drop by spoonfuls into hot oil.
Fry until golden on both sides.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.16 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Zucchini Casserole
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.16 - Vegetables

instructions.text: Layer zucchini, onion and tomatoes in casserole.
Season each layer with salt, pepper and oregano.
Top with cheese and crumbs, drizzle with oil.
Bake at 350°F for 45 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.16 - Vegetables section

recipes.title: Bean Soup
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.17 - Soups

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.
Bring to a boil, turn to low and cook about 40 min., stirring constantly.
Adding a juice glass of beer is optional.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.17 - Soups section

recipes.title: Clam Chowder Au Vin
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.17 - Soups

instructions.text: In saucepan combine potato, water, onion, celery and salt.
Cook covered until potatoes are tender, mash slightly.
Whip cream and refrigerate.
In blazer pan of chafing dish, combine mashed vegetables and remaining ingredients except cream.
Heat over direct heat, but do not boil.
Stir in whipped cream.
Season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle with 2 tbsp snipped parsley.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.17 - Soups section

recipes.title: Mock Turtle Soup
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.17 - Soups

ingredients.item: beef concentrate or 3 to 4 bullion cubes

instructions.text: Saute beef in heavy kettle or Dutch oven.
Add onion, cook 5 min.
Add catsup and 2 qts water, gravy and Worcestershire sauce.
Simmer gently and add brown flour, beef concentrate, brown sugar, salt, ground peppercorns, and vinegar.
Put into a bag the cloves, allspice and bay leaf, and add.
Simmer gently 2 hours and then remove spices.
Add eggs and lemon.
Refrigerate overnight.
Add wine and serve.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.17 - Soups section

recipes.title: Quick Egg Drop Soup
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.17 - Soups

instructions.text: Boil one cup water, add bullion cubes.
Mix eggs in bowl, add to boiled mixture and then stir in the corn starch.
Continue to boil till eggs are cooked.
A great 'fill-up' for the dieter.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.17 - Soups section

recipes.title: Saucy Fish Fillets
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.18 - Fish/Seafood

instructions.text: Drain fish and blot well.
In greased shallow baking dish, arrange fish in one layer.
Pour soup, undiluted, evenly over fish.
Top with cheese and sprinkle with paprika.
Bake at 350°F for 25 min or until fish flakes easily.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.18 - Fish/Seafood section

recipes.title: Fish in Foil
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.18 - Fish/Seafood

instructions.text: Skin fillets and cut into portions, sprinkle both sides with salt & pepper.
Combine butter, parsley, lemon, soy, and dillweed.
Cut into squares of heavy duty foil; grease lightly.
Place fish on foil in single layer, top with half the sauce.
Place onion slices on top.
Top each with a cheese slice.
Seal in foil.
Bake at 450°F for 15 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.18 - Fish/Seafood section

recipes.title: Grouper Creole
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.18 - Fish/Seafood

instructions.text: Saute vegetables in butter; stir in the spices.
Bring to a slow boil, turn temperature to low.
Lay grouper on top, cover and simmer.
Stir occasionally.
Simmer 45 min to an hour.
Serves 5.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.18 - Fish/Seafood section

recipes.title: Salmon Topped Kraft Dinner
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.18 - Fish/Seafood

instructions.text: Prepare Kraft Dinner as directed.
To the salmon add celery, green pepper, onion, Miracle Whip and pepper.
Toss lightly.
Arrange the pepper rings in the bottom of a well-greased loaf pan.
Carefully pack salmon mixture into pan and cover with Kraft Dinner.
Bake at 300°F for 30 min.
Unmold.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.18 - Fish/Seafood section

recipes.title: Sea-Burgers
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.18 - Fish/Seafood

instructions.text: Drain tuna.
Shred cheese.
Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Fill buns with mixture.
Wrap each snugly in foil and bake at 350°F for 20 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.18 - Fish/Seafood section

recipes.title: Salmon and Rice Souffle
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.19 - Fish/Seafood

instructions.text: Using first five ingredients, make a smooth, thick white sauce.
Add slightly beaten egg yolks, gradually.
Fold in rice and salmon.
Beat egg whites until almost stiff.
Fold into lukewarm rice mixture.
Pour into ungreased 1-qt casserole.
Bake at 325°F for 50 min.
Serves 6.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.19 - Fish/Seafood section

recipes.title: Seafood Salad
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.19 - Fish/Seafood

ingredients.prep_note: or 1 cup cooked shrimp, crab or lobster meat

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients except eggs and macaroni.
Add macaroni, combine and chill.
Garnish with hard boiled eggs.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.19 - Fish/Seafood section

recipes.title: Tunamato Bake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.19 - Fish/Seafood

instructions.text: Prepare Kraft Dinner as directed.
Add all other ingredients.
Pour into greased 3-qt casserole and bake at 350°F for 20 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.19 - Fish/Seafood section

recipes.title: Macaroni and Cheese
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.19

instructions.text: Boil macaroni about 8 min, drain.
Place half in greased 1-qt casserole, sprinkle with 1/2 cup cheese.
Add rest of macaroni, cover with rest of cheese.
Pour milk over all.
Bake at 350°F for 45 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.19

recipes.title: Risotto
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.19

instructions.text: Melt the 4 tbsp butter; add onion and brown.
Add rice and stir until butter is absorbed.
Add broth a little at a time; do not let rice become too dry.
Cook 40-45 min over low heat, stirring constantly.
When done, add 1/4 cup butter and saffron and mix well.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Serves 7.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.19

recipes.title: Texas Barbecued Chicken
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.20 - Chicken

instructions.text: Shake chicken pieces in a bag with flour and seasonings.
Fry chicken in oil until golden brown.
Drain off excess fat.
Cover. Bake at 350°F for 45 min. Turn pieces frequently.
For sauce: Combine first eight sauce ingredients in saucepan.
Heat to boiling, simmer uncovered 20 min.
Remove from heat and add lemon juice and butter. Mix well.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.20 - Chicken section

recipes.title: Chicken Cacciatore
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.20 - Chicken

ingredients.item: dry red wine or 1 tbsp vinegar

instructions.text: In skillet, brown chicken in shortening; pour off fat.
Add remaining ingredients except pepper.
Cover; cook over low heat 30 min; stir now and then.
Add peppers cook 15 min more.
Serve with spaghetti or rice.
Serves 4.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.20 - Chicken section

recipes.title: Chicken Casserole
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.20 - Chicken

instructions.text: Place stuffing and butter in pan and heat over low heat until bread absorbs all the butter.
Place chicken in casserole, add broccoli, then soup, then mayonnaise.
Put stuffing over all.
Bake at 350°F for 1/2 hour.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.20 - Chicken section

recipes.title: Chicken Chow Mein
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.20 - Chicken

instructions.text: Combine in casserole the vegetables and meat.
Combine, mix well, and add chicken soup, mushroom soup and milk.
Bake at 340°F for 30 min.
Serve hot over chow mein noodles or rice.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.20 - Chicken section

recipes.title: Chicken-Cranberry Salad Mold
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.21 - Chicken

instructions.text: Soften 1 envelope of gelatin in 1/2 cup cold water; stir over boiling water until gelatin is dissolved.
Blend in soup, mayonnaise, lemon juice, stir in gelatin.
Chill till mixture begins to thicken.
Fold in chicken, celery, almonds, onion and pepper.
Pour into 1 qt mold. Chill until firm.
Soften remaining envelope of gelatin in 1/4 cup cold water, stir until dissolved.
Crush cranberries with fork and gelatin.
Chill till mixture begins to thicken.
Fold in orange. Pour on top of chicken layer.
Chill till firm. Unmold; serves 6-8.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.21 - Chicken section

recipes.title: Chicken Fricassee with Sesame Seed Dumplings
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.21 - Chicken

instructions.text: Combine flour, salt and pepper. Dredge chicken well in seasoned flour.
Melt butter in dutch oven or heavy skillet; add chicken and cook over low heat until golden.
Add next 8 ingredients and stir to mix well.
Bring to boiling point; lower heat, cover and cook 30 min or until chicken is tender.
Combine biscuit mix, sesame seeds, eggs and milk and mix well with fork.
Drop by tablespoons into chicken, cover and cook 15 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.21 - Chicken section

recipes.title: Chicken Fricassee
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.21 - Chicken

instructions.text: Boil chickens in just enough water to cover.
Cook until very tender (meat falling from bone).
Spoon out chickens, cool, bone and cut into bite size pieces.
Save enough of liquid stock to make gravy to suit your needs.
Mix about 2 tbsp corn starch with this to make a thick gravy.
A few drops of the food coloring will make it more eye-appealing.
Serves 6-8.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.21 - Chicken section

recipes.title: Chili
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.22 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Slow cooker method: Cook at low 6-8 hours.
Alternative: Brown ground beef in oil.
Add remaining ingredients.
Cover and cook 4-5 hours as preferred.
Serves 8-10.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.22 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Chili
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.22 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Brown hamburger, drain.
Add all other ingredients, simmer for 15-30 min.
This is best when let stand, or served the next day.
Serves 4-6.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.22 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Everyday Meat Loaf
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.22 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Soak bread crumbs in milk; add meat, eggs, onion and seasonings; mix well.
Place in greased loaf pan, cover with Piquant Sauce.
Bake at 350°F for one hour.
For sauce: Combine brown sugar, catsup, nutmeg and dry mustard.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.22 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Tater Tot Casserole
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.22 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Brown beef, celery and onion.
In bowl, combine soup and milk.
In casserole layer first tater tots then beef, corn (drained), ending with tater tots.
Pour soup mixture over all, let stand 10 min.
Bake at 400°F for 45 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.22 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Huntburgers
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.22 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Hollow out centers of buns.
Crumble bread removed, mix well with meat, onion, salt, pepper and 1-1/2 cans tomato sauce.
Fill buns.
Bake on cooky sheet at 375°F for 20 min.
Spoon remaining sauce over buns, bake 5 min more.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.22 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Quick Tamale Casserole
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.23 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: In skillet with heat-resistant handle, saute onions and garlic juice in fat until transparent.
Add beef and saute until red disappears, stirring occasionally.
Spread meat mixture in pan.
Simmer corn, tomatoes and olives with meat.
Top with prepared corn bread mix.
Bake at 400°F for 30 min, or until corn bread is golden brown.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.23 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: East Potluck Supper
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.23 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Brown meat, stir in soup mix, water, rice, tomatoes and peas.
Simmer covered 20 min until rice is tender.
Top with cheese.
Serve with garlic bread.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.23 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Hamburger Stroganoff
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.23 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Brown hamburger and onion in oleo.
Mix flour, salt, garlic salt and pepper.
Add this and soup to hamburger and onion and simmer 5 min.
Add sour cream and mushrooms (if desired).
Heat and serve over noodles or rice.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.23 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Pastitsio (Greek Casserole)
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.23 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: In large skillet cook beef, onion and garlic until meat is browned and onion is tender.
Add tomatoes, 1/2 tsp salt, pepper and cinnamon; simmer 15 min.
Stir in 1/4 cup cheese and macaroni.
Turn into 13x9x2 inch baking dish; set aside.
In medium saucepan melt butter; blend in flour and remaining 1/4 tsp salt.
Gradually stir in milk and cook and stir until sauce thickens.
Cool slightly. Beat in eggs one at a time.
Stir in remaining 1/4 cup cheese and pour over meat mixture.
Place in preheated 350°F oven, lower temperature to 315°F and bake 35-40 min or until golden brown and knife comes out clean.
Makes 6-8 servings.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.23 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Pizza
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.24 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Stir jiffy mix and water with fork until dry ingredients are moistened.
Place on lightly floured board. Knead about 10 times.
Roll 2" larger than pizza pan and fit into pizza pan.
Spread sauce to edge.
Add meat and onions.
Cook at high heat until meat is done.
Add cheese and cook 5 min longer.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.24 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Kielbasa and Potatoes
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.24 - Main Dishes

ingredients.item: Polish Kielbasa or 2 lbs Italian sweet sausages

instructions.text: In large skillet, fry bacon until brown and crispy. Remove and set aside.
Add onion to drippings and saute until golden brown.
Add potatoes and stir over low heat until lightly browned, about 10 min.
Cook Kielbasa in boiling salted water, about 15 min.
Or if using sausage, cook in water 15 min.
Drain and cut into 1/2" slices.
Add sausage to potatoes and stir over low heat for another 10 min.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle with reserved crisp bacon.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.24 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Macaroni Supper
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.24 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Cut bacon in small pieces, add onions and fry together until bacon is crisp and onions are transparent.
Add tomato soup and macaroni.
Blend well, then heat thoroughly, or put in moderate oven 30 min or so.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.24 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Ham Royale
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.24 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Lightly brown onion and ham in butter.
Add flour and blend.
Add 1 cup water gradually, stirring constantly, then add milk.
Cook and stir over medium heat until smooth and thickened.
Add pepper, mustard, and Worcestershire sauce.
Blend well and serve over rice.
Serves 4.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.24 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Macaroni Sausage Casserole
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.25 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Cook macaroni. Drain well.
Brown sausage. Remove and reserve 1/2 of sausage.
Saute onion and green pepper with remaining sausage until barely cooked.
Stir in flour and salt. Slowly add milk.
Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until thick.
Stir in 1-1/2 cups shredded cheese.
Combine cooked macaroni and sausage; turn into greased 2-qt casserole.
Top with remaining cheese and reserved sausage.
Bake at 400°F for 15 min.
Makes 4 servings.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.25 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Rice & Pork
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.25 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Place beer and equal amount of water in pan at medium heat.
Add salt, pepper, saffron, bay leaves.
In frying pan, saute onion, garlic, green pepper until soft.
Then add to beer, water, etc.
Brown pork, add to beer. Cook 1/2 hour.
Next day, bring liquid to boil, add rice.
Lower heat; cook 20 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.25 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Pork Chop Casserole
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.25 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Brown rice in butter.
Mix soup, 2 cans water and mushrooms.
Combine with browned rice and place in casserole.
Brown pork chops and place on top of rice.
Distribute soup mix over all. Do not stir.
Bake 1 hour at 350°F.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.25 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Rhinelander Pork Chops
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.25 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Brown chops and remove.
Cook onions, green pepper, celery in drippings until tender.
Then stir in beef mix, water, and sherry.
Return chops and simmer covered for 45 min.
Stir occasionally.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.25 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Sweet & Sour Pork
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.25 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Salt and pepper pork chops, place in roasting pan.
Pour rest of ingredients over them.
Cook covered at 350°F for one hour or until meat is done.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.25 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Veal Piccata
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.26 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Sprinkle veal with salt and pepper. Dust lightly with flour.
Heat half butter and oil in skillet.
Add veal and cook until brown.
Add wine and cook until reduced.
Stir, bringing up brown bits.
Return veal to pan. Heat 3-5 min.
Garnish with lemon wedge, serve with risotto or fettuccine.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.26 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Veal & Pork Noodle Dish
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.26 - Main Dishes

instructions.text: Brown meat and onion.
Add celery, green pepper, soup and a little water.
Simmer until meat is tender.
Add noodles, corn and cheese.
Bake 30 min at 350°F.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.26 - Main Dishes section

recipes.title: Cooking Tips
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.26

instructions.text: Don't ever wash fish under running water. Takes away the flavor. The thing to do is wipe it with a wrung-out cloth, dipped first in salted water.
Hard boiled eggs washed first under cold water before placing them in the boiling water, won't crack.

Spaghetti and/or noodles won't boil over if you rub the top inside edge of the cooking vessel with a little butter or margarine. A lump of the same tossed into the cooking water accomplishes this purpose, too.
A pinch of sugar is the best perker-up of any vegetable. Not enough to taste it. It does wonders for flavor.

notes: Household hints from Specialties of the House cookbook, p.26

recipes.title: Fresh Apple Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.27 - Cakes

instructions.text: Beat oil and sugar together until well blended.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Add flour, soda, salt, and vanilla; stirring thoroughly.
Fold in apples and nuts.
Pour into greased and floured tube pan.
Bake 1-1/2 hr at 350°F.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.27 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Blue Ribbon Banana Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.27 - Cakes

instructions.text: Cream together butter and sugar until fluffy.
Add eggs, beat 2 min at medium speed; add mashed banana, beat 1 min.
Sift together dry ingredients.
Add flour mixture alternately with buttermilk and vanilla.
Pour into 2 greased and floured 9" round layer cake pans.
Sprinkle 1/4 cup coconut on each layer.
Bake at 375°F for 30 min. Remove from pans.
Cool layers, coconut side up, on racks.
Place first layer, coconut side down, and spread on filling.
Top with second layer, coconut side up.
Swirl frosting around sides and about 2" around top edge, leaving center unfrosted.
For Filling: Combine ingredients in saucepan. Cook until thickened. Cool.
For Frosting: Cream butter with extracts. Gradually add sugar, beating until fluffy.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.27 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Black Midnight Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.27 - Cakes

instructions.text: Blend all ingredients 1/2 min on low speed.
When well blended, beat 1 min on high speed.
Pour into greased and floured 9x13 pan.
Bake 41 min at 350°F.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.27 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Carrot Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.28 - Cakes

instructions.text: Mix all cake ingredients well.
Pour into greased and floured 9x11 pan or two 9" round pans.
Bake approximately 45 min at 350°F.
For Frosting: Mix cream cheese, butter, powdered sugar and vanilla well.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.28 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Pretzel Cheese Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.28 - Cakes

instructions.text: Mix first three ingredients and press into a pan.
Cool in refrigerator.
Mix cream cheese, powdered sugar and Cool Whip.
Spread over pretzel mixture.
Cover with pie filling.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.28 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Candlelight Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.28 - Cakes

instructions.text: Combine all cake ingredients.
Beat at medium speed 2 min.
Pour into greased and floured 10" bundt pan.
Bake at 350°F for 50 min.
Cool in pan 15 min.
Remove and finish cooling on rack.
Spoon glaze over cooled cake.
For Glaze: Heat milk, butter and orange juice until butter is melted.
Mix with confectioners sugar and orange rind. Beat until smooth.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.28 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Diet Cheese Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.28 - Cakes

ingredients.item: low calorie sugar or 1/2 tsp liquid sweetener

instructions.text: Beat eggs well.
Add rest of ingredients and beat one min.
Slowly add cottage cheese, beat to good consistency--not too thin or watery.
Place in 9x13 ungreased loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 40 min.
Turn off oven but leave cake for another 20 min.
Take cake out and cool.
Place in refrigerator for approximately 6 hours.
Place napkin on top to absorb any moisture.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.28 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Chocolate Sauerkraut Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.29 - Cakes

instructions.text: Cream sugar, butter together, add eggs and vanilla; beat thoroughly.
Sift dry ingredients together and add alternately with water.
Add sauerkraut.
Bake at 350°F in 2 layer pans.
Frost while still warm.
For Icing: Warm milk, carefully add to sifted powdered sugar.
Add melted butter and melted chocolate.
Add vanilla and beat about 1 min until very smooth.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.29 - Cakes section
Sauerkraut adds moisture - you can't taste it!

recipes.title: Quick Coconut Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.29 - Cakes

instructions.text: Beat first six ingredients together thoroughly.
Pour into greased 8" square pan.
Combine beaten egg white, sugar and coconut and put on top of dough.
Bake at 325°F for 40 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.29 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Devil's Food Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.29 - Cakes

instructions.text: Sift together flour, soda and salt.
Cream butter and sugar.
Beat in chocolate, then eggs; beat 5 min at high speed.
Add flour mixture alternately with buttermilk.
Beat well until well blended.
Pour into 2 greased and floured 9" cake pans.
Bake at 350°F for 30 min or until knife comes out clean.
Cool in pans on racks 10 min.
Remove and cool completely. Frost.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.29 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Cake Donuts
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.29 - Cakes

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.
Roll and fry in deep fat at 375°F.
Makes 10 doz.
These keep well frozen.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.29 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Italian Cream Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.30 - Cakes

ingredients.prep_note: 8-oz pkg cream cheese, 1 stick oleo, 1 tsp vanilla

instructions.text: Cream sugar and shortening well. Add oleo and beat till fluffy.
Add egg yolks, one at a time, beat well after each.
Add buttermilk and vanilla.
Sift flour, soda and salt together well and mix into batter.
Add coconut and pecans.
Fold in beaten egg whites.
Bake 30 min at 350°F in 7x12" pan.
For Icing Option 1: Mash bananas with cream cheese. Blend till spreading consistency.
For Icing Option 2: Beat all ingredients until creamy.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.30 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.30 - Cakes

instructions.text: Melt butter for topping in a 10" baking pan.
Add brown sugar and heat slowly until sugar and butter are blended.
Arrange pineapple slices and cherries in the butter-sugar mixture. Set aside.
Sift together flour, salt and baking powder.
Cream butter and sugar until fluffy, add eggs and vanilla, beat until smooth.
Add flour mixture and milk alternately.
Pour over pineapple and bake at 350°F for 35 min.
Cool in pan 5 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.30 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Prune Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.30 - Cakes

ingredients.item: junior size prunes or tapioca and prunes

instructions.text: Combine sugar and oil.
Beat well after adding each of the following: eggs, spices, flour, prunes and nuts.
Bake 1-1/2 hours at 325°F in greased 10" tube pan.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.30 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Salad Dressing Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.30 - Cakes

instructions.text: Mix first 3 ingredients thoroughly.
Add rest and bake at 375°F for 35 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.30 - Cakes section
Uses mayonnaise-style salad dressing for moisture

recipes.title: Sour Cream Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.31 - Cakes

ingredients.item: brown sugar mixed with 1 1/2 tsp cinnamon

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients except sugar and cinnamon.
Pour half into tube pan.
Sprinkle half of sugar mixture on top and pour in remaining half of dough.
Sprinkle with rest of sugar.
Bake one hour at 350°F.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.31 - Cakes section
GRANDMA'S HANDWRITING: 'Cake mix - Peggy says - I've tried - They like best' - Grandma recommended this recipe!

recipes.title: Lemon Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.31 - Cakes

instructions.text: Mix boiling water and jello, set aside.
Mix cake mix, eggs, oil and salt; beat well.
Add jello mixture, beat 2 min.
Bake in greased 13x9 pan at 350°F for 35-40 min.
When baked, let cool slightly.
Mix powder sugar and lemon juice together to make glaze.
Stir holes in top about 2" apart.
Pour on glaze.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.31 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Texas Sheet Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.31 - Cakes

instructions.text: Heat butter, water and cocoa to a boil.
Remove from heat and add to flour and sugar.
Beat in eggs and sour cream.
Pour into greased cookie sheet (16x16) about 1" deep.
Bake 20 min at 375°F.
For Icing: Melt margarine, cocoa and milk over hot water.
Remove from heat, add to powdered sugar, vanilla and nuts.
Spread over cake as it comes from oven. Cool.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.31 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Three Hole Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.31 - Cakes

instructions.text: Sift dry ingredients into ungreased cake pan.
Make three holes in flour.
In first hole put the oil; in second, vinegar; and in third, vanilla.
Pour 1 cup cold water or cold coffee over all.
Stir until well blended with a fork.
Bake in same pan at 350°F for 30 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.31 - Cakes section
Classic depression-era wacky cake - no eggs, no mixer needed!

recipes.title: Coffee Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.32 - Cakes

instructions.text: Scald milk, stir in sugar, salt and margarine. Cool to lukewarm.
Measure warm water into large bowl. Sprinkle in yeast and stir until dissolved.
Stir in remaining milk and add flour. Beat until smooth.
Add remaining flour and make a stiff batter.
Cover loosely with aluminum foil; refrigerate at least 2 hours.
Roll out dough into half rectangle, cut into 12 strips.
Make 4 strips about 1" apart on greased cookie sheet. Weave in remaining 4 strips.
Put scrap topping on top and let rise for 1 to 1-1/2 hours until doubled.
Bake at 375°F for 25 min or until done.
For Topping: Mix sugar, flour, cinnamon and oleo; blend.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.32 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Tomato Soup Cake
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.32 - Cakes

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar.
Add soup and baking soda.
Add flour, cinnamon, cloves and salt.
Add raisins and walnuts.
Bake at 350°F for 1/2 hour.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.32 - Cakes section
Unique spice cake - tomato soup adds moisture and tang!

recipes.title: Best Ever Chocolate Icing
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.32 - Cakes

instructions.text: Bring all ingredients to a full rolling boil.
Remove from heat and beat at high speed until consistency to spread, at least 5 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.32 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Cream Frosting
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.32 - Cakes

instructions.text: Mix milk and flour. Cook till thick; cool.
Mix remaining ingredients for 4 min with electric beater.
Add flour mixture; cream 4 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.32 - Cakes section

recipes.title: Cherry-Berry Pie
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.33 - Pies

instructions.text: Drain cherries and strawberries, reserving juices.
Combine salt, sugar, cornstarch and tapioca in saucepan, stir well.
Blend in juices, stirring constantly, until thick and clear.
Add lemon juice.
Remove from heat, stir in drained cherries and strawberries and let stand 15 min.
Pour into pastry lined pan, cover with top crust.
Bake at 425°F for 35 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.33 - Pies section

recipes.title: Glazed Berry Pie
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.33 - Pies

instructions.text: Mix sugar, cornstarch and water in saucepan.
Boil over medium heat till thick and clear, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and add berries.
Put into baked crust and chill.
Top with whipped cream (optional).

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.33 - Pies section

recipes.title: Mystery Cheesecake Pie
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.33 - Pies

instructions.text: Combine cheese, egg, 1/3 cup sugar and 1/2 tsp vanilla; beat till light and fluffy.
Spread over bottom of pie shell; arrange nuts on top.
Combine the 2 eggs, 1/4 cup sugar, corn syrup, 1/4 tsp vanilla; mix well.
Pour over pecans.
Bake 375°F for 40-45 min or till done.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.33 - Pies section

recipes.title: Citrus Chiffon Pie
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.33 - Pies

instructions.text: Beat egg yolks in top of double boiler.
Add the juices, 1/3 cup sugar and salt; cook over hot water till thick, about 8 min, stir occasionally.
Soften gelatin in cold water. Add to hot mixture, stir till gelatin is dissolved.
Remove from heat, add rinds and cool till thick and syrupy.
Beat egg whites till stiff, add remaining 1/3 cup sugar gradually, beat till thick and smooth.
Fold lightly into the partially congealed mixture.
Pour into pie shell, chill till set, about 2 hours.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.33 - Pies section

recipes.title: Lemon Chime Pie
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.34 - Pies

instructions.text: For Crust: Sift flour with salt, cut in shortening.
Combine egg, lemon juice and rind; sprinkle over flour mixture; stir with fork till dough is moist enough to hold together.
Roll out; fit into 8-9" pan, prick, bake at 400°F for 13-15 min. Bake extra pastry also, and crumble.
For Filling: Combine sugar, cornstarch, water, rind and juice, and slightly beaten egg yolks.
Cook, stirring constantly till thick. Remove from heat, add cream cheese, blend until smooth.
Beat egg whites till soft peaks, gradually add 1/4 cup sugar; beat until stiff.
Fold into lemon mixture; spoon into cooled crust, chill.
Sprinkle pastry crumbs around edge.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.34 - Pies section

recipes.title: Lemon Pie
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.34 - Pies

instructions.text: Mix 1-1/3 cups sugar, salt, cornstarch, gradually add hot water.
Cook about 8 min till mixture is clear and begins to become thick.
Reduce to low heat for 4 min.
Add and beat well the juice, rind, butter; cool.
Fill pie shell.
Beat egg whites with 2 tbsp sugar; top pie.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.34 - Pies section

recipes.title: Peach Custard Pie
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.34 - Pies

instructions.text: Mix sugar, cream, eggs, flour, vanilla and salt.
Pour over halves of peaches in unbaked pie shell.
Bake 450°F for 10 min, then 350°F for 50 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.34 - Pies section

recipes.title: Old Fashioned Custard Pie
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.34 - Pies

instructions.text: Mix sugar, salt and cornstarch thoroughly; stir in eggs, then milk.
Gradually stir in boiling water; blend in vanilla and nutmeg.
Pour into unbaked crust.
Bake at 400°F until knife comes out clean, 25-30 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.34 - Pies section

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pie
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.35 - Pies

instructions.text: Blend sugar, spices, salt together.
Beat eggs with milk, combine with sugar mixture and pumpkin, until smooth.
Pour filling into unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 425°F for 15 min; reduce heat to 350°F for 35 min, or until knife comes out clean.
Cool before slicing.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.35 - Pies section

recipes.title: Rhubarb Pie
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.35 - Pies

instructions.text: Combine sugar, flour, eggs and nutmeg.
Add rhubarb and mix well.
Pour into unbaked 8" pie shell.
Bake at 450°F for 10 min, then 350°F for 30 min longer, or until rhubarb is soft.
(If frozen rhubarb is used, do not defrost.)

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.35 - Pies section

recipes.title: Pie Crust
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.35 - Pies

instructions.text: Sift flour and salt; cut in shortening.
Add milk a tablespoon at a time, mixing with fork.
Roll out to fit a 9" plate.
Water may be used instead of milk, but milk gives a slightly browner crust.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.35 - Pies section

recipes.title: Strawberry Pie
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.35 - Pies

instructions.text: Mix together sugar, jello, water, cornstarch and 1 cup berries.
Cook 1 min after starting to boil.
Pour in rest of berries and put in baked pie shell.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.35 - Pies section

recipes.title: Sweet Pie (Ricotta)
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.35 - Pies

instructions.text: For Dough: Mix flour, salt, baking powder, sugar together; stir in shortening.
Beat egg with fork, mix with milk, then pour into flour mixture.
Roll dough and fit into 10" pie plate.
For Filling: Beat eggs, add sugar, salt; mix in Ricotta, orange rind, lemon rind, and citron.
Pour into unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 350°F for about 1 hour.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.35 - Pies section
Italian-style ricotta pie

recipes.title: Apple Date Bread
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.36 - Desserts

instructions.text: Sift flour, sugar, soda, salt & spices together.
Combine eggs, pie filling, oil and vanilla.
Stir into flour mixture and mix well; stir in dates and nuts.
Pour into greased and floured loaf pan.
Bake in 350°F oven for 55-65 min.
Cool, cut in squares and serve with whipped cream.
Serves 15.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.36 - Desserts section

recipes.title: Apple Topping
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.36 - Desserts

instructions.text: Crumble and mix all ingredients.
Scatter over pie-sliced apples.
Bake 41 min at about 350°F.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.36 - Desserts section

recipes.title: Blueberry Jello Mold
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.36 - Desserts

instructions.text: Strain blueberries, save 1 cup juice.
Mix jello with boiling water, add 1 cup juice.
Set aside 1-1/2 cups blueberry-jello mixture; pour rest into mold; refrigerate until firm.
Then prepare Dream Whip; beat until stiff.
Add cream cheese, beat until very smooth.
Add 1/2 cups remaining blueberry jello mixture, fold in blueberries.
Pour on set jello; refrigerate until firm.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.36 - Desserts section

recipes.title: Bread Pudding
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.36 - Desserts

instructions.text: Toast bread and spread with all the butter while hot.
Arrange toast in a 1" greased square pan. Sprinkle with raisins.
Stir the salt and all but 1 tbsp of sugar into the eggs, add milk and stir to mix well.
Pour over the toast and allow to stand 10 min.
Press toast lightly down into milk occasionally so that toast soaks up most of the milk mixture.
Mix cinnamon with remaining 1 tbsp sugar and sprinkle over top.
Bake in 350°F oven for 30 min or until a knife comes out clean.
Serve warm.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.36 - Desserts section

recipes.title: Baked Custard
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.36 - Desserts

instructions.text: Beat all ingredients together till thoroughly mixed.
Pour into greased custard cups and set in pan of water.
Sprinkle tops with nutmeg.
Bake at 400°F for 10 min; then reduce heat till firm.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.36 - Desserts section

recipes.title: Cherry Dessert
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.37 - Desserts

instructions.text: Pour cherry pie filling into large, ungreased cake pan.
Sprinkle dry cake mix over.
Melt butter and drizzle over top.
Top with almonds.
Bake at 375°F.
A small dessert may be made by using 1 can of pie filling and a jiffy cake mix and 1/3 cup of melted butter and almonds.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.37 - Desserts section
Easy dump cake style dessert

recipes.title: Baked Curried Fruit
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.37 - Desserts

instructions.text: Drain fruit well, place in baking dish in layers.
Sprinkle with sugars and curry.
Dot butter on top.
Bake 1 hour at 350°F.
Serves 10 to 12.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.37 - Desserts section

recipes.title: Fruited Ice Cream
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.37 - Desserts

ingredients.prep_note: cut in half and well drained

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients well.
Refreeze.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.37 - Desserts section

recipes.title: Jello and Ice Cream
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.37 - Desserts

instructions.text: Prepare Jello and let chill till just beginning to set.
Beat till all foamy.
Add ice cream and keep beating till distributed evenly.
Chill about an hour.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.37 - Desserts section

recipes.title: Rich Lemon Dessert
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.37 - Desserts

instructions.text: Melt oleo; combine with crumbs; press into an 8x12" dish.
Mix all other ingredients.
Pour on crumbs; top with Cool Whip and chill.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.37 - Desserts section

recipes.title: Spiced Peaches
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.37 - Desserts

instructions.text: Drain syrup from peaches; add other ingredients to syrup; bring to boil.
Simmer 10 min.
Pour over peach halves and cool for several hours.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.37 - Desserts section

recipes.title: Baked Pineapple Dessert
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.38 - Desserts

instructions.text: Drain pineapple, reserving 1/2 cup juice.
Arrange slices in shallow glass baking dish.
Mix brandy with reserved juice and pour over pineapple slices.
Sprinkle with orange peel; let stand several hours.
Whip cream till stiff; add powdered sugar.
Before serving, place pineapple slices on cake.
Drizzle brandy mixture over slices; top with whipped cream.
Makes 5 servings.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.38 - Desserts section

recipes.title: Rice Pudding
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.38 - Desserts

instructions.text: Summer rice with salt for 7 min.
Add milk and butter, stir; cover; simmer for 2 hrs.
Beat egg with sugar; add vanilla and raisins.
Pour milk mixture slowly into egg mixture, stirring constantly.
Keep stirring until mixture is thick and coats a spoon.
Pour into bowl, sprinkle cinnamon and sugar mixture over top.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.38 - Desserts section

recipes.title: Brownies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.38 - Desserts

instructions.text: Grease and flour 9x13 pan.
Make pudding according to directions.
Let cool in pot till fairly cool.
Add cake mix.
Pour into pan and top with nuts and chips.
Bake at 350°F for 35-40 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.38 - Desserts section

recipes.title: Brown Sugar Brownies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.38 - Desserts

instructions.text: Melt shortening; remove from heat; add brown sugar, cool slightly.
Add eggs.
Sift all dry ingredients; add gradually to sugar mixture.
Add remaining ingredients as listed.
Spread in pan; bake at 350°F for 25-30 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.38 - Desserts section
Blondies with chocolate chips

recipes.title: Seven-Layer Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.39 - Cookies

instructions.text: Melt margarine in balt pan, sprinkle graham cracker crumbs over melted margarine.
Add remaining ingredients.
Bake at 350°F for 25 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.39 - Cookies section
Also known as Magic Bars or Hello Dollies

recipes.title: Pumpkin Bars
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.39 - Cookies

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together and place in greased and floured pan.
Bake at 350°F for 15 min. Cool.
For Frosting: Mix all frosting ingredients together and spread on cookie bars.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.39 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Milk-Billy Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.39 - Cookies

instructions.text: Bring the first five ingredients to a boil.
Remove from heat and let cool.
Add flour, soda and salt.
Bake at 350°F for 18-20 min.
Frost.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.39 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Anise Snaps
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.39 - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs and beat well.
Add anise seeds, blend well.
Add dry ingredients sifted together and mix well.
Chill for several hours.
Roll to 1/8" thickness. Cut in desired shapes.
Bake at 350°F for 12-15 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.39 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Coconut-Oatmeal Crisp Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.39 - Cookies

instructions.text: Sift together flour, baking powder, soda.
Cream lard and sugars until light and fluffy.
Add oats and flour mixture; blend thoroughly.
Add coconut and nuts; mix well.
Roll dough into balls about size of walnuts.
Bake at 375°F for 10-15 min.
Yields 5 dozen.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.39 - Cookies section
GRANDMA'S HANDWRITING: 'Good'

recipes.title: Cinnamon Snowballs
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.40 - Cookies

instructions.text: Heat oven to 300°F.
Beat butter until creamy.
Sift together 3/4 cup of sugar, flour, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg; gradually add to butter; blend well.
Add oats, blend, add vanilla and nuts; mix about 1 min.
Shape into small balls.
Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 21 min.
Remove and while still hot sprinkle with or roll in remaining sugar.
Cool; then roll in sugar again.
Makes 3 dozen.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.40 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Fruit Squares
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.40 - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream together margarine, egg and vanilla with fork.
Add flour, salt and sugar. Mix until crumbly.
Put 1/2 of mixture into 8" square pan and pat down.
Pour in pie filling.
Add brown sugar to remaining mixture; pat down over filling.
Sprinkle with cinnamon.
Bake at 350°F for 45 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.40 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Hawaiian Drop Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.40 - Cookies

instructions.text: Sift together flour, baking powder and salt; set aside.
Cream shortening.
Add sugar and flavorings; beat until smooth.
Add egg, beat until mixture is fluffy.
Blend in pineapple, nuts and dry ingredients.
Drop by teaspoon, 3 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet.
Sprinkle with coconut.
Bake at 375°F for 20 min.
Makes 5 dozen.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.40 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Lemon Wafers
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.40 - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream sugar and shortening; add lemon rind, juice, eggs; beat well.
Add sifted dry ingredients.
Shape into 1 inch balls; put on cookie sheet.
Press flat with bottom of a glass which has been dipped in oil and then in sugar.
Bake at 350°F for 10-12 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.40 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Molasses Sugar Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.41 - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream together shortening and sugar.
Add molasses and egg; beat well.
Sift together flour, soda, cinnamon, cloves, ginger and salt; stir into sugar mixture.
Mix well; chill.
Form into 1" balls, roll in granulated sugar and place on greased cookie sheets.
Bake at 350°F for 8-10 min.
Makes 5 doz.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.41 - Cookies section
GRANDMA'S HANDWRITING: 'same as Crinkles'

recipes.title: No-Bake Chocolate Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.41 - Cookies

instructions.text: Mix cocoa and sugar. Melt butter.
Stir in milk, sugar and cocoa; mix and add salt.
Bring to a boil for 1 min, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat; stir in oats and mix well.
Stir one minute.
Drop by teaspoonfuls on waxed paper or foil (vanilla may be added).

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.41 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Good Oatmeal Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.41 - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream shortening; add sugar then eggs.
Mix dry ingredients and add; add raisins and nuts.
Add only enough milk to make STIFF dough.
Bake on greased pans at 350°F for 10-12 min.
Makes 6 dozen.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.41 - Cookies section
GRANDMA'S HANDWRITING: 'Ruthie's or Mom's'

recipes.title: Oatmeal-Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.41 - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream together margarine and brown sugar.
Add remaining ingredients.
Drop by teaspoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheet at 350°F for 10 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.41 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Everyday Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.42 - Cookies

instructions.text: Combine first seven ingredients.
Cream butter with sugars; beat in egg.
Gradually blend in dry ingredients, alternately with applesauce.
Stir in raisins, nuts and chocolate chips.
Drop by tablespoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets.
Bake at 375°F for 15 min.
Makes 5 dozen.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.42 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Peanut Blossom Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.42 - Cookies

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients except candy in large bowl.
Mix on low speed until dough forms.
Shape into balls, using a rounded teaspoonful for each.
Roll balls in sugar; place on ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake at 375°F for 10-12 min.
Top each cookie immediately with a candy kiss; press down firmly so cookie cracks around edge.
Makes about 4 dozen.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.42 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.42 - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream together sugars, shortening and peanut butter.
Add eggs.
Sift flour, soda and salt; add to first mixture and mix well.
Roll into balls and place on slightly greased baking sheet.
Flatten with fork.
Bake 10-12 min at 375°F.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.42 - Cookies section
GRANDMA'S HANDWRITING: 'more soda'

recipes.title: Refrigerator Christmas Cookie
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.42 - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream sugars and margarine.
Add eggs and beat.
Add cinnamon, cloves and flour a little at a time. Beat well after each.
Add soda and hot water; beat.
Add nuts.
Put batter on waxed paper and roll into logs, chill overnight.
Slice and bake on greased sheets at 350°F until lightly brown.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.42 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Sugar Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.43 - Cookies

instructions.text: Beat eggs; stir in oil, vanilla and sugar until mixture thickened.
Add flour, baking powder and salt.
Drop with teaspoon onto ungreased baking sheet.
Flatten with greased glass dipped in sugar.
Bake 8 min for soft or 10 min for crisp.
Remove immediately from baking sheet.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.43 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Toll House Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.43 - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream shortening; add sugars gradually.
Add eggs and hot water to creamed mixture, then sifted dry ingredients.
Add chocolate chips, oatmeal and vanilla and mix well.
Drop on greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 375°F for 15 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.43 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Unbaked Ball Cookies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.43 - Cookies

instructions.text: Mix dates, eggs and sugar and cook slowly about 5 min.
Cool a little, then add Rice Krispies, nuts and vanilla.
Form into small balls and roll in coconut flakes.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.43 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Santa's Whiskers
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.43 - Cookies

ingredients.item: finely chopped red and green candied cherries

instructions.text: Cream together butter and sugar.
Blend in milk and vanilla.
Stir in flour, candied cherries, and nuts.
Form into 2 rolls, 2 inches in diameter and 8 inches long.
Roll in coconut. Wrap and chill overnight.
Slice 1/4 inch thick.
Bake on ungreased cookie sheet at 375°F for 12 min.
Makes 5 dozen.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.43 - Cookies section

recipes.title: Butterscotch Crunchies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.44 - Candies

instructions.text: Melt morsels in double boiler.
Remove from heat; stir in noodles and peanuts.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper.
Let stand till firm, about 30 min.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.44 - Candies section

recipes.title: Date-Nut Roll
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.44 - Candies

instructions.text: Combine crackers, dates, walnuts, add marshmallows.
Mix with milk and work enough to form into roll.
Wrap each roll in plastic wrap.
Let set a day or more before using. Will keep a long time.
When ready to use, slice 1/4" thick.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.44 - Candies section

recipes.title: Fudge
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.44 - Candies

instructions.text: Beat first three ingredients over medium heat until soft-ball stage.
Remove from heat and beat by hand.
Add butter and vanilla; beat till about ready to set.
Pour into buttered pan.
Cut when slightly cool.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.44 - Candies section

recipes.title: Peanut Brittle
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.44 - Candies

instructions.text: Boil sugar, syrup and water together to 260°F.
Add butter and peanuts.
Boil to 300°F, stirring at intervals.
Remove from heat; add soda and 2 tsp vanilla.
Pour on well-buttered metal or formica sheet.
When quite cool, lift with spatula and stretch.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.44 - Candies section

recipes.title: Pecan Sandies
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.44 - Candies

instructions.text: Cream butter and add remaining ingredients; mix well.
Roll with hands until slender, about 3" long.
Bake at 350°F on ungreased cookie sheet 20 min.
Roll in confectioners sugar while still warm.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.44 - Candies section

recipes.title: Potato Candy
recipes.source_note: Specialties of the House cookbook, p.44 - Candies

instructions.text: Combine potato and sugar and beat well.
Add butter and coconut, cream together.
Spread in a buttered pan.
Melt chocolate and pour on top.

notes: From Specialties of the House cookbook, p.44 - Candies section
Old-fashioned confection using mashed potato

recipes.title: Cooking with Honey - Tips
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley

instructions.text: When measuring honey, moisten cup or spoon with oil or melted butter, or measure shortening before measuring honey.
To use honey in place of sugar substitute equal amount of honey, but reduce other liquid by 1/4 cup.

Cakes or cookies made with honey are improved in keeping qualities as honey tends to retard drying out, which is an important factor in baking in advance, also in sending cookies or other honey baked items to out-of-town friends or members of family.
It is well to lower baking temperature of oven about 25 degrees which prevents over-browning of honey baked goods.

notes: Household hints from My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook
GRANDMA'S HANDWRITING visible on this page

recipes.title: Honey Date Spice Cake
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes

instructions.text: Cream together shortening and sugar.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition.
Gradually add honey.
Stir in dates and orange rind.
Sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and spices.
Blend into creamed mixture with orange juice.
Bake in tube pan about 1 hour and fifteen minutes at 350°F. Cool.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes section

recipes.title: Honey Chocolate Cake
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes

instructions.text: Sift flour and measure, add soda and salt, and sift together three times.
Cream shortening; gradually add honey, beating well after each addition to keep mixture thick.
Add 3/4 of flour mixture and beat well smooth and well blended.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each.
Stir in chocolate and blend.
Add remaining flour alternately with water, beating very well after each addition.
Add vanilla.
Bake in two greased, 9" layer pans at 350°F for 30 minutes, or until done.
Frost and fill with Quick Creamed Frosting.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes section

recipes.title: Oatmeal Honey Cake
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes

instructions.text: Pour cup boiling water over oatmeal. Let stand 30 minutes, beat 1/2 minute.
Beat in eggs, melted oleo, honey, and sugar.
Add sifted cake flour, soda, salt and cinnamon.
Bake 30 minutes at 350°F in loaf pan.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes section

recipes.title: Old Fashion Apple Cake
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes

instructions.text: Mix well the apples, cider, honey, brown sugar, buttermilk, eggs and margarine.
Add the dry ingredients mixing well.
Bake in 350°F for 30 minutes.
Yields 3-8 layers.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes section
GRANDMA'S HANDWRITING: '1/2 it' (halve the recipe)

recipes.title: Honey Coffee Cake
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes

instructions.text: Sift dry ingredients into a bowl. Cut in shortening.
Add egg and milk, stirring only until all flour is moistened.
Spread batter in greased 9" square pan.
Cover with topping.
Bake in moderately hot oven (400°F) 25 to 30 minutes.
Serve warm. Yield: 9 to 12 servings.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes section

recipes.title: Honey Fruit Cake
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes

instructions.text: In large bowl, combine prepared fruits, nuts and mincemeat. Mix in 3 tablespoons flour well.
Combine boiling water and honey in a fine stream and mix into first mixture.
Stir together dry ingredients. Carefully fold into batter.
Pour into well-greased flour pan that has been greased and bottom lined with brown paper.
Bake at 300 degrees (slow) about 1-3/4 hours until cake tests done in center.
Remove from pan, cool on rack.
Decorate with red, green cherries and pineapple chunks.
Freezing improves this cake.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes section

recipes.title: Prune Cake (with Honey)
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes

instructions.text: Blend sugar, honey and oil, add eggs 1 at a time.
Add dry ingredients alternately with milk, add vanilla, mix and prunes.
Cook in tube pan lined with waxed paper, oven about 375 degrees, until it shrinks from sides of pan.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cakes section

recipes.title: Honey Cheese Pie
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies

ingredients.item: Juice and grated rind of 1/2 lemon

instructions.text: Cream cheese, combine honey, eggs, lemon, salt, and milk.
Add to cheese gradually.
Pour in unbaked pastry shell and sprinkle with nutmeg.
Bake at 450°F for ten minutes, reduce to 325°F for 30 minutes.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies section

recipes.title: Honey Raisin Pie
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies

instructions.text: Rinse and drain raisins.
Combine with orange rind and juice, lemon juice, honey, butter, salt, and cornstarch that has been moistened in the cold water; mix all well blended.
Bring to a boil and cook and stir until mixture thickens (about 3 or 4 minutes).
Pour into pastry-lined pie pan, cover with top crust.
Bake in a moderately hot oven (425°F) 30 to 35 minutes.
Cool before serving.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies section

recipes.title: Red Cherry Pie (with Honey)
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies

instructions.text: Drain cherries and set aside.
In saucepan, combine juice with salt and cornstarch. Add honey.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thickened and clear.
Add butter. Stir until melted.
Remove from heat and stir in cherries, almond extract and red food coloring if desired.
Adjust crust, dot with butter.
Bake in hot oven, 400 degrees, for 42 minutes.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies section

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pie (with Honey)
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies

instructions.text: Mix dry ingredients well to prevent streaking.
Add other ingredients; blend thoroughly.
Turn into pastry shell.
Bake 15 minutes at 425°F preheated oven.
Reduce to 350°F and bake 40 minutes longer.
Chill at least 4 hours before serving.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies section

recipes.title: Rhubarb and Peach Honey Cobbler
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies

instructions.text: Drain the rhubarb and peaches, reserving the juice. Combine juices with tapioca and bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Add honey. Remove from heat and combine with the fruit.
Pour into 2-quart baking dish.
Sift flour once, measure, add baking powder, sugar, salt and dry sifted. Cut in shortening. Add milk gradually stirring until soft dough is formed.
Turn out on lightly floured board and knead 10 seconds or enough to shape. Pat or roll dough to fit top of baking dish.
Cut several slits in center and adjust dough over fruit mixture, opening slits to permit escape of steam.
Bake in 400°F oven 30 minutes.
Serve hot or cold, with honey sweetened whipped cream.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies section

recipes.title: Honey Apple Pie
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies

instructions.text: Combine honey, flour, cinnamon and salt.
Spread 1/3 the mixture over pastry; add apples.
Sprinkle remainder of mixture over top of apples.
Sprinkle with lemon juice and dot with butter.
Add sifted top crust and seal edges.
Bake in 425°F oven, 30 to 40 minutes.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies section

recipes.title: Honey Apple Crisp
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies

instructions.text: Arrange apples in greased baking dish and sprinkle with lemon juice.
Spread honey over apples. Mix dry ingredients.
Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse bread crumbs.
Sprinkle over apples.
Bake at 375°F until apples are tender and crust is browned (about 30 minutes).
6 servings.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies section

recipes.title: Honey Pecan Pie
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies

instructions.text: Mix honey with well-beaten eggs.
Cream sugar, dry milk and butter. Add to honey-egg mixture.
Stir in pecans and vanilla.
Turn into an unbaked 9" crust and bake at 375°F for 1 hour.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Pies section

recipes.title: Crisp Honey Cookies
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream butter and honey. Sift together flour, soda, and spices and mix in wheat germ.
Combine dry ingredients with creamed mixture. Chill about one hour.
Roll on lightly floured board to about 1/8 inch thickness.
Cut with floured cookie cutter.
Bake on ungreased cookie sheets in 350°F oven, 8-10 minutes.
Cool on racks, then spread thinly with frosting.
Makes about 3 dozen.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies section

recipes.title: Honey Fruit Cookies
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream shortening and honey, add the egg, sour milk, and flour which has been sifted with soda and salt.
Add the nuts and fruit.
Drop on greased pans and bake at 350°F for 15 minutes.
(Memphis Beekeepers Assoc.)

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies section

recipes.title: Honey Raisin Cookies
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream shortening and honey thoroughly.
Add the eggs, beat until well mixed.
Sift together the flour, nutmeg, baking powder, soda and salt.
Add to the creamed mixture, stir until well mixed.
Add raisins and vanilla.
Drop batter by tablespoonfuls on a greased cooky sheet, 2 inches apart.
Bake at 350°F (moderate oven) for 12 minutes or until golden brown.
Makes 7 dozen cookies.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies section

recipes.title: Date Bars (with Honey)
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies

instructions.text: Re-sift flour with baking powder and salt.
Beat eggs until very light. Place in a large mixing bowl.
Gradually beat in honey. Add flour mixture to honey-egg mixture.
Add dates and nuts.
Spread in greased and floured 13 x 9 x 2 inch pan.
Bake at 350°F 35-45 minutes.
Cool thoroughly. Cut in bars.
Sprinkle lightly covered or freeze.
(California Honey Adv. Board) Yields about 5 dozen.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies section

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Drop Cookies (with Honey)
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies

ingredients.prep_note: chunk peanut butter may be used

instructions.text: Sift flour and baking soda and set aside.
Cream peanut butter, butter and vanilla.
Add honey and sugar, beating well after each addition. Then add 2 well-beaten eggs.
Mix well, then add the sifted flour.
Drop on cookie sheet and bake 375°F 10-12 minutes.
Cool. Check to see that they do not brown too fast on bottom.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies section

recipes.title: Butter Cookies (with Honey)
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream butter and gradually add honey.
Beat in egg yolk. Add lemon peel, flour, baking powder, and lemon juice.
Stir well. Chill dough.
Shape dough into small balls and arrange on greased cookie sheet.
Flatten with flat-bottomed glass.
Brush with lightly beaten egg whites.
Bake at 350°F for 10 to 15 minutes.
Makes 4 dozen.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies section

recipes.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies (with Honey)
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies

instructions.text: Cream honey and butter together; add egg and beat well.
Sift together dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture.
Blend well. Add vanilla, chocolate chips, and mix well.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 375°F for 12 to 15 minutes.
Makes 3 dozen.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Cookies section

recipes.title: Bread Pudding (with Honey)
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Puddings

instructions.text: Warm milk and honey together, pour over bread cubes, reserving some.
Place in two-quart battered casserole. Beat eggs slightly with salt; add to bread.
Sprinkle with honey mixture and vanilla. Sprinkle top with nutmeg.
Heat oven to 350 degrees (slow).
Bake 50 to 60 min until custard tests done near center. May be served warm or cold.
Makes 8 servings.
Hint: Cut recipe in half. Reduce baking time 15 minutes.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Puddings section

recipes.title: Rice Custard Pudding (with Honey)
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Puddings

instructions.text: In a two-quart oven-proof baking casserole, beat eggs slightly.
Add balance of ingredients. Sprinkle top of pudding with nutmeg.
Place casserole in a pan of hot water.
Heat oven to 350 degrees (moderate).
Bake 1 hour. Remove from oven and stir gently.
Cool 1/2 hour without additional stirring.
Serve warm or very cold. (10 servings)

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Puddings section

recipes.title: Honey Divinity
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Confections

instructions.text: In a two-quart saucepan, combine honey, sugar, water and salt.
Stir over low heat until sugar is dissolved. Continue cooking slowly, without stirring, to 265 degrees or candy (hard crack stage).
Meanwhile in a large mixer bowl, beat egg whites at high speed until very stiff.
Slowly pour on hot syrup, beating constantly at high speed until mixture loses its gloss and a small amount dropped from spoon holds its shape.
Add vanilla.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper.
Makes about 3-1/2 dozen pieces of Golden divinity.
Honey adds to the keeping quality of divinity.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Confections section

recipes.title: Velvety Fudge "Superb" (with Honey)
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley
recipes.source_note: My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Confections

instructions.text: In a medium-size heavy saucepan combine honey, sugar, salt and milk.
Bring to a full rolling boil over medium heat stirring constantly. Reduce heat. Boil and stir gently for 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
Add marshmallows and chocolate pieces. Beat until smooth and mixture starts to thicken (about 5 minutes).
Mix in walnuts and vanilla.
Pour into buttered 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan.
Cool in refrigerator before marking into squares.
Makes about 3 pounds of candy.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook - Confections section

recipes.title: Honey Orange Glaze for Ham
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley

instructions.text: Put orange juice, water, honey and salt in saucepan.
Blend cornstarch with 1/4 cup of the mixture and return to saucepan.
Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until it thickens and comes to a boil. Boil two or three minutes. Cool. Brush on ham.
Honey glaze does not tend to run off so do some other glazes.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook

recipes.title: Honey Baked Stuffed Apples
recipes.attribution: My Favorite Honey Recipes by Mrs. Ida Kelley

instructions.text: Cut up dates, add melted butter and 1/2 cup of the honey. Mix well and set aside.
Slice off top of 6 apples, remove core and stuff with the date mixture. Place in baking dish and drizzle 1 tablespoon of honey over each apple.
Pour 1/4 cup water into bottom of baking dish. Bake (oven 350-400 degrees) until apples are tender (about 40 minutes). Serve with honey sauce.

notes: From My Favorite Honey Recipes cookbook
